Pork chops with pan sauce.directions: Ingredients needed: 6 (5-6 oz) boneless pork chops, 1/4 cup (4 tbsp) butter, 2 cups chicken broth, 1 cup heavy cream, 4 cloves garlic, minced, 1/2 tsp (to taste) black pepper, 1/4 cup flour, 2 tablespoons olive oil. Season pork chops with salt, pepper, and garlic powder. Dredge lightly in flour. Heat oil in skillet over medium-high heat. Sear chops 4-5 minutes per side until golden and cooked through (145°F). Remove to plate. Add butter to pan, scrape up fond. Add broth and simmer 2 minutes. Stir in cream, simmer until thickened. Pour sauce over chops.

Beef and noodles.directions: Ingredients needed: 1.5 lbs beef chuck, cubed, 12 oz wide egg noodles, 3 cups beef broth, 1/4 cup (4 tbsp) butter, 1/4 cup flour, 1/2 tsp (to taste) black pepper, 5 cloves garlic, minced, 2 medium onions, diced. Season beef with salt, pepper, garlic and onion powder. Brown in butter in Dutch oven. Add broth, bring to boil, reduce heat and simmer covered 2 hours until tender. Cook noodles according to package. Make slurry with 2 tbsp flour and cold water, stir into broth to thicken. Serve beef and gravy over noodles.

Smothered pork chops.directions: Ingredients needed: 4 (8 oz) thick-cut pork chops, 1 cup flour, 3 cups chicken broth, 1 cup heavy cream, 3 tablespoons butter, 1/2 tsp (to taste) black pepper, 5 cloves garlic, minced, 1 large onion, diced. Season chops with salt, pepper, garlic and onion powder. Dredge in flour. Brown in butter 3-4 minutes per side. Remove. Add 2 tbsp flour to drippings, cook 1 minute. Whisk in broth, then cream. Return chops to pan, cover and simmer 30-40 minutes until tender. Serve with gravy.

ingredients: flank steak, sliced thin and cut into small pieces
Beef fried rice.directions:
Ingredients needed: 3 cups cooked jasmine rice (day-old, refrigerated), 8 oz flank steak, sliced thin and cut into small pieces, 3 tbsp vegetable oil, 2 large eggs, beaten, 1/2 cup frozen peas and carrots, 3 g reen onions, sliced, 3 cloves garlic, minced, 3 tbsp soy sauce, 1 tbsp oyster sauce, 1 tbsp sesame oil, 1/2 tsp white pepper, 1/2 tsp salt. 1. Season beef with pinch of salt and white pepper.
2. Heat 1 tbsp vegetable oil in large wok over high heat (450°F). Add beef, stir-fry for 2-3 minutes until browned. Remove and set aside.
3. Add another 1 tbsp oil to wok. Pour in beaten eggs, scramble for 30-45 seconds until just set. Remove and set aside.
4. Add remaining 1 tbsp oil. Add minced garlic, stir-fry for 15 seconds until fragrant.
5. Add peas and carrots, stir-fry for 2 minutes.
6. Add cold rice, breaking up clumps. Stir-fry for 3-4 minutes until heated through and slightly crispy.
7. Add soy sauce, oyster sauce, sesame oil, white pepper, and salt. Toss for 1 minute.
8. Return cooked beef and eggs to wok along with green onions. Toss for 30 seconds to combine.
9. Serve immediately while hot.

Chicken and rice casserole.directions: Ingredients needed: 4 bone-in chicken thighs, 1.5 cups uncooked long grain white rice, 1 can (10.5 oz) cream of chicken soup, 2 cups chicken broth, 3 tbsp butter, 1 tsp salt, 1/2 tsp black pepper, 1 tsp garlic powder, 1/2 tsp onion powder. 1. Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease a 9x13 inch baking dish. 2. In the baking dish, combine rice, cream of chicken soup, chicken broth, garlic powder, and onion powder. Stir until well mixed. 3. Season chicken thighs on both sides with salt and pepper. Place chicken skin-side up on top of rice mixture. 4. Cut butter into small pieces and dot over chicken and rice. 5. Cover dish tightly with aluminum foil. Bake for 60 minutes. 6. Remove foil and bake for additional 15-20 minutes until chicken reaches 165°F internal temperature, skin is golden brown, and rice is tender. 7. Let rest 5 minutes. Garnish with fresh parsley before serving.

Korean-style beef bowls.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 lb ground beef, 1/3 cup soy sauce, 1/4 cup packed brown sugar, 1 tablespoon sesame oil, 5 cloves garlic, minced, 1 teaspoon ground ginger, 1 cup jasmine rice, 1 tablespoon sesame seeds, 3 tablespoons sriracha, 4 large eggs. Brown beef. Add soy sauce, brown sugar, sesame oil, garlic, ginger. Cook 3 minutes. Serve over rice. Top with fried egg, sesame seeds, sriracha if desired.

Pork chop piccata.directions: Ingredients needed: 4 boneless pork chops, 1/2 inch thick, 1 cup flour, 1 tsp salt, 1/2 tsp black pepper, 4 tbsp olive oil, 6 tbsp butter, 4 cloves garlic, minced, 1 cup chicken broth, 1/2 cup dry white wine, 1/3 cup fresh lemon juice, 1/4 cup capers, drained, 1/4 cup fresh parsley, chopped, 1 lemon, juiced. 1. Pound pork chops to even 1/2 inch thickness. Season both sides with salt and pepper. Dredge in flour, shake off excess. 2. Heat oil in large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook pork chops 4-5 min per side until golden and internal temp reaches 145°F. Transfer to plate, tent with foil. 3. In same skillet, melt 2 tbsp butter over medium heat. Add garlic, cook 30 seconds until fragrant. 4. Add wine, scrape up browned bits. Simmer 2 min until reduced by half. Add chicken broth and lemon juice, bring to boil. Simmer 5 min until sauce reduces by one-third. 5. Add capers and remaining 4 tbsp butter, swirl pan until butter melts into sauce. Season with salt and pepper. 6. Return pork chops to pan, spoon sauce over. Simmer 2 min to heat through. Garnish with parsley and lemon slices. Serve over pasta or with vegetables.

Chicken marsala.directions: Ingredients needed: 2 lbs chicken breasts, 1 cup all-purpose flour, 1 tsp salt, 1/2 tsp black pepper, 1 tsp garlic powder, 4 tbsp olive oil, 4 tbsp butter, 16 oz mushrooms, sliced, 4 cloves garlic, minced, 1.5 cups Marsala wine, 1 cup chicken broth, 1 cup heavy cream, 2 tbsp fresh parsley, chopped. 1. Pound chicken breasts to even 1/2 inch thickness. Season with salt and pepper. Dredge in flour mixed with garlic powder, shake off excess. 2. Heat oil in large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook chicken 5-6 min per side until golden and cooked through (165°F internal temp). Transfer to plate, tent with foil. 3. In same skillet, melt butter over medium-high heat. Add mushrooms, cook 6-8 min without stirring initially to brown. Add garlic, cook 1 min. 4. Add Marsala wine, scraping up browned bits. Simmer 5 min until reduced by half. Add chicken broth, simmer 3 min. 5. Reduce heat to medium-low. Stir in heavy cream, simmer 5 min until sauce thickens enough to coat back of spoon. Season with salt and pepper. 6. Return chicken to pan, spoon sauce over. Simmer 2-3 min to heat through. Garnish with parsley. Serve over pasta or mashed potatoes.

City chicken.directions: Ingredients needed: 2 lbs pork shoulder, 1 lb veal cutlets, 1 cup flour, 6 eggs, 3/4 cup panko breadcrumbs, 1/2 tsp (to taste) black pepper, 1/4 cup vegetable oil, 1 lb wooden skewers. Thread pork and veal on skewers to look like drumsticks. Dredge in flour, egg, breadcrumbs. Brown in oil. Braise covered 45 minutes until tender. A Depression-era classic.

ingredients: small pasta (acini di pepe or orzo)
Italian wedding soup.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 lb ground beef or Italian sausage, 1 egg, 1/4 cup breadcrumbs, 1/4 cup grated Parmesan cheese, 2 cloves garlic, minced, 8 cups chicken broth, 1 cup small pasta (acini di pepe or orzo), 4 cups fresh spinach, chopped, 2 carrots, diced small, 2 celery stalks, diced small, 1 onion, diced. 1. Mix ground meat with egg, breadcrumbs, Parmesan, half the garlic, 1/2 tsp salt, 1/4 tsp pepper. Form into 1-inch meatballs. 2. In large pot, sauté onion, carrots, celery in 2 tbsp oil over medium heat for 5 min until softened. Add remaining garlic, cook 1 min. 3. Add broth, bring to boil. Gently drop in meatballs, reduce to simmer. Cook 10 min until meatballs are cooked through (165°F). 4. Add pasta, cook 8-10 min until tender. 5. Stir in spinach, cook 2 min until wilted. Season with salt and pepper. Garnish with parsley and Parmesan.

Sausage and rice casserole.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 lb Italian sausage (mild or spicy), 1.5 cups uncooked long grain white rice, 1 can (10.5 oz) cream of mushroom soup, 2.5 cups chicken broth, 1 medium onion, diced, 2 cloves garlic, minced, 1 cup frozen peas, 1 cup shredded mozzarella cheese, 1 tsp Italian seasoning, 1/2 tsp salt, 1/4 tsp black pepper, 2 tbsp olive oil. 1. Preheat oven to 375°F. Grease a 9x13 inch baking dish. 2. Heat olive oil in large skillet over medium-high heat. Remove sausage from casings and crumble into pan. Cook 6-8 minutes until browned. Remove sausage with slotted spoon. 3. In same skillet, sauté onion 4-5 minutes until softened. Add garlic and cook 1 minute more. 4. In baking dish, combine rice, cream of mushroom soup, chicken broth, Italian seasoning, salt, and pepper. Stir in cooked sausage, onion mixture, and frozen peas. 5. Cover tightly with foil. Bake 50-60 minutes until rice is tender. 6. Remove foil, top with mozzarella cheese. Bake uncovered 10 minutes until cheese is melted and bubbly. Let rest 5 minutes before serving.

Chicken noodle soup.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 whole chicken (3-4 lbs), 12 cups water, 3 carrots (sliced), 3 celery stalks (sliced), 1 large onion (diced), 4 cloves garlic (minced), 2 bay leaves, 1 tsp thyme, 8 oz egg noodles, 1/4 cup fresh parsley (chopped). 1. Place chicken in large pot with water, bring to boil. 2. Reduce heat, simmer 1 hour skimming foam from surface. 3. Remove chicken, let cool, shred meat discarding bones and skin. 4. Strain broth, return to pot. 5. Add carrots, celery, onion, garlic, bay leaves, and thyme to broth. 6. Simmer 20 min until vegetables are tender. 7. Add egg noodles, cook 8-10 min until tender. 8. Return shredded chicken to pot. 9. Season with salt and pepper. 10. Stir in parsley and serve hot.

Sausage and peppers.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 lb Italian sausage, 2 bell peppers, sliced, 2 cups marinara sauce, 2 tablespoons olive oil, 4 cloves garlic, minced, 1 tablespoon Italian seasoning, 8 oz hoagie rolls. Brown sausages in oil. Remove, slice. Sauté peppers and garlic. Return sausage, add marinara and Italian seasoning. Simmer 20 minutes. Serve on hoagie rolls.

Breaded pork cutlets (schnitzel-style).directions: Ingredients needed: 4 boneless pork chops (6 oz each), 1 cup all-purpose flour, 2 eggs, beaten with 1 tbsp water, 2 cups panko breadcrumbs, 1/4 cup butter, 1/4 cup vegetable oil, 1/2 tsp (to taste) black pepper, 1 lemon, juiced. 1. Pound pork chops between plastic wrap to 1/4-inch thickness. Season with salt and pepper. 2. Set up breading station: flour in shallow dish, beaten eggs in second dish, panko in third dish. 3. Coat each cutlet in flour, shake off excess. Dip in egg, let drip. Press into panko, coating completely. 4. Heat butter and oil in large skillet over medium-high heat. 5. Fry cutlets 3-4 min per side until golden and cooked through (145°F internal temp). 6. Drain on paper towels. Serve with lemon wedges.

Sausage stroganoff.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 lb Italian sausage, 12 oz wide egg noodles, 4 cups beef broth, 1/2 cup sour cream, 1/4 cup (4 tbsp) butter, 1 cup flour, 1 tablespoon Worcestershire sauce. Brown sliced sausage. Add flour, cook 1 minute. Add broth and Worcestershire, simmer 10 minutes. Cook noodles. Off heat, stir in sour cream. Serve over noodles.

Pork chop casserole.directions: Ingredients needed: 6 bone-in pork chops (1 inch thick), 1 can (10.5 oz) cream of mushroom soup, 1 can (10.5 oz) cream of chicken soup, 1 cup sour cream, 1 cup chicken broth, 1 medium onion, sliced thin, 2 cups uncooked egg noodles, 2 tbsp butter, 1 tsp garlic powder, 1 tsp paprika, 1 tsp salt, 1/2 tsp black pepper. 1. Preheat oven to 350°F. 2. Season pork chops on both sides with salt, pepper, garlic powder, and paprika. 3. Heat butter in large oven-safe skillet over medium-high heat. Brown pork chops 3-4 minutes per side. Remove and set aside. 4. In same skillet, sauté onion 3-4 minutes. Remove from heat. 5. In bowl, whisk together both soups, sour cream, and chicken broth. Stir in uncooked egg noodles. 6. Pour mixture into skillet with onions. Nestle browned pork chops into noodle mixture. 7. Cover tightly with foil. Bake 45 minutes. 8. Remove foil and bake 10-15 minutes more until pork reaches 145°F and noodles are tender. Let rest 5 minutes. Garnish with parsley.

ingredients: (15 oz each) white beans (cannellini or great northern), drained and rinsed
Sausage and white bean soup.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 lb Italian sausage, casings removed, 2 cans (15 oz each) white beans (cannellini or great northern), drained and rinsed, 6 cups chicken broth, 1 onion, diced, 3 carrots, diced, 3 celery stalks, diced, 4 cloves garlic, minced, 1 can (14.5 oz) diced tomatoes, 2 cups kale or spinach, chopped, 1 tsp Italian seasoning, 1/2 tsp red pepper flakes. 1. In large pot, brown sausage over medium-high heat, breaking into crumbles, 6-8 min. Remove with slotted spoon, set aside. 2. In same pot, sauté onion, carrots, celery in drippings for 5 min. Add garlic, cook 1 min. 3. Add broth, tomatoes, Italian seasoning, red pepper flakes. Bring to boil, reduce to simmer. Cook 15 min until vegetables are tender. 4. Add beans and sausage, simmer 10 min. 5. Stir in kale, cook 3-5 min until wilted. Season with salt and pepper. Serve with grated Parmesan.

Breaded chicken parmesan.directions: Ingredients needed: 3 large chicken breasts (2 lbs), 1 cup all-purpose flour, 6 eggs, 2 cups Italian breadcrumbs, 1 cup Parmesan cheese, grated, 2 tsp Italian seasoning, 1 tsp garlic powder, 1.5 cups Salt and pepper to taste, 1/2 cup olive oil, 2 cups marinara sauce, 8 oz mozzarella cheese, shredded, 1/4 cup fresh basil, chopped. 1. Preheat oven to 425°F. Pound chicken breasts to even 1/2 inch thickness between plastic wrap. Season both sides with salt and pepper. 2. Set up breading station: flour in shallow dish, beaten eggs in second dish, breadcrumbs mixed with 1/2 cup Parmesan, Italian seasoning, and garlic powder in third dish. 3. Dredge each chicken breast in flour, shake off excess. Dip in egg, let excess drip. Press into breadcrumb mixture, coating both sides. 4. Heat oil in large skillet over medium-high heat. Fry chicken 3-4 min per side until golden brown and internal temp reaches 165°F. Transfer to paper towels. 5. Spread 1 cup marinara in 9x13 baking dish. Place chicken on top. Spoon remaining sauce over chicken. Top each breast with mozzarella and remaining Parmesan. 6. Bake 15 min until cheese is melted and bubbly. Garnish with basil. Serve over spaghetti or with crusty bread.

Ground beef and rice soup.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 lb ground beef, 1 cup long grain white rice, uncooked, 8 cups beef broth, 1 can (14.5 oz) diced tomatoes, 1 onion, diced, 2 carrots, diced, 2 celery stalks, diced, 3 cloves garlic, minced, 1 tsp Worcestershire sauce, 1 bay leaf, 1 tsp paprika. 1. In large pot, brown ground beef over medium-high heat, breaking into crumbles, 6-8 min. Drain excess fat. 2. Add onion, carrots, celery. Cook 5 min until softened. Add garlic, cook 1 min. 3. Add broth, tomatoes, Worcestershire, bay leaf, paprika, 1 tsp salt, 1/2 tsp pepper. Bring to boil. 4. Add rice, reduce to simmer. Cook covered 20-25 min until rice is tender. 5. Remove bay leaf. Season with salt and pepper. Garnish with parsley.

Baked sausage and noodles.directions: Ingredients needed: 8 oz medium egg noodles, 1 lb Italian sausage, 2 cups marinara sauce, 1.5 cups shredded cheese, 8 oz shredded cheese, 1 tablespoon Italian seasoning. Cook noodles. Brown crumbled sausage. Mix noodles, sausage, marinara, ricotta. Transfer to baking dish. Top with mozzarella. Bake at 375°F 25 minutes until bubbly.

Hunter's chicken.directions: Ingredients needed: 3 large chicken breasts (2 lbs), 1/2 lb bacon, 1/2 cup BBQ sauce, 1.5 cups shredded cheese, 2 tablespoons vegetable oil, 1 lb 1, sliced pepper. Season chicken with salt and pepper. Sear in hot pan until golden. Wrap with bacon, top with BBQ sauce and cheese. Bake at 400°F for 25 minutes until chicken is cooked through and cheese is melted.

ingredients: boneless, skinless chicken breasts (about 6 oz each)
Vegetable oil for frying (about 1 inch deep)
For gravy: 1/4 cup pan drippings, 1/4 cup flour, 2 cups milk, salt and pepper to taste
Chicken fried chicken.directions:
Ingredients needed: 4 boneless, skinless chicken breasts (about 6 oz each), 2 cups all-purpose flour, 2 tsp paprika, 2 tsp garlic powder, 1 tsp onion powder, 2 tsp salt, 1 tsp black pepper, 1/2 tsp cayenne pepper, 2 large eggs, 1 cup buttermilk. 1. Place 4 chicken breasts between plastic wrap and pound to 1/2-inch thickness with a meat mallet.
2. In a shallow dish, mix 2 cups flour, 2 tsp paprika, 2 tsp garlic powder, 1 tsp onion powder, 2 tsp salt, 1 tsp black pepper, and 1/2 tsp cayenne.
3. In another dish, whisk 2 eggs and 1 cup buttermilk.
4. Season chicken with salt and pepper. Dredge in flour, dip in egg mixture, then dredge in flour again.
5. Heat 1 inch of oil in a large skillet to 350°F over medium-high heat.
6. Fry chicken 2 pieces at a time, 5-6 minutes per side, until golden brown and internal temperature reaches 165°F.
7. Transfer to a wire rack. Keep warm in a 200°F oven while making gravy.
8. For gravy: Pour off all but 1/4 cup oil. Whisk in 1/4 cup flour, cook 2 minutes. Gradually whisk in 2 cups milk.
9. Simmer 5-7 minutes until thickened. Season with salt and pepper. Serve over chicken.

Loaded mashed potatoes.directions: Ingredients needed: 3 lbs russet potatoes, peeled and cubed, 1 cup sour cream, 1/2 cup butter, 1/2 cup milk (warmed), 8 oz cream cheese, softened, 2 cups shredded cheddar cheese, 6 strips bacon, cooked and crumbled, 4 g reen onions, sliced, 1 tsp salt, 1/2 tsp black pepper, 1/2 tsp garlic powder. 1. Place cubed potatoes in large pot, cover with cold salted water. Bring to boil over high heat. 2. Reduce heat to medium and simmer 15-20 minutes until potatoes are fork-tender. Drain well. 3. Return potatoes to pot. Add butter and let melt 1 minute. 4. Mash potatoes until smooth. Add cream cheese and mix until fully incorporated. 5. Stir in warm milk, sour cream, 1.5 cups cheddar cheese, salt, pepper, and garlic powder. Mix until creamy. 6. Fold in half of the bacon and half of the green onions. 7. Transfer to serving dish. Top with remaining cheddar cheese, bacon, and green onions. Serve immediately while hot.

ingredients: medium russet potatoes (about 3 lbs), peeled and cubed
Potato soup.directions: Ingredients needed: 6 medium russet potatoes (about 3 lbs), peeled and cubed, 6 cups chicken broth, 1 onion, diced, 3 cloves garlic, minced, 1 cup heavy cream, 1/2 cup butter, 1/2 cup all-purpose flour, 1 1/2 tsp salt, 1/2 tsp black pepper, 1 cup shredded cheddar cheese, 6 slices bacon, cooked and crumbled. 1. In large pot, combine potatoes, broth, onion, garlic. Bring to boil, reduce to simmer. Cook 15-20 min until potatoes are fork-tender. 2. Use potato masher to mash some potatoes, leaving some chunks. 3. In separate pan, melt butter over medium heat. Whisk in flour, cook 2 min. Gradually whisk in cream until smooth. 4. Add cream mixture to soup, stir well. Simmer 5 min until thickened. 5. Stir in cheese until melted. Season with salt and pepper. Top with bacon, green onions, and sour cream.

Fried potatoes and sausage skillet.directions: Ingredients needed: 2 lbs Yukon gold potatoes, diced, 1 lb smoked sausage, sliced, 4 tablespoons butter, 4 cloves garlic, minced, 2 teaspoons paprika, 1/2 tsp (to taste) black pepper. Dice potatoes small. Remove sausage from casing, crumble. Cook sausage until browned, remove. Add butter, fry potatoes until crispy golden. Season with garlic powder, paprika, salt, pepper. Return sausage, toss.

Buttered noodles.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 lb egg noodles, 3 tablespoons butter, 1/2 cup grated parmesan cheese, 1/2 tsp (to taste) black pepper. Cook noodles according to package in salted water. Drain, reserving 1/2 cup pasta water. Return to pot, add butter and toss until melted. Add parmesan and toss, adding pasta water as needed for silky coating. Season with salt and pepper.

Potato and sausage casserole.directions: Ingredients needed: 2 lbs russet potatoes, sliced 1/4 inch thick, 1 lb smoked sausage (kielbasa), sliced, 1 medium onion, diced, 1 can (10.5 oz) cream of mushroom soup, 1 cup sour cream, 2 cups shredded cheddar cheese, 1/2 cup milk, 3 tbsp butter, 1 tsp garlic powder, 1 tsp paprika, 1/2 tsp salt, 1/2 tsp black pepper. 1. Preheat oven to 375°F. Grease a 9x13 inch baking dish. 2. In large skillet over medium heat, cook sausage 5-6 minutes until browned. Add onion and cook 3-4 minutes more. Set aside. 3. In bowl, whisk together cream of mushroom soup, sour cream, milk, garlic powder, paprika, salt, and pepper. 4. Layer half the sliced potatoes in baking dish. Top with half the sausage mixture and half the soup mixture. Sprinkle with 1 cup cheese. 5. Repeat layers with remaining potatoes, sausage, soup mixture, and cheese. Dot top with butter pieces. 6. Cover with foil. Bake 60 minutes. 7. Remove foil and bake 15-20 minutes more until potatoes are tender and top is golden brown. Let rest 10 minutes. Garnish with chives.

Cheesy rice.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 cup jasmine rice, 1.5 cups shredded cheese, 3 tablespoons butter, 4 cups chicken broth. Cook rice in chicken broth. When done, stir in butter and shredded cheddar until melted and creamy. Season with salt.

ingredients: Optional: 8 oz cooked protein (chicken, pork, beef, or shrimp), diced
Fried rice (plain or with meat).directions:
Ingredients needed: 3 cups cooked jasmine rice (day-old, refrigerated), 3 tbsp vegetable oil, 2 large eggs, beaten, 1/2 cup frozen peas and carrots, 3 g reen onions, sliced, 3 tbsp soy sauce, 1 tbsp sesame oil, 1/2 tsp white pepper, 1/2 tsp salt. 1. Heat 1 tbsp vegetable oil in large wok or skillet over high heat (about 450°F).
2. Pour in beaten eggs and scramble for 30-45 seconds until just set. Remove and set aside.
3. Add remaining 2 tbsp oil to wok. Add peas and carrots, stir-fry for 2 minutes.
4. Add cold rice, breaking up clumps with spatula. Stir-fry for 3-4 minutes until rice is heated through and slightly crispy.
5. If using protein, add it now and stir-fry for 1 minute to heat through.
6. Add soy sauce, sesame oil, white pepper, and salt. Toss for 1 minute to combine.
7. Return scrambled eggs to wok along with green onions. Toss for 30 seconds.
8. Serve immediately while hot.

Pasta with meat sauce.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 lb spaghetti, 2 tbsp olive oil, 1 lb ground beef, 1/2 lb Italian sausage, casings removed, 1 large onion, diced, 4 cloves garlic, minced, 28 oz crushed tomatoes, 6 oz tomato paste, 1 cup beef broth, 2 tsp dried oregano, 2 tsp dried basil, 3 bay leaves, 1 tsp salt, 1/2 tsp black pepper, 2 teaspoons dried basil. 1. Heat oil in large pot over medium-high heat. Add beef and sausage, cook 8-10 min, breaking up meat, until browned. Add onion, cook 5 min until softened. Add garlic, cook 1 min. 2. Add tomato paste, cook 2 min, stirring, until paste darkens. Add beef broth, scrape up browned bits. 3. Add crushed tomatoes, oregano, basil, bay leaf, salt, pepper. Bring to boil, reduce to low simmer. Cook partially covered 30-35 min, stirring occasionally, until sauce thickens. Add water if too thick. 4. Remove bay leaf. Taste and adjust seasoning. Keep warm on low heat. 5. Cook spaghetti in salted boiling water until al dente. Reserve 1 cup pasta water before draining. 6. Add pasta to sauce, toss to coat. Add pasta water if needed to loosen sauce. Serve topped with Parmesan and fresh basil.

Scalloped potatoes with pork chops.directions: Ingredients needed: 4 (8 oz) thick-cut pork chops, 2 lbs Yukon gold potatoes, diced, 1.5 cups shredded cheese, 3/4 cup heavy cream, 3 tablespoons butter, 1/2 cup all-purpose flour, 1/2 tsp (to taste) black pepper, 6 cloves garlic, minced. Season and brown pork chops. Slice potatoes thin. Make cream sauce with butter, flour, cream. Layer potatoes in dish with cheese and cream sauce. Top with pork chops. Cover, bake at 350°F 1 hour.

ingredients: large russet potatoes, peeled and grated
Potato pancakes.directions: Ingredients needed: 4 large russet potatoes, peeled and grated, 1 s mall onion, grated, 2 eggs, beaten, 1/4 cup all-purpose flour, 1 tsp salt, 1/2 tsp black pepper, 1/4 cup vegetable oil for frying, 1/2 cup sour cream, 1/2 cup applesauce. 1. Place grated potatoes and onion in clean towel, squeeze out as much moisture as possible. 2. Transfer to bowl, add eggs, flour, salt, pepper. Mix well. 3. Heat 2 tbsp oil in large skillet over medium-high heat. 4. Drop 1/4 cup potato mixture per pancake, flatten with spatula. 5. Fry 4-5 min per side until golden brown and crispy. Don't overcrowd pan. 6. Drain on paper towels, add more oil as needed. Serve hot with sour cream, applesauce, and chives.

Baked potato bar.directions: Ingredients needed: 2 lbs Yukon gold potatoes, diced, 1/4 cup (4 tbsp) butter, 1/2 cup sour cream, 8 oz shredded cheese, 8 slices thick-cut bacon, 2 tablespoons chopped fresh chives, 1/2 tsp (to taste) black pepper. Bake potatoes at 400°F 1 hour. Split open, fluff with fork, season with salt and pepper. Set up toppings: butter, sour cream, cheese, bacon bits, chives. Let everyone build their own.

ingredients: (10.5 oz) can cream of mushroom soup
Pork chop and potato bake.directions: Ingredients needed: 4 (6-8 oz each) bone-in pork chops, 2 lbs Yukon gold potatoes, diced, 1 (10.5 oz) can cream of mushroom soup, 1 cup milk, 2 cups shredded cheddar cheese, 1/2 tsp (to taste) black pepper, 5 cloves garlic, minced. Season pork chops. Slice potatoes thin. Mix soup with milk. Layer in dish: potatoes, soup, cheese. Top with pork chops. Season chops with garlic powder. Cover. Bake at 350°F 1 hour. Uncover last 15 minutes.

Egg noodles with brown butter.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 lb egg noodles, 6 tbsp butter, 2 cloves garlic, minced, 1/4 cup grated parmesan cheese, 2 tbsp fresh parsley, chopped, 1/2 tsp black pepper, 1/4 tsp nutmeg. 1. Cook egg noodles in salted boiling water according to package directions, usually 6-8 min. Drain, reserve 1/2 cup pasta water. 2. In large skillet, melt butter over medium heat. Continue cooking, swirling pan, until butter turns golden brown and smells nutty, 4-5 min. Watch carefully to avoid burning. 3. Add garlic, cook 30 sec. 4. Add cooked noodles to skillet, toss to coat. Add pasta water as needed for sauce. 5. Toss with parmesan, parsley, pepper, nutmeg. Season with salt. Top with fried egg if desired.

Sausage gravy over rice.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 lb smoked sausage, sliced, 1/4 cup flour, 2 cups whole milk, 1.5 cups long-grain white rice, 1/2 tsp (to taste) black pepper. Brown sausage, crumble. Add 3 tbsp flour, cook 1 minute. Slowly add 2.5 cups milk, stirring. Simmer until thickened. Season generously with pepper. Serve over cooked rice.

ingredients: Vegetable oil for frying (about 2 inches deep)
Fried chicken tenders.directions:
Ingredients needed: 2 lbs chicken tenderloins, 2 cups all-purpose flour, 2 tsp paprika, 2 tsp garlic powder, 1 tsp onion powder, 2 tsp salt, 1 tsp black pepper, 1/2 tsp cayenne pepper, 3 large eggs, 1/4 cup milk, 2 cups panko breadcrumbs. 1. Set up breading station: Dish 1 - mix 2 cups flour, 2 tsp paprika, 2 tsp garlic powder, 1 tsp onion powder, 2 tsp salt, 1 tsp black pepper, 1/2 tsp cayenne. Dish 2 - whisk 3 eggs and 1/4 cup milk. Dish 3 - 2 cups panko.
2. Pat 2 lbs chicken tenderloins dry. Season with salt and pepper.
3. Dredge each tender in flour, dip in egg, coat in panko, pressing to adhere.
4. Heat 2 inches oil in a heavy pot to 350°F over medium-high heat.
5. Fry 4-5 tenders at a time, 3-4 minutes per side until golden and internal temperature reaches 165°F.
6. Transfer to wire rack. Let oil return to 350°F between batches.
7. Keep finished tenders warm in 200°F oven. Serve hot with dipping sauces.

Ground beef and potato hash.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 lb ground beef, 4 medium potatoes, diced small, 1 onion, diced, 1 bell pepper, diced, 3 cloves garlic, minced, 2 tbsp vegetable oil, 1 tsp paprika, 1/2 tsp cumin, 4 eggs. 1. Heat 1 tbsp oil in large cast iron skillet over medium-high heat. Add potatoes, season with salt. Cook 8-10 min, stirring occasionally, until golden and tender. Remove to plate. 2. Add remaining oil, brown ground beef 5-6 min, breaking into crumbles. Drain excess fat. 3. Add onion, bell pepper, cook 4 min. Add garlic, paprika, cumin, salt, pepper. Cook 1 min. 4. Return potatoes to skillet, mix well. Make 4 wells, crack eggs into wells. 5. Cover, cook 4-6 min until eggs reach desired doneness. Garnish with parsley, serve with hot sauce.

Chicken and dumplings (no veg).directions: Ingredients needed: 6 (5-6 oz) bone-in chicken thighs, 1/4 cup flour, 1 tablespoon baking powder, 4 tablespoons butter, 1.5 cups milk, 2 cups chicken broth, 1/2 tsp (to taste) black pepper, 4 cloves garlic, minced. Simmer chicken in broth 25 minutes until cooked. Remove and shred. Mix 2 cups flour, 1 tbsp baking powder, 1 tsp salt. Cut in 4 tbsp cold butter. Stir in 3/4 cup milk. Drop dumplings into simmering broth. Cover, cook 15 minutes. Return chicken.

ingredients: For gravy: 2 tbsp butter, 8 oz mushrooms (sliced), 1 medium onion (sliced), 2 cloves garlic (minced), 2 tbsp flour, 2 cups beef broth, 1 tbsp Worcestershire sauce, 1 tsp Dijon mustard, salt and pepper to taste
Salisbury steak.directions:
Ingredients needed: 1 1/2 lbs ground beef (80/20), 1/3 cup breadcrumbs, 1 large egg, 2 tsp Worcestershire sauce, 1 tsp garlic powder, 1 tsp onion powder, 1 tsp salt, 1/2 tsp black pepper. 1. In a large bowl, combine 1 1/2 lbs ground beef, 1/3 cup breadcrumbs, 1 egg, 2 tsp Worcestershire sauce, 1 tsp garlic powder, 1 tsp onion powder, 1 tsp salt, and 1/2 tsp black pepper. Mix gently until just combined.
2. Divide into 4 equal portions and shape into oval patties about 1/2-inch thick.
3. Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add patties and cook 4-5 minutes per side until browned and cooked through (160°F). Remove to a plate.
4. In the same skillet, melt 2 tbsp butter over medium heat. Add 8 oz sliced mushrooms and 1 sliced onion. Cook 6-7 minutes until softened and golden.
5. Add 2 cloves minced garlic and cook 1 minute.
6. Sprinkle 2 tbsp flour over mushroom mixture and stir for 1-2 minutes.
7. Gradually add 2 cups beef broth, stirring constantly. Add 1 tbsp Worcestershire sauce and 1 tsp Dijon mustard.
8. Bring to a simmer and cook 3-4 minutes until gravy thickens. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
9. Return patties to skillet, spooning gravy over them. Simmer 2-3 minutes to heat through.
10. Serve hot over mashed potatoes or egg noodles with gravy.

Twice-baked potatoes.directions: Ingredients needed: 6 large russet potatoes, 1/2 cup butter, softened, 1 cup sour cream, 1 cup milk, 2 cups shredded cheddar cheese, 6 strips bacon, cooked and crumbled, 4 g reen onions, sliced, 1 tsp salt, 1/2 tsp black pepper, 1/2 tsp garlic powder. 1. Preheat oven to 400°F. Pierce potatoes several times with fork. Bake directly on oven rack 60-75 minutes until tender when squeezed. 2. Let potatoes cool 10 minutes until safe to handle. Cut each potato in half lengthwise. 3. Scoop out potato flesh into large bowl, leaving 1/4 inch shell. Reserve shells. 4. Mash potato flesh with butter until smooth. Mix in sour cream, milk, 1.5 cups cheese, half the bacon, half the green onions, salt, pepper, and garlic powder. 5. Reduce oven to 375°F. Spoon potato mixture back into shells, mounding high. Place on baking sheet. 6. Top with remaining cheese and bacon. Bake 20-25 minutes until heated through and cheese is melted and bubbly. 7. Broil 2-3 minutes for extra crispy tops. Garnish with remaining green onions.

Sausage and potato soup.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 lb smoked sausage or kielbasa, sliced, 6 medium potatoes, peeled and cubed, 6 cups chicken broth, 1 onion, diced, 3 cloves garlic, minced, 2 cups kale or spinach, chopped, 1 cup heavy cream, 1 tsp smoked paprika, 1/2 tsp dried thyme. 1. In large pot, brown sliced sausage over medium-high heat, 5-6 min. Remove and set aside. 2. In same pot, sauté onion in drippings for 4 min. Add garlic, cook 1 min. 3. Add broth, potatoes, paprika, thyme. Bring to boil, reduce to simmer. Cook 15-20 min until potatoes are tender. 4. Use potato masher to lightly mash some potatoes for thickness. 5. Add sausage back to pot. Stir in cream and kale. Simmer 5 min until kale is wilted. Season with salt, pepper, and red pepper flakes if desired.

ingredients: For glaze: 1/2 cup ketchup, 2 tbsp brown sugar, 1 tbsp mustard
Meatloaf.directions:
Ingredients needed: 2 lbs ground beef (80/20), 1 cup breadcrumbs, 1/2 cup milk, 2 large eggs, 1 medium onion, finely diced (1 cup), 2 cloves garlic, minced, 1/4 cup ketchup, 2 tbsp Worcestershire sauce, 1 tsp dried parsley, 1 tsp salt, 1/2 tsp black pepper. 1. Preheat oven to 350°F. Line a rimmed baking sheet with parchment paper or lightly grease a 9x5 inch loaf pan.
2. In a small bowl, combine 1 cup breadcrumbs and 1/2 cup milk. Let soak 5 minutes.
3. In a large bowl, combine 2 lbs ground beef, soaked breadcrumbs, 2 eggs, 1 cup diced onion, 2 cloves minced garlic, 1/4 cup ketchup, 2 tbsp Worcestershire sauce, 1 tsp parsley, 1 tsp salt, and 1/2 tsp black pepper.
4. Mix gently with hands until just combined (don't overmix).
5. Shape into a 9x5 inch loaf on the baking sheet (or press into loaf pan).
6. In a small bowl, whisk together 1/2 cup ketchup, 2 tbsp brown sugar, and 1 tbsp mustard. Spread half the glaze over the top of the meatloaf.
7. Bake at 350°F for 45 minutes. Remove from oven and spread remaining glaze on top.
8. Return to oven and bake 15-20 minutes more until internal temperature reaches 160°F.
9. Let rest 10 minutes before slicing.

Porcupine meatballs.directions: Ingredients needed: 1.5 lbs ground beef (80/20), 1.5 cups long-grain white rice, 4 large tomatoes, diced, 6 cups beef broth, 3 tablespoons Worcestershire sauce, 1/2 tsp (to taste) black pepper, 1 medium yellow onion, chopped. Mix beef with uncooked rice, salt, pepper, onion powder. Form into balls. Place in baking dish. Mix soup, broth, Worcestershire. Pour over meatballs. Cover. Bake at 350°F 1 hour until rice is tender.

Creamy chicken and rice.directions: Ingredients needed: 4 (6-8 oz) boneless chicken breasts, 1.5 cups long-grain white rice, 1 can (10.5 oz) cream of chicken soup, 4 cups chicken broth, 1/2 cup sour cream, 5 cloves garlic, minced, 1/2 tsp (to taste) black pepper. Season and brown chicken. Remove. Add rice, soup, broth, garlic powder. Place chicken on top. Cover, simmer 25 minutes until rice is tender and chicken is cooked. Stir in sour cream. Season.

Potato skins.directions: Ingredients needed: 2 lbs Yukon gold potatoes, diced, 8 oz shredded cheese, 6 slices bacon, 1/2 cup sour cream, 1/4 cup (4 tbsp) butter. Bake potatoes until tender. Halve, scoop out most of flesh (save for other use). Brush with butter, season with salt. Bake at 450°F 15 minutes until crispy. Fill with cheese and bacon. Bake until cheese melts. Serve with sour cream.

Spaghetti and meatballs.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 lb ground beef, 1/2 lb ground pork, 1/2 lb ground veal, 1 cup breadcrumbs, 1/2 cup milk, 3 large eggs, 1/2 cup Parmesan, grated, 4 cloves garlic, minced, 1/4 cup fresh parsley, chopped, 2 tsp Italian seasoning, 1.5 tsp salt, 1 tsp black pepper, 4 cups marinara sauce, 1 lb spaghetti, 1 teaspoon dried basil. 1. Preheat oven to 400°F. Line baking sheet with parchment. In small bowl, soak breadcrumbs in milk 5 min. 2. In large bowl, combine beef, pork, veal, soaked breadcrumbs, eggs, Parmesan, garlic, parsley, Italian seasoning, salt, pepper. Mix gently with hands until just combined. 3. Form into 20-24 meatballs, about 2 inches each. Place on baking sheet. Bake 20-22 min until browned and cooked through (internal temp 160°F). 4. Heat marinara in large pot over medium heat. Add baked meatballs, simmer gently 20 min to meld flavors. 5. Cook spaghetti in salted boiling water until al dente. Reserve 1 cup pasta water before draining. 6. Toss pasta with some sauce, adding pasta water if needed. Serve pasta topped with meatballs, more sauce, Parmesan, and fresh basil.

French onion-style pork chops.directions: Ingredients needed: 4 (8 oz) thick-cut pork chops, 2 medium onions, diced, 4 cups beef broth, 1.5 cups shredded cheese, 4 tablespoons butter, 2 teaspoons fresh thyme, 1/2 tsp (to taste) black pepper. Caramelize onions. Brown pork chops. Top with onions and broth. Cover, simmer 20 minutes. Uncover, top with Gruyère. Broil until cheese bubbles and browns.

Hamburger helper style.directions:
Ingredients needed: 1 lb ground beef, 8 oz egg noodles or macaroni, 1 can (10.5 oz) cream of mushroom soup, 1 1/2 cups milk, 1/2 cup water, 2 cups shredded cheddar cheese, 1 tsp garlic powder, 1 tsp onion powder, 1/2 tsp paprika, 1 tsp salt, 1/2 tsp black pepper. 1. Brown 1 lb ground beef in a large skillet over medium-high heat (about 8-10 minutes), breaking it up as it cooks. Drain excess fat.
2. Season beef with 1 tsp garlic powder, 1 tsp onion powder, 1/2 tsp paprika, 1 tsp salt, and 1/2 tsp black pepper. Stir well.
3. Add 8 oz uncooked noodles, 1 can cream of mushroom soup, 1 1/2 cups milk, and 1/2 cup water to the skillet. Stir to combine.
4. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to medium-low. Cover and simmer for 12-15 minutes, stirring occasionally, until noodles are tender.
5. Remove from heat and stir in 2 cups shredded cheddar cheese until melted and creamy.
6. Let stand 5 minutes before serving to thicken.

ingredients: all-purpose flour, plus more for dusting
Potato gnocchi.directions: Ingredients needed: 2 lbs russet potatoes, 1 cup 1 egg, lightly beaten, 1.5 cups all-purpose flour, plus more for dusting, 1 tsp salt, 1/2 cup butter, 2 tablespoons fresh sage, chopped, 1 cup Parmesan, grated, 1.5 cups Black pepper to taste. 1. Preheat oven to 400°F. Pierce potatoes with fork, bake 1 hour until tender. Cut in half, scoop flesh into large bowl while still hot. Rice or mash until smooth, no lumps. Cool 10 min. 2. Add egg, 1 cup flour, salt to potatoes. Mix gently until dough just comes together. Add more flour 1 tbsp at a time if too sticky. Don't overwork. 3. Divide dough into 6 pieces. On floured surface, roll each into 3/4 inch rope. Cut into 1 inch pieces. Roll each piece down tines of fork to create ridges, if desired. 4. Bring large pot of salted water to gentle boil. Working in batches, add gnocchi. Cook until they float, about 2-3 min. Remove with slotted spoon. 5. Melt butter in large skillet over medium heat. Add sage, cook until butter browns and sage crisps, 3-4 min. Add cooked gnocchi, toss gently. Season with salt and pepper. 6. Serve topped with Parmesan and crispy sage.

Breaded fried sausage patties.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 lb Italian sausage, 1 cup flour, 3 large eggs, 1 cup breadcrumbs, 1/2 tsp (to taste) black pepper, 2 tablespoons vegetable oil. Form sausage into patties. Season flour. Dip in flour, beaten egg, breadcrumbs. Fry at 350°F until golden and cooked through, about 4 minutes per side.

Beef and rice stuffed potatoes.directions: Ingredients needed: 6 large russet potatoes, 1 lb ground beef, 1 cup cooked white rice, 1 can (10.5 oz) cream of mushroom soup, 1 cup shredded cheddar cheese, 1 medium onion, diced, 2 cloves garlic, minced, 1/2 cup sour cream, 1/4 cup milk, 2 tbsp butter, 1 tsp salt, 1/2 tsp black pepper, 1 tsp Worcestershire sauce. 1. Preheat oven to 400°F. Pierce potatoes with fork and bake 60-75 minutes until tender. 2. While potatoes bake, brown ground beef with onion in skillet over medium-high heat, 8-10 minutes. Drain fat. Add garlic and cook 1 minute. Season with salt and pepper. 3. Stir in cooked rice, cream of mushroom soup, and Worcestershire sauce. Simmer 5 minutes. Keep warm. 4. When potatoes are done, let cool 10 minutes. Cut in half lengthwise and scoop out flesh, leaving shells. 5. Mash potato flesh with butter, sour cream, and milk. Season with salt and pepper. 6. Reduce oven to 375°F. Fill each potato shell with mashed potato, then top generously with beef and rice mixture. Sprinkle with cheese. 7. Bake 15-20 minutes until cheese is melted and bubbly. Garnish with green onions.

ingredients: beef roast (chuck or sirloin), thinly sliced or shredded
For gravy: 3 tbsp butter, 1/4 cup flour, 2 cups beef broth from cooking, salt and pepper to taste
For mashed potatoes (optional): 2 lbs potatoes, 1/2 cup milk, 4 tbsp butter
Hot beef sandwiches.directions:
Ingredients needed: 2 lbs beef roast (chuck or sirloin), thinly sliced or shredded, 8 slices white bread or 4 hoagie rolls, 4 cups beef broth, 2 cloves garlic, minced, 1 tsp Worcestershire sauce, 1 tsp onion powder, 1/2 tsp black pepper. 1. In a large pot, combine 4 cups beef broth, 2 cloves minced garlic, 1 tsp Worcestershire sauce, 1 tsp onion powder, and 1/2 tsp black pepper. Bring to a boil.
2. Add 2 lbs sliced beef, reduce heat to low, and simmer 20-30 minutes until beef is tender and heated through.
3. Remove beef with a slotted spoon. Reserve 2 cups of cooking liquid for gravy.
4. For gravy: In a saucepan, melt 3 tbsp butter over medium heat. Whisk in 1/4 cup flour, cook 2 minutes.
5. Gradually whisk in 2 cups reserved cooking liquid. Simmer 5-7 minutes until thickened. Season with salt and pepper.
6. For each sandwich: Place 2 slices bread (or split hoagie roll) on a plate. Top with generous portion of hot beef.
7. Ladle gravy over beef and bread. Serve immediately, optionally with mashed potatoes on the side.

Cracklin' chicken.directions: Ingredients needed: 3 lbs whole chicken, cut into pieces, 1/2 tsp (to taste) black pepper, 3 tablespoons butter, 3 tablespoons olive oil. Flatten chicken butterfly style. Season heavily. Heat oil and butter in cast iron. Cook skin-side down with weight on top 30 minutes until skin is incredibly crispy. Flip 5 minutes.

Pork fried rice.directions:
Ingredients needed: 3 cups cooked jasmine rice (day-old, refrigerated), 8 oz pork tenderloin, diced into 1/4-inch cubes, 3 tbsp vegetable oil, 2 large eggs, beaten, 1/2 cup frozen peas and carrots, 3 g reen onions, sliced, 3 cloves garlic, minced, 3 tbsp soy sauce, 1 tbsp oyster sauce, 1 tbsp sesame oil, 1/2 tsp white pepper, 1/2 tsp salt. 1. Season diced pork with pinch of salt and white pepper.
2. Heat 1 tbsp vegetable oil in large wok over high heat (450°F). Add pork, stir-fry for 3-4 minutes until cooked through and lightly browned. Remove and set aside.
3. Add another 1 tbsp oil to wok. Pour in beaten eggs, scramble for 30-45 seconds until just set. Remove and set aside.
4. Add remaining 1 tbsp oil. Add minced garlic, stir-fry for 15 seconds until fragrant.
5. Add peas and carrots, stir-fry for 2 minutes.
6. Add cold rice, breaking up clumps. Stir-fry for 3-4 minutes until heated through and slightly crispy.
7. Add soy sauce, oyster sauce, sesame oil, white pepper, and salt. Toss for 1 minute.
8. Return cooked pork and eggs to wok along with green onions. Toss for 30 seconds to combine.
9. Serve immediately while hot.

Beef tips and noodles.directions: Ingredients needed: 8 oz sirloin tips, 1 lb egg noodles, 3 cups beef broth, 1 lb mushrooms, quartered, 1/2 cup sour cream, 4 tablespoons butter, 1 cup flour, 3 tablespoons Worcestershire sauce. Brown beef tips, remove. Sauté mushrooms. Add flour, cook 1 minute. Add broth and Worcestershire. Return beef. Simmer 30 minutes until tender. Stir in sour cream. Serve over egg noodles.

Sausage carbonara.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 lb spaghetti, 1 lb Italian sausage, casings removed, 4 egg yolks, 3 large eggs, 1.5 cups Pecorino Romano, finely grated, 1/2 cup Parmesan, grated, 2 tsp black pepper, freshly cracked, 1 lb penne pasta. 1. Bring large pot of salted water to boil. Cook spaghetti until al dente, 8-10 min. Reserve 2 cups pasta water before draining. 2. While pasta cooks, cook sausage in large skillet over medium-high heat 8-10 min, breaking up meat, until browned and cooked through. Remove from heat. 3. In bowl, whisk together egg yolks, whole eggs, Pecorino, Parmesan, and lots of black pepper. 4. Add hot drained pasta to skillet with sausage, toss off heat for 30 seconds to cool slightly. 5. Working quickly off heat, pour egg mixture over pasta, tossing vigorously and constantly. Add pasta water 2 tbsp at a time, tossing continuously, until creamy sauce forms that coats pasta (not scrambled eggs). 6. Plate immediately. Top with more Pecorino and cracked pepper. Serve at once.

Duchess potatoes.directions: Ingredients needed: 2 lbs Yukon gold potatoes, diced, 6 egg yolks, 3 tablespoons butter, 1/4 teaspoon ground nutmeg, 1/2 teaspoon white pepper. Make smooth mashed potatoes. Beat in yolks and butter. Season with nutmeg, salt, pepper. Pipe into decorative rosettes. Brush with egg. Bake at 400°F until golden.

Country fried pork chops.directions: Ingredients needed: 6 (5-6 oz) boneless pork chops, 1/2 cup all-purpose flour, 3 tablespoons butter, 4 large eggs, 1/2 tsp (to taste) black pepper, 4 cloves garlic, minced, 3 tablespoons vegetable oil. Pound chops. Season flour. Dip in buttermilk-egg mixture, then flour. Fry at 350°F until golden and cooked through. Make white gravy with drippings.

Meatball subs.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 lb ground beef, 1.5 lbs ground pork, 1.5 cups breadcrumbs, 1/2 cup grated parmesan cheese, 4 large eggs, 1 (24 oz) jar marinara sauce, 8 oz shredded cheese, 1.5 teaspoons Italian seasoning, 1/2 cup hoagie rolls, 4 cloves garlic, minced. Make meatballs: mix meats, breadcrumbs, parmesan, egg, garlic, Italian seasoning. Form balls, bake at 400°F 20 minutes. Simmer in marinara. Split rolls, fill with meatballs and sauce. Top with mozzarella. Broil until cheese melts.

Potato and sausage pierogi filling.directions: Ingredients needed: 2 lbs Yukon gold potatoes, diced, 1 lb Italian sausage, 1/4 cup (4 tbsp) butter, 3 cups 1, sliced pepper, 2 medium onions, diced. Boil potatoes until tender, mash with butter. Brown sausage with diced onion. Combine mashed potatoes with sausage mixture. Season with salt and pepper. Use as pierogi filling.

ingredients: boneless skinless chicken breasts (6 oz each)
Chicken schnitzel.directions: Ingredients needed: 4 boneless skinless chicken breasts (6 oz each), 1 cup all-purpose flour, 4 large eggs, 2 cups plain breadcrumbs, 1/2 cup grated Parmesan cheese, 1 tsp paprika, 1/2 tsp garlic powder, 1/4 cup butter, 1/4 cup vegetable oil, 1/2 tsp (to taste) black pepper, 1 large lemon, 1/3 cup fresh parsley. 1. Place chicken breasts between plastic wrap. Pound with meat mallet to 1/4-inch even thickness. Season both sides with salt and pepper. 2. Set up breading station: Place flour in shallow dish. Beat eggs with 1 tbsp water in second dish. Mix breadcrumbs, Parmesan, paprika, and garlic powder in third dish. 3. Dredge each chicken breast in flour, shake off excess. Dip in egg, let excess drip. Press firmly into breadcrumb mixture, coating both sides completely. Place on plate. 4. Heat butter and oil in large skillet over medium-high heat until butter foams. 5. Fry chicken breasts 3-4 min per side until golden brown and crispy. Don't crowd pan. Internal temp 165°F. 6. Drain on paper towels briefly. Serve immediately with lemon wedges and chopped parsley. Serve with potato salad or cucumber salad.

ingredients: For gravy: 3 tbsp flour, 2.5 cups beef broth, salt and pepper
Poor man's steak.directions: Ingredients needed: 1.5 lbs ground beef (80/20), 1/2 cup breadcrumbs, 1/4 cup milk, 1 egg, 1 tsp salt, 1/2 tsp black pepper, 1 tsp garlic powder, 1/2 tsp onion powder, 3 tbsp vegetable oil. 1. Mix ground beef, breadcrumbs, milk, egg, salt, pepper, garlic powder, and onion powder. 2. Form into 6 oval patties about 1/2-inch thick. 3. Heat oil in large skillet over medium-high heat. Brown patties 3-4 min per side. Remove and set aside. 4. Sprinkle flour into drippings, whisk and cook 2 min. Gradually add broth, whisking constantly. 5. Bring to simmer, cook 5 min until thickened. Season with salt and pepper. 6. Return patties to gravy, simmer 5-7 min until cooked through. Serve patties smothered in gravy.

Baked ziti with meat.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 lb ziti pasta, 1 lb Italian sausage, casings removed, 1 lb ground beef, 2 medium onions, diced, 4 cloves garlic, minced, 28 oz crushed tomatoes, 15 oz marinara sauce, 2 tsp Italian seasoning, 1 tsp salt, 1/2 tsp black pepper, 15 oz ricotta cheese, 1 cup 1 egg, 1/2 cup Parmesan, grated, 16 oz mozzarella, shredded, 1/4 cup fresh basil, chopped. 1. Preheat oven to 375°F. Cook ziti in salted boiling water 2 min less than package directions (still firm). Drain well. 2. In large skillet, brown sausage and beef over medium-high heat 8 min, breaking up meat. Add onion, cook 5 min. Add garlic, cook 1 min. 3. Add crushed tomatoes, marinara, Italian seasoning, salt, pepper. Simmer 15 min, stirring occasionally. 4. In bowl, mix ricotta, egg, Parmesan, half the basil. 5. In 9x13 baking dish, layer half the ziti, dollops of half the ricotta mixture, half the meat sauce, half the mozzarella. Repeat layers. Top with remaining mozzarella and Parmesan. 6. Cover with foil, bake 25 min. Remove foil, bake 20 min more until cheese is golden and bubbly. Broil 2 min for extra browning. Rest 10 min, garnish with basil before serving.

Cacio e pepe.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 lb spaghetti or tonnarelli, 2 cups Pecorino Romano, finely grated, 2 tbsp black peppercorns, coarsely cracked, 12 oz pasta. 1. Bring large pot of salted water to boil. Cook pasta until al dente, 8-10 min. Reserve 2.5 cups pasta water before draining. 2. While pasta cooks, toast cracked black pepper in large dry skillet over medium heat 1-2 min until fragrant. Add 1 cup reserved pasta water, bring to simmer. 3. Add drained pasta to skillet, toss vigorously for 1 min. 4. Remove from heat. Working quickly, add Pecorino in 3-4 additions, tossing constantly and vigorously. Add pasta water 2-3 tbsp at a time while tossing to create creamy emulsion, not clumps. The sauce should coat pasta like silk. 5. Keep tossing off heat for 2-3 min total, adding more pasta water as needed. The constant motion and pasta water create the creamy sauce. 6. Serve immediately with more cracked pepper and Pecorino on top. Do not let sit or sauce will break.

Hasselback potatoes.directions: Ingredients needed: 2 lbs Yukon gold potatoes, diced, 4 tablespoons butter, 2 tablespoons olive oil, 6 cloves garlic, minced, 1/2 tsp (to taste) black pepper, 1/2 cup grated parmesan cheese. Place potato between two chopsticks. Slice thin crosswise, sticks prevent cutting through bottom. Brush with melted butter and oil. Season with salt, pepper, garlic. Bake at 425°F 45-50 minutes, basting occasionally. Top with parmesan, bake 5 more minutes.

Sausage and cheese stuffed potatoes.directions: Ingredients needed: 6 large russet potatoes, 1 lb Italian sausage, 1 cup shredded mozzarella cheese, 1 cup shredded cheddar cheese, 1/2 cup sour cream, 1/4 cup milk, 4 oz cream cheese, softened, 3 tbsp butter, 1 tsp Italian seasoning, 1/2 tsp garlic powder. 1. Preheat oven to 400°F. Pierce potatoes with fork and bake 60-75 minutes until tender. 2. Remove sausage from casings and crumble into skillet. Cook over medium-high heat 8-10 minutes until browned and cooked through. Drain and set aside. 3. When potatoes are done, let cool 10 minutes. Cut in half lengthwise and scoop out flesh into bowl, leaving 1/4 inch shells. 4. Mash potato flesh with butter and cream cheese until smooth. Mix in sour cream, milk, 1/2 cup mozzarella, 1/2 cup cheddar, Italian seasoning, garlic powder, salt, and pepper. 5. Fold in cooked sausage. Reduce oven to 375°F. 6. Fill potato shells with mixture, mounding high. Top with remaining cheeses. Place on baking sheet. 7. Bake 20-25 minutes until heated through and cheese is golden and bubbly. Garnish with fresh basil.

Rice pilaf.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 cup jasmine rice, 4 cups chicken broth, 4 tablespoons butter, 1 bay leaf. Sauté rice in butter until slightly toasted. Add broth, salt, bay leaf. Bring to boil. Cover, simmer 18-20 minutes until liquid is absorbed and rice is tender. Fluff with fork, remove bay leaf.

Chicken and gravy over biscuits.directions: Ingredients needed: 4 (6-8 oz) boneless chicken breasts, 1/2 cup biscuits, 1/4 cup (4 tbsp) butter, 1/4 cup flour, 3 cups chicken broth, 1/2 cup heavy cream, 2 teaspoons fresh thyme, 1/2 tsp (to taste) black pepper. Cook and cube chicken. Make gravy: roux with butter and flour, add broth and cream, simmer until thick. Add thyme, chicken. Split biscuits, ladle chicken and gravy over.

ingredients: 1/2 lbs ground beef (80/20), divided into 8 balls (3 oz each)
Smash burgers.directions:
Ingredients needed: 1 1/2 lbs ground beef (80/20), divided into 8 balls (3 oz each), 8 slices American cheese, 4 hamburger buns, 1 tsp salt, 1/2 tsp black pepper, 2 tbsp vegetable oil. 1. Divide 1 1/2 lbs ground beef into 8 loose balls (3 oz each). Do not compress. Season with 1 tsp salt and 1/2 tsp black pepper.
2. Heat a cast iron griddle or skillet over high heat. Add 2 tbsp oil.
3. Place 2-4 beef balls on griddle. Immediately smash each ball with a sturdy spatula, pressing hard to create 1/4-inch thick patties about 4 inches wide.
4. Cook 2 minutes without moving until crispy, deeply browned crust forms on bottom.
5. Flip burgers and immediately top each with 1 slice American cheese. Cook 1 minute more until cheese melts.
6. Remove to a plate. Repeat with remaining balls.
7. Toast buns cut-side down on griddle 30-60 seconds until golden.
8. Assemble: bottom bun, 2 patties stacked together, toppings, condiments, top bun. Serve immediately.

Beef ragu over noodles.directions: Ingredients needed: 2.5 lbs beef, 1 (28 oz) can crushed tomatoes, 3/4 cup white wine, 3 cups beef broth, 6 cloves garlic, minced, 2 tablespoons fresh rosemary, chopped, 3 bay leaves, 12 oz wide egg noodles, 1/2 cup grated parmesan cheese. Brown beef chunks. Add wine, reduce. Add tomatoes, broth, garlic, herbs. Braise covered at 300°F 3-4 hours until falling apart. Shred into sauce. Serve over egg noodles with parmesan.

ingredients: 1/2 lbs sirloin steak, cut into 1-inch cubes
Garlic butter steak bites.directions:
Ingredients needed: 1 1/2 lbs sirloin steak, cut into 1-inch cubes, 6 tbsp butter, divided, 6 cloves garlic, minced, 1 tsp dried thyme, 1 tsp dried rosemary, 1 tsp salt, 1/2 tsp black pepper, 2 tbsp vegetable oil, 2 tbsp fresh parsley, chopped. 1. Pat 1 1/2 lbs steak cubes dry with paper towels. Season with 1 tsp salt and 1/2 tsp black pepper.
2. Heat 2 tbsp oil in a large cast iron skillet over high heat until smoking hot.
3. Add steak cubes in a single layer (work in batches if needed). Sear 2 minutes per side until browned and medium-rare. Remove to a plate.
4. Reduce heat to medium. Add 6 tbsp butter to skillet. When melted, add 6 cloves minced garlic, 1 tsp thyme, and 1 tsp rosemary.
5. Cook 1-2 minutes, stirring constantly, until garlic is fragrant but not burned.
6. Return steak bites to skillet and toss to coat in garlic butter, about 30 seconds.
7. Transfer to serving plate, drizzle with remaining garlic butter from pan, and garnish with 2 tbsp fresh parsley. Serve immediately.

ingredients: russet potatoes, peeled and sliced 1/8-inch thick
Au gratin potatoes.directions: Ingredients needed: 3 lbs russet potatoes, peeled and sliced 1/8-inch thick, 2 cups heavy cream, 1 cup whole milk, 3 cloves garlic, minced, 2 cups shredded Gruyère cheese, 1/2 cup grated Parmesan cheese, 3 tbsp butter, 2 tbsp flour, 1/2 tsp nutmeg, 1/2 tsp (to taste) black pepper. 1. Preheat oven to 350°F. Butter 9x13 baking dish. 2. Melt butter in saucepan over medium heat. Add garlic, cook 1 min. Whisk in flour, cook 2 min. 3. Gradually whisk in cream and milk. Add nutmeg, 1 tsp salt, and pepper. Simmer, stirring, until slightly thickened, 5 min. Remove from heat. 4. Layer 1/3 of potatoes in prepared dish, overlapping slightly. Sprinkle with 1/3 of Gruyère. Pour 1/3 of cream mixture over top. Repeat layers twice more. 5. Press down gently with spatula to submerge potatoes. Sprinkle Parmesan over top. 6. Cover with foil. Bake 45 min. Remove foil, bake 30-40 min more until potatoes are tender, top is golden brown and bubbling. 7. Let rest 15 min before serving.

Swedish meatballs.directions: Ingredients needed: 1.5 lbs ground beef (80/20), 1.5 lbs ground pork, 1.5 cups breadcrumbs, 6 eggs, 1 teaspoon allspice, 1/8 teaspoon nutmeg, 3 cups beef broth, 1 cup heavy cream, 3 tablespoons butter, 1/2 cup all-purpose flour. Mix meats with breadcrumbs, egg, allspice, nutmeg, salt. Form small balls. Brown in butter. Remove. Add flour to make roux. Add broth and cream. Simmer until thickened. Return meatballs to coat. Serve over egg noodles.

ingredients: 1/2 lbs boneless chicken thighs or breasts
Fresh dill or parsley for garnish
Chicken and rice soup.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 1/2 lbs boneless chicken thighs or breasts, 1 cup long grain white rice, uncooked, 8 cups chicken broth, 3 carrots, diced, 3 celery stalks, diced, 1 onion, diced, 3 cloves garlic, minced, 2 bay leaves, 1 tsp dried thyme, 1 tsp poultry seasoning. 1. Season chicken with salt and pepper. In large pot, heat 2 tbsp oil over medium-high. Brown chicken 4 min per side. Remove and set aside. 2. In same pot, sauté onion, carrots, celery for 5 min. Add garlic, cook 1 min. 3. Add broth, bay leaves, thyme, poultry seasoning. Bring to boil. Add chicken, reduce to simmer. Cook 20 min until chicken reaches 165°F. 4. Remove chicken, let cool 5 min, then shred or dice. 5. Add rice to soup, cook 18-20 min until tender. Return chicken to pot. Season with salt and pepper. Garnish with fresh herbs and serve with lemon wedges.

Sausage risotto.directions: Ingredients needed: 6 cups chicken broth, 2 tbsp olive oil, 1 lb Italian sausage, casings removed, 1 large onion, diced, 2 cups Arborio rice, 1/2 cup dry white wine, 4 tbsp butter, 1.5 cups Parmesan cheese, grated, 1/2 cup heavy cream, 1 lb Salt and pepper to taste, 1/3 cup fresh parsley. 1. Heat chicken broth in saucepan, keep warm over low heat. 2. Heat oil in large heavy-bottomed pot over medium-high heat. Add sausage, breaking up with spoon. Cook 8 min until browned. Remove sausage, leaving drippings in pot. 3. Add onion to pot, cook 4-5 min until soft. Add rice, stir to coat with drippings. Toast 2-3 min, stirring, until edges become translucent. 4. Add wine, stir until absorbed, about 2 min. Add warm broth 1 ladle (3/4 cup) at a time, stirring constantly. Wait until each addition is almost completely absorbed before adding next ladle. Continue 18-20 min until rice is creamy and al dente. 5. Return sausage to pot. Remove from heat. Stir in butter, Parmesan, and cream vigorously until creamy. Season with salt and pepper. Serve immediately garnished with parsley and more Parmesan.

Deep fried potato wedges.directions: Ingredients needed: 2 lbs Yukon gold potatoes, diced, 1/4 cup vegetable oil, 1 teaspoon paprika, 4 cloves garlic, minced, 1/2 tsp (to taste) black pepper. Cut potatoes into wedges. Soak in cold water 30 minutes. Dry well. Fry at 325°F until soft, then 375°F until golden and crispy. Season immediately with salt and spices.

ingredients: taco shells or 3 cups cooked rice
Toppings: shredded lettuce, diced tomatoes, shredded cheese, sour cream, salsa
Ground beef tacos (shell or over rice).directions: Ingredients needed: 1 lb ground beef, 1 tbsp vegetable oil, 1 s mall onion, diced, 2 cloves garlic, minced, 1 tbsp chili powder, 1 tsp cumin, 1 tsp paprika, 1/2 tsp oregano, 1/4 tsp cayenne pepper, 1/2 cup water, 12 taco shells or 3 cups cooked rice. 1. Heat oil in large skillet over medium-high heat. Add onion, cook 3-4 min until softened. Add garlic, cook 30 sec. 2. Add ground beef, breaking apart with spoon. Cook 6-8 min until browned, drain excess fat. 3. Add chili powder, cumin, paprika, oregano, cayenne, salt, and pepper. Stir 1 min until fragrant. 4. Add water, reduce heat to medium-low. Simmer 5-7 min until liquid reduces and mixture thickens. 5. Warm taco shells in 350°F oven 5 min (or serve over rice). 6. Fill shells with meat mixture and desired toppings.

Browned butter gnocchi.directions: Ingredients needed: 2 lbs potato gnocchi (fresh or frozen), 1/2 cup butter, 1 tablespoon dried sage, 4 cloves garlic, thinly sliced, 1/2 cup Parmesan cheese, grated, 3 cups Salt and pepper to taste, 1/4 tsp nutmeg, 1/3 cup pine nuts, 1 large lemon. 1. Bring large pot of salted water to boil. Cook gnocchi according to package directions until they float, 2-4 min. Reserve 1 cup cooking water, drain gnocchi gently. 2. While gnocchi cooks, melt butter in large skillet over medium heat. Add sage leaves, cook 2-3 min until crispy and butter begins to brown and smell nutty. Remove sage to paper towel, reserving brown butter. 3. Add garlic to brown butter, cook 1 min until fragrant. Add drained gnocchi to skillet. Gently toss to coat. Cook 2-3 min until gnocchi develops golden crust on some sides. 4. Add nutmeg, salt, pepper. Add 2-3 tbsp reserved cooking water to create silky sauce. Add Parmesan, toss gently to combine. 5. Serve immediately topped with crispy sage leaves, toasted pine nuts, lemon zest, more Parmesan, and cracked black pepper.

Pork and rice bowls.directions: Ingredients needed: 1.5 lbs ground pork, 1 cup jasmine rice, 1/3 cup soy sauce, 1/4 cup packed brown sugar, 2 teaspoons sesame oil, 4 cloves garlic, minced, 1 teaspoon ground ginger, 6 eggs, 3 tablespoons sriracha. Brown pork. Add soy sauce, brown sugar, garlic, ginger. Cook 5 minutes. Serve over rice. Top with fried egg, drizzle sesame oil and sriracha.

Potato croquettes.directions: Ingredients needed: 2 lbs Yukon gold potatoes, diced, 6 eggs, 1 cup flour, 1.5 cups breadcrumbs, 3 tablespoons butter, 1/2 cup grated parmesan cheese, 1/8 teaspoon nutmeg, 1/4 cup vegetable oil. Make mashed potatoes with butter and parmesan. Season with nutmeg and salt. Cool. Shape into cylinders. Dip in flour, beaten egg, breadcrumbs. Deep fry at 350°F until golden. Drain on rack.

Chicken paprikash.directions: Ingredients needed: 6 (5-6 oz) bone-in chicken thighs, 2 teaspoons paprika, 1/2 cup sour cream, 4 cups chicken broth, 4 tablespoons butter, 1/2 cup all-purpose flour, 1/2 tsp (to taste) black pepper, 5 cloves garlic, minced. Brown chicken in butter 4 minutes per side. Add 2 tbsp paprika, stir 30 seconds. Add broth, simmer covered 30 minutes. Remove chicken. Make slurry with flour and water, stir in to thicken. Remove from heat, stir in sour cream. Return chicken.

Lazy pierogies.directions: Ingredients needed: 8 oz medium egg noodles, 2 lbs Yukon gold potatoes, diced, 2 cups shredded cheddar cheese, 1/4 cup (4 tbsp) butter, 1 medium yellow onion, chopped, 1/2 cup sour cream. Cook egg noodles, drain. Sauté onion in butter until caramelized. Mix noodles with mashed potatoes and cheese. Top with caramelized onions and sour cream.

Sausage and potato foil packs.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 lb Italian sausage, 2 lbs Yukon gold potatoes, diced, 2 tablespoons olive oil, 1 tablespoon Italian seasoning, 6 cloves garlic, minced, 1/2 tsp (to taste) black pepper, 1/2 cup grated parmesan cheese. Slice sausage and cube potatoes. Toss with olive oil, Italian seasoning, garlic powder, salt, pepper. Divide onto foil sheets. Seal packets. Grill or bake at 400°F 25-30 minutes. Open, top with parmesan.

Chicken bog.directions: Ingredients needed: 2 lbs chicken thighs, 1.5 cups long-grain white rice, 1 lb Italian sausage, 3 cups chicken broth, 1/2 tsp (to taste) black pepper, 6 cloves garlic, minced, 3 tablespoons butter. Brown sausage, remove. Brown chicken 4 minutes per side. Add broth, bring to boil. Reduce heat, simmer 30 minutes. Remove chicken, shred. Add rice and sausage to broth. Cover, cook 20 minutes. Stir in chicken.

ingredients: ground beef or 1 lb sliced steak
Sour cream and salsa for serving
Beef and cheese quesadilla.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 lb ground beef or 1 lb sliced steak, 8 large flour tortillas, 3 cups shredded Mexican cheese blend, 1 s mall onion, diced, 1 bell pepper, diced, 2 cloves garlic, minced, 1 tbsp vegetable oil, 1 tsp cumin, 1 tsp chili powder. 1. Heat oil in skillet over medium-high heat. Cook onion and bell pepper 4-5 min until softened. Add garlic, cook 30 sec. 2. Add beef, season with cumin, chili powder, salt, pepper. Cook 6-8 min until browned (or steak cooked through). Drain and set aside. 3. Heat clean skillet or griddle over medium heat. Place tortilla on surface. 4. Sprinkle 1/2 cup cheese on half the tortilla, add beef mixture, top with another 1/4 cup cheese. Fold tortilla in half. 5. Cook 2-3 min per side until golden brown and cheese melts. Repeat with remaining tortillas. 6. Cut into wedges, serve with sour cream and salsa.

Loco moco.directions: Ingredients needed: 2 lbs ground beef, 2 cups white rice, 4 large eggs, 4 cups beef broth, 1/3 cup soy sauce, 1/4 cup (4 tbsp) butter, 1/2 cup all-purpose flour, 1/2 tsp (to taste) black pepper. Make hamburger patty, season, cook to desired doneness. Make gravy: roux with butter and flour, add broth and soy sauce, simmer until thick. Fry egg with runny yolk. Stack: rice, patty, gravy, fried egg on top.

Potato and egg skillet.directions: Ingredients needed: 5 medium potatoes, diced, 1 onion, diced, 1 red bell pepper, diced, 4 tbsp olive oil, 1 tsp paprika, 1/2 tsp garlic powder, 4 eggs, 1/2 cup shredded cheese, 2 g reen onions, sliced. 1. Heat 3 tbsp oil in large skillet over medium-high heat. Add potatoes, season with salt. Cook 10-12 min, stirring occasionally, until golden and tender. 2. Add onion and bell pepper, cook 5 min until softened. Add paprika, garlic powder, pepper. 3. Make 4 wells in potato mixture. Add remaining oil to wells, crack eggs into wells. 4. Sprinkle cheese over everything. Cover, cook 5-7 min until eggs set to desired doneness. 5. Garnish with green onions, serve with sour cream.

ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
Pasta aglio e olio.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 lb spaghetti, 3/4 cup extra virgin olive oil, 8 cloves garlic, thinly sliced, 1 tsp red pepper flakes, 1/2 cup fresh parsley, chopped, 1/2 cup Parmesan, grated, 1.5 cups Salt and black pepper to taste, 2 lemons, juiced and zested. 1. Bring large pot of salted water to boil. Cook spaghetti until al dente, 8-10 min. Reserve 2 cups pasta water before draining. 2. While pasta cooks, heat olive oil in large skillet over medium-low heat. Add sliced garlic, cook gently 3-4 min, stirring constantly, until golden and fragrant but not brown. Add red pepper flakes, cook 30 seconds. 3. Add 1/2 cup pasta water to skillet, increase heat to medium. Bring to simmer. 4. Add drained pasta to skillet, toss vigorously for 2 min, adding more pasta water 1/4 cup at a time to create light sauce that coats pasta. 5. Remove from heat. Add parsley, Parmesan, lemon zest, salt, pepper. Toss well to combine. 6. Serve immediately with extra Parmesan, drizzle of olive oil, and more red pepper flakes if desired.

ingredients: sriracha or chili crisp for serving
Crispy rice with fried egg.directions: Ingredients needed: 3 cups cooked day-old rice (preferably jasmine), 4 eggs, 3 tbsp vegetable oil (divided), 2 tbsp soy sauce, 1 tbsp sesame oil, 2 cloves garlic (minced), 2 g reen onions (sliced), 1 tsp white pepper. 1. Break up day-old rice to separate grains. 2. Heat 2 tbsp oil in large nonstick skillet or wok over high heat. 3. Add rice, press down firmly to create even layer. 4. Cook without stirring 5-7 min until bottom is golden and crispy. 5. Flip rice in sections, cook another 3-4 min. 6. Add garlic, soy sauce, sesame oil, and white pepper, toss to combine. 7. Transfer rice to plates. 8. Heat remaining 1 tbsp oil in same skillet over medium-high heat. 9. Fry eggs sunny-side up 3-4 min until whites are set but yolks are runny. 10. Top each rice portion with fried egg, garnish with green onions, serve with sriracha or chili crisp.

ingredients: salt and pepper; Soup: 8 cups beef broth
Meatball soup.directions: Ingredients needed: 1/2 cup rice (uncooked), 1 egg, 2 cloves garlic (minced), 1 tsp cumin, 2 carrots (sliced), 2 potatoes (diced), 2 zucchini (sliced), 1 can (14 oz) diced tomatoes, 1 onion (diced), 3 cloves garlic (minced), 1 tsp oregano, 1/4 cup cilantro (chopped). 1. Mix ground beef, rice, egg, garlic, cumin, salt, and pepper, form into 1-inch meatballs. 2. Bring beef broth to boil in large pot. 3. Add onion, garlic, and oregano. 4. Carefully drop meatballs into boiling broth. 5. Add carrots and potatoes, simmer 20 min. 6. Add zucchini and tomatoes, simmer 15 min until rice in meatballs is cooked. 7. Season with salt and pepper. 8. Garnish with cilantro, serve with lime wedges.

Potato au poivre.directions: Ingredients needed: 2 lbs Yukon gold potatoes, sliced 1/4-inch thick, 2 cups heavy cream, 3 cloves garlic, minced, 2 tbsp black peppercorns, coarsely crushed, 1 1/2 cups shredded Gruyère cheese, 3 tbsp butter, 1 tsp salt. 1. Preheat oven to 375°F. Butter 9x13 baking dish. 2. Heat cream, garlic, crushed peppercorns, and salt in saucepan over medium heat until simmering. Remove from heat, steep 10 min. 3. Layer half the potatoes in dish. Sprinkle with half the cheese. Pour half the cream mixture over. Repeat layers. 4. Dot top with butter. Cover with foil. 5. Bake 45 min. Remove foil, bake 25-30 min more until potatoes are tender and top is golden. 6. Let rest 10 min before serving.

Butter chicken (simplified).directions: Ingredients needed: 6 (5-6 oz) bone-in chicken thighs, 1/4 cup (4 tbsp) butter, 1/2 cup heavy cream, 2 cups tomato sauce, 8 oz garam masala, 1 teaspoon ground cumin, 1/2 teaspoon paprika, 4 cloves garlic, minced, 1 tablespoon fresh ginger, minced, 1 cup jasmine rice. Cook chicken cubes in butter with garlic, ginger, spices. Add tomato sauce, simmer 15 minutes. Add cream, simmer until thickened. Serve over rice.

ingredients: For gravy: 3 tbsp butter, 3 tbsp flour, 2 cups beef broth, 1 tsp Worcestershire sauce, salt and pepper to taste
For mashed potatoes: 2 lbs potatoes, 1/2 cup milk, 4 tbsp butter, salt to taste
Hot hamburger plate.directions:
Ingredients needed: 1 1/2 lbs ground beef (80/20), 1 tsp garlic powder, 1 tsp onion powder, 1 tsp salt, 1/2 tsp black pepper, 8 slices white bread. 1. Make mashed potatoes: Peel and cube 2 lbs potatoes. Boil in salted water 15-20 minutes until tender. Drain, mash with 1/2 cup milk, 4 tbsp butter, and salt. Keep warm.
2. Form 1 1/2 lbs ground beef into 4 oval patties (6 oz each). Season with 1 tsp garlic powder, 1 tsp onion powder, 1 tsp salt, 1/2 tsp black pepper.
3. Cook patties in a large skillet over medium-high heat 5-6 minutes per side until browned and cooked to 160°F. Remove to a plate.
4. For gravy: In same skillet, melt 3 tbsp butter over medium heat. Whisk in 3 tbsp flour, cook 2 minutes.
5. Gradually whisk in 2 cups beef broth and 1 tsp Worcestershire sauce. Simmer 5 minutes until thickened. Season with salt and pepper.
6. For each plate: Place 2 slices white bread, top with 1 beef patty, scoop of mashed potatoes, and ladle gravy generously over everything. Serve hot.

Sausage and egg fried rice.directions: Ingredients needed: 4 cups cooked day-old rice, 1 lb breakfast sausage, 4 eggs (beaten), 3 tbsp vegetable oil (divided), 1/2 cup onion (diced), 1/2 cup frozen peas and carrots, 3 cloves garlic (minced), 3 tbsp soy sauce, 1 tbsp sesame oil, 2 g reen onions (sliced). 1. Heat large wok or skillet over medium-high heat, cook sausage 6-8 min until browned and crumbled, drain and set aside. 2. Heat 1 tbsp oil in same pan, scramble eggs 2-3 min until just set, remove and set aside. 3. Heat remaining 2 tbsp oil over high heat, add onion and cook 2-3 min until softened. 4. Add garlic, cook 30 sec until fragrant. 5. Add rice, breaking up clumps, stir-fry 4-5 min until heated through. 6. Add peas and carrots, cook 2 min. 7. Return sausage and eggs to pan. 8. Add soy sauce and sesame oil, toss to combine. 9. Season with salt and pepper. 10. Garnish with green onions and serve hot.

Pork adobo.directions: Ingredients needed: 1.5 lbs pork belly, 1/3 cup soy sauce, 2 cups white rice, 6 cloves garlic, minced, 1 bay leaf, 1/2 tsp (to taste) black peppercorns, 3 tablespoons vegetable oil. Combine pork with soy sauce, vinegar, garlic, bay leaves, peppercorns and 1/2 cup water. Simmer covered 30 minutes. Remove pork, reduce sauce. Pan-fry pork until crispy. Serve with reduced sauce and rice.

ingredients: medium russet potatoes (about 3 lbs), peeled and cubed
Green onions and sour cream for topping
Cheesy potato soup.directions: Ingredients needed: 6 medium russet potatoes (about 3 lbs), peeled and cubed, 6 cups chicken broth, 1 onion, diced, 4 cloves garlic, minced, 1/2 cup butter, 1/2 cup all-purpose flour, 2 cups whole milk, 1 cup heavy cream, 3 cups shredded sharp cheddar cheese, 1 cup shredded Monterey Jack cheese, 1 tsp salt, 1/2 tsp black pepper, 8 slices bacon, cooked and crumbled. 1. In large pot, combine potatoes, broth, onion, garlic. Bring to boil, reduce to simmer. Cook 15-20 min until potatoes are very tender. 2. Use immersion blender to blend until mostly smooth but still chunky. 3. In separate pan, melt butter over medium heat. Whisk in flour, cook 2-3 min until golden. Gradually whisk in milk and cream until smooth. 4. Pour cream mixture into soup, stirring constantly. Simmer 5 min until thickened. 5. Reduce heat to low. Gradually stir in cheeses, stirring until melted and smooth. Season with salt and pepper. Top with bacon, green onions, and sour cream.

ingredients: Green onions and hot sauce for serving
Chicken bog casserole.directions: Ingredients needed: 3 lbs chicken thighs and drumsticks, 1 lb smoked sausage, sliced, 2 cups uncooked long grain white rice, 4 cups chicken broth, 1 large onion, diced, 3 cloves garlic, minced, 2 tbsp butter, 1 tbsp Cajun seasoning, 1 tsp salt, 1/2 tsp black pepper, 1/2 tsp cayenne pepper, 3 bay leaves. 1. Preheat oven to 350°F. Season chicken with Cajun seasoning, salt, and pepper. 2. In large Dutch oven, brown chicken in butter over medium-high heat, 5 minutes per side. Remove and set aside. 3. In same pot, cook sausage 5 minutes until browned. Add onion and cook 4-5 minutes. Add garlic and cook 1 minute more. 4. Stir in rice, coating with fat. Add chicken broth, bay leaves, and cayenne pepper. Bring to boil. 5. Nestle chicken pieces into rice mixture. Cover Dutch oven with lid. 6. Transfer to oven and bake 50-60 minutes until chicken reaches 165°F and rice is tender and has absorbed liquid. 7. Remove bay leaves. Let rest 10 minutes. Shred chicken if desired, mixing into rice. Serve with green onions and hot sauce.

ingredients: fresh Chinese wheat noodles (or dried egg noodles)
Ground pork dan dan noodles.directions:
Ingredients needed: 1 lb fresh Chinese wheat noodles (or dried egg noodles), 12 oz ground pork, 3 tbsp vegetable oil, 4 cloves garlic, minced, 2 tbsp ginger, minced, 3 tbsp Chinese sesame paste (or tahini), 3 tbsp soy sauce, 2 tbsp Chinese black vinegar, 2 tbsp chili oil, 1 tbsp Sichuan peppercorns, toasted and ground, 2 tsp sugar, 1/4 cup chicken broth, 3 g reen onions, sliced, 1/4 cup roasted peanuts, crushed, 2 tbsp preserved mustard greens (ya cai), chopped. 1. Bring large pot of water to boil for noodles.
2. In small bowl, mix sesame paste, soy sauce, black vinegar, chili oil, ground Sichuan peppercorns, sugar, and chicken broth. Set aside.
3. Heat 2 tbsp vegetable oil in wok over high heat (450°F). Add ground pork, breaking it up with spatula. Cook for 5-6 minutes until browned and crispy. Remove and set aside.
4. In same wok, add remaining 1 tbsp oil. Add garlic, ginger, and preserved mustard greens. Stir-fry for 1 minute until fragrant.
5. Return pork to wok, stir to combine with aromatics. Cook for 1 minute.
6. Meanwhile, cook noodles according to package directions (typically 3-4 minutes for fresh, 6-8 minutes for dried). Drain, reserving 1/2 cup cooking water.
7. Divide sauce mixture among serving bowls. Add hot noodles.
8. Top each bowl with ground pork mixture, green onions, and crushed peanuts.
9. Add splash of reserved noodle water if sauce is too thick. Toss and serve immediately.

Potato fondant.directions: Ingredients needed: 2 lbs Yukon gold potatoes, diced, 1/4 cup (4 tbsp) butter, 4 lbs chicken, 1/2 teaspoon thyme, 6 cloves garlic, minced. Cut potatoes into thick cylinders. Sear in butter until golden on both sides. Add stock, garlic, and thyme. Bake at 425°F for 30 minutes, basting occasionally until glazed and tender.

Lasagna.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 lb ground beef, 1/2 lb Italian sausage, 1 medium onion, diced, 4 cloves garlic, minced, 1 jar (24 oz) marinara sauce, 1 can (15 oz) tomato sauce, 2 tbsp tomato paste, 15 oz ricotta cheese, 1 egg, 3 cups shredded mozzarella cheese, 1 cup grated Parmesan cheese, 12 lasagna noodles, 2 tsp Italian seasoning, 1 tsp salt, 1/2 tsp black pepper, 1/4 cup fresh basil, chopped, 2 tbsp olive oil. 1. Preheat oven to 375°F. Cook lasagna noodles according to package directions. Drain and set aside. 2. Heat olive oil in large skillet over medium-high heat. Brown ground beef and sausage 8-10 minutes, breaking up meat. Drain excess fat. 3. Add onion and cook 5 minutes. Add garlic and cook 1 minute. Stir in marinara sauce, tomato sauce, tomato paste, Italian seasoning, salt, and pepper. Simmer 15 minutes. 4. In bowl, mix ricotta, egg, 1 cup mozzarella, 1/2 cup Parmesan, and half the basil. 5. Spread 1 cup meat sauce in 9x13 baking dish. Layer 4 noodles, half the ricotta mixture, one-third remaining meat sauce, and 3/4 cup mozzarella. 6. Repeat with 4 more noodles, remaining ricotta, one-third meat sauce, and 3/4 cup mozzarella. Top with final 4 noodles, remaining sauce, remaining mozzarella and Parmesan. 7. Cover with foil. Bake 40 minutes. Remove foil and bake 15 minutes until cheese is golden and bubbly. Let rest 15 minutes. Garnish with remaining basil.

White lasagna.directions: Ingredients needed: 12 lasagna noodles, 2 lbs Italian sausage, casings removed, 8 tbsp butter, 6 cloves garlic, minced, 1/2 cup flour, 4 cups whole milk, 2 cups heavy cream, 2 cups Parmesan, grated, 1/4 tsp nutmeg, 15 oz ricotta cheese, 2 eggs, 16 oz mozzarella, shredded, 2 cups baby spinach. 1. Preheat oven to 375°F. Cook lasagna noodles al dente, drain, lay flat. Brown sausage in skillet 8-10 min, breaking up meat. Drain, set aside. 2. In large pot, melt butter over medium heat. Add garlic, cook 1 min. Whisk in flour, cook 2 min. Gradually whisk in milk and cream. Simmer 8-10 min, whisking, until thickened. 3. Reduce heat to low. Add Parmesan and nutmeg, stir until cheese melts. Season with salt and pepper. Mix ricotta with eggs. 4. Spread 1 cup white sauce in 9x13 baking dish. Layer 4 noodles, half the ricotta, half the sausage, handful of spinach, 1/3 mozzarella, 1/3 remaining sauce. Repeat. Top with final 4 noodles, remaining sauce, remaining mozzarella. 5. Cover with foil, bake 30 min. Remove foil, bake 20 min until bubbly and golden. 6. Rest 15 min before serving.

Baked spaghetti.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 lb spaghetti, 1 lb ground beef, 1 lb Italian sausage, casings removed, 1 large onion, diced, 4 cloves garlic, minced, 24 oz marinara sauce, 15 oz crushed tomatoes, 2 tsp Italian seasoning, 1 tsp salt, 1/2 tsp black pepper, 8 oz cream cheese, softened, 1 cup sour cream, 16 oz mozzarella, shredded, 1/2 cup Parmesan, grated. 1. Preheat oven to 350°F. Cook spaghetti in salted water 2 min less than package directions. Drain well. 2. Brown beef and sausage in large skillet over medium-high heat 8 min, breaking up meat.
