Frito pie.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 lb ground beef, 1 s mall onion, diced, 2 cloves garlic, minced, 1 can (15 oz) chili beans in sauce, 1 can (8 oz) tomato sauce, 1 tbsp chili powder, 1 tsp cumin, 1/2 tsp paprika, 4 cups Fritos corn chips, 2 cups shredded cheddar cheese. 1. Brown ground beef in large skillet over medium-high heat 6-8 min. Add onion, cook 3-4 min until softened. Add garlic, cook 30 sec. Drain excess fat. 2. Add beans, tomato sauce, chili powder, cumin, paprika, and 1/2 cup water. Stir well. Simmer 15-20 min until thickened, stirring occasionally. Season with salt and pepper. 3. For individual servings: open single-serving Frito bags, spoon chili inside, top with cheese and toppings. Or layer Fritos in bowls, top with chili, cheese, and toppings. 4. For casserole: preheat oven to 350°F. Layer Fritos in 9x13 baking dish, top with chili and cheese. Bake 15-20 min until cheese melts. Serve with desired toppings.

ingredients: Toppings: shredded cheddar, sour cream, green onions
Chili (no beans).directions: Ingredients needed: 3 lbs ground beef (80/20), 2 onions diced, 6 cloves garlic minced, 1 can (28 oz) crushed tomatoes, 1 can (6 oz) tomato paste, 2 cups beef broth, 1/4 cup chili powder, 2 tbsp cumin, 1 tbsp paprika, 1 tbsp oregano, 1 tsp cayenne, 2 tsp salt, 1 tsp black pepper. 1. Heat large pot over medium-high heat. Brown ground beef in batches 7-8 min per batch, breaking up with spoon. Don't drain. 2. Add onions, cook 5 min until softened. Add garlic, cook 1 min. 3. Stir in all spices, cook 1-2 min until fragrant. 4. Add crushed tomatoes, tomato paste, and broth. Stir well. 5. Bring to boil, reduce heat to low. Simmer uncovered 2-3 hours, stirring occasionally, until very thick and rich. 6. Adjust seasoning. Serve hot with desired toppings.

ingredients: boneless skinless chicken breasts cut into 1-inch pieces
Toppings: shredded Monterey Jack cheese, sour cream, cilantro, lime wedges, tortilla chips
White chicken chili (no beans).directions: Ingredients needed: 2 lbs boneless skinless chicken breasts cut into 1-inch pieces, 2 tbsp olive oil, 2 onions diced, 6 cloves garlic minced, 2 cans (4 oz each) diced green chiles, 4 cups chicken broth, 2 tsp cumin, 1 tsp oregano, 1/2 tsp cayenne, 1 tsp salt, 1/2 tsp black pepper, 1 cup sour cream, 1/2 cup heavy cream. 1. Heat oil in large pot over medium-high heat. Season chicken with salt and pepper, brown in batches 5-6 min. Remove and set aside. 2. Add onions to pot, cook 5 min until softened. Add garlic, cook 1 min. 3. Stir in green chiles, broth, cumin, oregano, cayenne, salt, and pepper. Bring to boil. 4. Reduce heat to medium-low. Return chicken to pot, simmer 20-25 min until chicken is cooked through and flavors meld. 5. Remove from heat. Stir in sour cream and heavy cream until smooth. 6. Serve hot topped with cheese, sour cream, cilantro, lime wedges, and tortilla chips.

ingredients: large russet potatoes, peeled and cubed
dried ancho chiles, stemmed and seeded
dried guajillo chile, stemmed and seeded
Garnishes: shredded cabbage, radishes, lime wedges, cilantro, diced onion, tortilla chips, oregano
Pozole (no hominy sub potato).directions: Ingredients needed: 2 lbs pork shoulder, cut into 1-inch cubes, 3 large russet potatoes, peeled and cubed, 1 large onion, diced, 6 cloves garlic, minced, 2 dried ancho chiles, stemmed and seeded, 1 dried guajillo chile, stemmed and seeded, 8 cups chicken broth, 2 tsp oregano, 1 tsp cumin, 2 bay leaves. 1. Toast dried chiles in dry skillet 1-2 min until fragrant. Soak in hot water 15 min. Blend with 1 cup soaking liquid until smooth. 2. Season pork with salt and pepper. Brown in large pot or Dutch oven over medium-high heat 8-10 min. Remove and set aside. 3. In same pot, cook onion 4-5 min. Add garlic, cook 1 min. Add chile puree, cook 2-3 min. 4. Return pork to pot. Add broth, oregano, cumin, and bay leaves. Bring to boil, reduce to simmer. Cover, cook 1.5 hours until pork is tender. 5. Add potatoes, simmer 20-25 min until tender. Remove bay leaves. Season with salt and pepper. 6. Serve in bowls with garnishes on the side.

ingredients: beef honeycomb tripe, cleaned and cut into 1-inch pieces
beef feet or oxtail (optional, for richness)
Garnishes: chopped onion, cilantro, lime wedges, dried oregano, crushed red pepper, warm tortillas
Menudo (simplified).directions: Ingredients needed: 2 lbs beef honeycomb tripe, cleaned and cut into 1-inch pieces, 1 lb beef feet or oxtail (optional, for richness), 1 large onion, quartered, 8 cloves garlic, whole, 3 dried ancho chiles, 2 dried guajillo chiles, 10 cups water, 2 tbsp white vinegar, 2 tsp oregano, 1 tsp cumin. 1. Rinse tripe thoroughly. Place in large pot with water, vinegar, and 1 tsp salt. Boil 10 min, drain, rinse. This removes impurities. 2. Return tripe to pot with 10 cups fresh water, onion quarters, and whole garlic cloves. Bring to boil, reduce heat, simmer covered 2-3 hours until tripe is tender. 3. Meanwhile, toast chiles in dry pan 1-2 min. Soak in hot water 15 min. Blend with 1 cup soaking liquid until smooth. 4. Strain chile puree into pot. Add oregano, cumin, salt, and pepper. Simmer 30 min more. Remove onion quarters. 5. Adjust seasoning. The broth should be rich and slightly spicy. 6. Serve hot in bowls with garnishes and warm tortillas.

Bone broth.directions: Ingredients needed: 2 lbs beef chuck roast, 1/4 cup vinegar, 2 bay leaves, 1/2 tsp (to taste) black peppercorns, 2 cups water. Roast bones at 400°F 45 minutes. Transfer to large pot with vinegar, bay leaves, peppercorns. Cover with water. Simmer 12-24 hours, skimming occasionally. Strain, season with salt. Store in jars.

Egg drop soup.directions: Ingredients needed: 6 cups chicken broth, 4 eggs (beaten), 2 tbsp cornstarch, 3 tbsp water, 1 tbsp soy sauce, 1 tsp sesame oil, 1/2 tsp white pepper, 1/2 tsp ginger (minced), 2 g reen onions (sliced), 1 tsp rice vinegar. 1. Bring chicken broth to boil in large pot over high heat. 2. Mix cornstarch and water to create slurry. 3. Add soy sauce, sesame oil, white pepper, and ginger to boiling broth. 4. Slowly pour cornstarch slurry into broth while stirring constantly. 5. Reduce heat to medium, simmer 2-3 min until slightly thickened. 6. Slowly drizzle beaten eggs into soup while stirring gently in circular motion to create egg ribbons. 7. Remove from heat immediately after all egg is added. 8. Stir in rice vinegar. 9. Season with salt to taste. 10. Garnish with green onions and serve hot.

Wonton soup (no filling veg).directions:
Ingredients needed: 30-40 wonton wrappers, 1/2 lb ground pork, 2 tbsp soy sauce, 1 tbsp sesame oil, 1 tsp grated ginger, 2 cloves garlic, minced, 1/2 tsp white pepper, 8 cups chicken broth, 2 cups bok choy, chopped, 2 g reen onions, sliced, 1 tbsp soy sauce (for soup), 1 tsp sesame oil (for soup). 1. Make filling: Mix ground pork, 2 tbsp soy sauce, 1 tbsp sesame oil, ginger, garlic, and white pepper until well combined.
2. Place 1 tsp filling in center of each wonton wrapper.
3. Wet edges with water. Fold in half diagonally to form triangle, pressing to seal.
4. Bring two bottom corners together, overlapping slightly, and press to seal.
5. Bring large pot of water to boil. Cook wontons in batches for 3-4 minutes until they float. Remove with slotted spoon.
6. In separate pot, bring chicken broth to boil. Add 1 tbsp soy sauce and 1 tsp sesame oil.
7. Add bok choy, cook for 2 minutes until wilted.
8. Divide cooked wontons among serving bowls (6-8 wontons per bowl).
9. Ladle hot broth and bok choy over wontons.
10. Garnish with green onions and serve immediately.

Egg salad sandwich.directions: Ingredients needed: 10 hard-boiled eggs chopped, 1/2 cup mayonnaise, 2 tsp Dijon mustard, 2 tbsp fresh dill chopped (or 1 tsp dried), 2 celery stalks finely diced, 2 tbsp red onion minced, 1 tsp lemon juice, 1/2 tsp salt, 1/4 tsp black pepper, 8 slices bread. 1. Chop hard-boiled eggs into small pieces and place in bowl. 2. Add mayo, mustard, dill, celery, onion, lemon juice, salt, and pepper. Mix gently until combined. 3. Taste and adjust seasoning as needed. For creamier texture, add more mayo. 4. Cover and refrigerate at least 30 min before serving. 5. Serve on bread with lettuce. Garnish with paprika.

ingredients: maple syrup and butter for serving
Pancakes.directions: Ingredients needed: 2 cups all-purpose flour, 2 tbsp sugar, 2 tsp baking powder, 1 tsp baking soda, 1/2 tsp salt, 2 cups buttermilk, 2 eggs, 4 tbsp melted butter (plus more for cooking), 1 tsp vanilla extract. 1. Whisk together flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt in large bowl. 2. In separate bowl, whisk buttermilk, eggs, melted butter, and vanilla. 3. Pour wet ingredients into dry ingredients, stir until just combined (batter should be lumpy). 4. Heat griddle or large skillet over medium heat, brush with butter. 5. Pour 1/4 cup batter for each pancake onto hot griddle. 6. Cook 2-3 min until bubbles form on surface and edges look dry. 7. Flip and cook another 2-3 min until golden brown. 8. Keep finished pancakes warm in 200°F oven. 9. Repeat with remaining batter, brushing griddle with butter between batches. 10. Serve hot with maple syrup and butter.

ingredients: melted butter (plus more for waffle iron)
maple syrup and butter for serving
Waffles.directions: Ingredients needed: 2 cups all-purpose flour, 2 tbsp sugar, 1 tbsp baking powder, 1/2 tsp salt, 2 eggs (separated), 1 3/4 cups milk, 1/2 cup melted butter (plus more for waffle iron), 1 tsp vanilla extract. 1. Preheat waffle iron according to manufacturer instructions. 2. Mix flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt in large bowl. 3. In separate bowl, whisk egg yolks, milk, melted butter, and vanilla. 4. In another bowl, beat egg whites until stiff peaks form. 5. Pour wet ingredients into dry ingredients, stir until just combined. 6. Gently fold in beaten egg whites until incorporated. 7. Spray waffle iron with cooking spray or brush with melted butter. 8. Pour batter onto waffle iron (amount varies by iron size). 9. Close lid and cook 4-5 min until golden brown and crispy. 10. Serve immediately with maple syrup and butter, or keep warm in 200°F oven while making remaining waffles.

Biscuits and honey.directions: Ingredients needed: 1/4 cup flour, 1 teaspoon baking powder, 3 tablespoons butter, 4 tablespoons butter, 1/4 cup honey. Cut cold butter into flour mixed with baking powder and salt. Add buttermilk, mix until just combined. Pat out, cut rounds. Bake at 425°F 12-15 minutes. Serve warm with butter and honey.

Shakshuka (no tomato version).directions: Ingredients needed: 4 large eggs, 1 (12 oz) jar roasted red peppers, 8 oz shredded cheese, 5 cloves garlic, minced, 2 teaspoons cumin, 2 teaspoons paprika, 3 tablespoons olive oil. Blend roasted peppers with garlic, cumin, paprika. Simmer in skillet until slightly thickened. Make wells, crack in eggs. Top with feta. Cover and cook until eggs are set.

Omelette.directions: Ingredients needed: 3 eggs, 2 tbsp milk, 2 tbsp butter, 1/3 cup shredded cheese (cheddar, 1/4 cup fillings (diced ham, 1 tbsp fresh herbs (chives or parsley - chopped). 1. Beat eggs, milk, salt, and pepper in bowl until well combined. 2. If using vegetables, sauté them in 1 tbsp butter over medium heat 3-4 min until softened, set aside. 3. Heat 8-inch nonstick skillet over medium heat, melt remaining butter. 4. Pour egg mixture into pan, tilt to spread evenly. 5. Cook 2-3 min without stirring, gently lifting edges to let uncooked egg flow underneath. 6. When eggs are mostly set but still slightly wet on top, add cheese and fillings to one half. 7. Fold omelette in half using spatula. 8. Cook 1 min more until cheese melts. 9. Slide onto plate, garnish with herbs and serve immediately.

Breakfast casserole.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 lb breakfast sausage, 8 large eggs, 2 cups whole milk, 6 cups cubed bread (day-old), 2 cups shredded cheddar cheese, 1 cup shredded mozzarella cheese, 1 medium onion, diced, 1 red bell pepper, diced, 4 g reen onions, sliced, 1 tsp salt, 1/2 tsp black pepper, 1/2 tsp garlic powder, 1/4 tsp cayenne pepper, 2 tbsp butter. 1. Grease a 9x13 baking dish. 2. In large skillet, cook sausage over medium-high heat 8-10 minutes until browned. Remove with slotted spoon. 3. In same skillet, melt butter and sauté onion and bell pepper 5-6 minutes until softened. 4. In large bowl, whisk together eggs, milk, salt, black pepper, garlic powder, and cayenne. 5. Add bread cubes, cooked sausage, sautéed vegetables, 1.5 cups cheddar, and mozzarella. Mix well. 6. Pour into baking dish. Top with remaining cheddar and green onions. Cover and refrigerate at least 4 hours or overnight. 7. When ready to bake, preheat oven to 350°F. Bake uncovered 45-55 minutes until set in center, puffed, and golden brown. Internal temperature should reach 160°F. Let rest 10 minutes before serving.

Strata.directions: Ingredients needed: 10 cups cubed French bread (day-old), 10 large eggs, 3 cups whole milk, 1 cup heavy cream, 2 cups shredded Gruyère cheese, 1 cup shredded Parmesan cheese, 8 oz ham, diced, 1 medium onion, diced, 2 cups fresh spinach, 3 cloves garlic, minced, 4 tbsp butter, 2 tbsp Dijon mustard, 1 tsp salt, 1/2 tsp black pepper, 1/4 tsp nutmeg. 1. Grease a 9x13 baking dish. 2. In skillet, melt butter over medium heat. Sauté onion 5 minutes. Add garlic and spinach, cook 2-3 minutes until spinach wilts. Set aside. 3. In large bowl, whisk eggs, milk, cream, Dijon mustard, salt, pepper, and nutmeg. 4. Layer half the bread cubes in baking dish. Top with half the ham, half the vegetable mixture, and half of both cheeses. 5. Repeat layers with remaining bread, ham, vegetables, and cheese. 6. Pour egg mixture evenly over everything, pressing down gently to ensure bread absorbs liquid. Cover and refrigerate at least 6 hours or overnight. 7. When ready to bake, preheat oven to 350°F. Let strata sit at room temperature 30 minutes. 8. Bake uncovered 50-60 minutes until puffed, golden, and set in center (internal temp 160°F). Let rest 10 minutes.

Huevos rancheros (simplified).directions: Ingredients needed: 8 corn tortillas, 8 large eggs, 2 cups ranchero sauce or salsa roja, 1 can (15 oz) refried beans, 1 cup shredded cheese, 1/4 cup vegetable oil, 1/2 cup crumbled queso fresco, 1/4 cup fresh cilantro, chopped. 1. Warm refried beans in small pot over low heat, stirring occasionally. Warm ranchero sauce in another pot. 2. Heat 2 tbsp oil in skillet over medium heat. Fry tortillas one at a time, 30 sec per side until softened but not crispy. Drain on paper towels. Keep warm. 3. In same skillet (add more oil if needed), fry eggs sunny-side up or over-easy, 2-3 min until whites set but yolks remain runny. Season with salt and pepper. 4. To assemble: place 2 tortillas on each plate. Spread with refried beans. Top each with fried egg. 5. Ladle warm ranchero sauce over eggs. Sprinkle with shredded cheese and queso fresco. Garnish with cilantro. Serve with avocado and sour cream if desired.

Corned beef hash.directions: Ingredients needed: 3 cups cooked corned beef, diced, 4 cups cooked potatoes, diced, 1 large onion, diced, 1 red bell pepper, diced, 3 tbsp butter or oil, 1 tsp paprika, 1/2 tsp garlic powder, 4 eggs. 1. Heat 2 tbsp butter in large cast iron skillet over medium-high heat. 2. Add onions and peppers, sauté 4-5 min until softened. 3. Add potatoes, corned beef, paprika, garlic powder, salt, pepper. Press down with spatula. 4. Cook without stirring 6-8 min until bottom is crispy and browned. Flip in sections, cook 5-6 min more. 5. Make 4 wells, add remaining butter, crack eggs into wells. Cover, cook 4-6 min until eggs reach desired doneness. Garnish with parsley.

Spam and eggs.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 can (12 oz) Spam, sliced 1/4 inch thick, 4 eggs, 2 cups cooked white rice, 2 tbsp soy sauce, 1 tsp sesame oil, 2 g reen onions, sliced, 1 tbsp butter. 1. Heat large skillet over medium-high heat. Fry Spam slices 3-4 min per side until edges are crispy and caramelized. Remove to plate. 2. In same skillet, add butter. Crack eggs, fry sunny-side up or to preference, 3-4 min. 3. Mix rice with soy sauce and sesame oil, heat in microwave 1-2 min. 4. Plate rice, top with Spam and fried eggs. Sprinkle with green onions, pepper, and furikake if using.

Beans and rice.directions: Ingredients needed: 2 cups white rice, 2 cups cooked black beans, 1 teaspoon ground cumin, 6 cloves garlic, minced, 3 cups chicken broth, 1/4 cup olive oil, 1 lime, juiced and zested. Sauté garlic in oil. Add rice, toast 1 minute. Add broth, cumin, salt. Cook covered 18 minutes. Fluff. Stir in warmed beans. Squeeze lime over top.

Red beans and rice.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 (15 oz) can kidney beans, drained, 1 lb smoked sausage, sliced, 1.5 cups long-grain white rice, 2 cups diced ham (12 oz), 2 bay leaves, 2 teaspoons fresh thyme, 2 teaspoons Cajun seasoning. Soak beans overnight. Simmer with ham hock, bay leaf, thyme for 2 hours. Add sliced sausage and Cajun seasoning. Cook 1 more hour, mashing some beans to thicken. Serve over rice.

Black beans and rice.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 (15 oz) can black beans, drained, 1.5 cups long-grain white rice, 1 teaspoon ground cumin, 1 teaspoon dried oregano, 5 cloves garlic, minced, 1 bay leaf, 2 cups chicken broth, 3 tablespoons olive oil, 3 limes. Cook rice in broth. Sauté garlic in oil. Add beans, cumin, oregano, bay leaf. Simmer 15 minutes. Serve beans over rice. Squeeze lime on top.

Refried beans.directions: Ingredients needed: 2 cups cooked pinto beans, 1/4 cup lard, 1 teaspoon ground cumin, 4 cloves garlic, minced. Cook beans until very tender. Reserve cooking liquid. Mash beans. Heat lard in skillet. Add garlic and cumin. Add mashed beans, cooking liquid as needed. Stir and mash until creamy. Season with salt.

ingredients: shredded cheese (cheddar, Monterey Jack, or Mexican blend)
Bean and cheese burrito.directions: Ingredients needed: 4 large flour tortillas, 2 cups refried beans, 2 cups shredded cheese (cheddar, Monterey Jack, or Mexican blend), 1 cup cooked rice (optional), 1/2 cup sour cream, 1/2 cup salsa, 1/4 cup diced onion, 1/4 cup chopped cilantro, 1 tbsp vegetable oil. 1. Warm refried beans in pot over medium-low heat, stirring occasionally. Add splash of water if too thick. Season with salt and pepper. 2. If using rice, have it warm and ready. 3. Warm tortillas in microwave wrapped in damp paper towel 30 sec, or on dry griddle 15 sec per side until pliable. 4. Lay tortilla flat. Spread 1/2 cup beans in center line. Add 1/4 cup rice if using. Top with 1/2 cup cheese, dollop of sour cream, salsa, onion, and cilantro. 5. Fold in left and right sides, then roll from bottom to top, tucking tightly. 6. Optional: heat oil in skillet over medium heat. Brown burritos seam-side down 2 min, then flip and brown other side 2 min. Serve immediately.

ingredients: Optional fillings: cooked chicken, sautéed peppers and onions, black beans, corn
Sour cream, guacamole, and salsa for serving
Quesadilla.directions: Ingredients needed: 8 flour tortillas, 3 cups shredded Mexican cheese blend, 2 tbsp butter. 1. Heat large skillet or griddle over medium heat. 2. Place one tortilla on surface. Sprinkle 3/4 cup cheese evenly over entire tortilla. Add optional fillings if desired. Place second tortilla on top. 3. Cook 2-3 min until bottom tortilla is golden brown and cheese starts melting. Carefully flip. Cook 2-3 min more until second side is golden and cheese fully melts. 4. Remove from heat, let rest 1 min. Cut into 4-6 wedges. 5. Repeat with remaining tortillas. 6. Serve warm with sour cream, guacamole, and salsa for dipping.

ingredients: shredded cheese (cheddar, Monterey Jack, or blend)
Toppings: sour cream, guacamole, salsa, diced tomatoes, sliced black olives, chopped cilantro, diced onion, pickled jalapeños
Nachos.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 bag (13 oz) tortilla chips, 2 cups shredded cheese (cheddar, Monterey Jack, or blend), 1 lb ground beef or shredded chicken (optional), 1 can (15 oz) refried beans, 1 can (4 oz) diced green chiles, 1 jalapeño, sliced. 1. Preheat oven to 375°F. Line large baking sheet with parchment. 2. If using meat: brown ground beef or cook chicken, season with taco seasoning. Warm refried beans in pot. 3. Spread half the chips on baking sheet. Dot with spoonfuls of beans, sprinkle half the meat if using. Top with half the cheese, green chiles, and jalapeño slices. 4. Add second layer: remaining chips, beans, meat, and cheese. 5. Bake 10-12 min until cheese melts and bubbles. Watch carefully to prevent burning chips. 6. Remove from oven, immediately top with desired cold toppings. Serve hot.

ingredients: Toppings: shredded cheddar, sour cream, green onions
Chili.directions: Ingredients needed: 2 lbs ground beef (80/20), 1 onion diced, 1 bell pepper diced, 4 cloves garlic minced, 2 cans (15 oz each) kidney beans drained, 1 can (28 oz) crushed tomatoes, 1 can (6 oz) tomato paste, 2 cups beef broth, 3 tbsp chili powder, 1 tbsp cumin, 1 tsp paprika, 1 tsp oregano, 1/2 tsp cayenne, 2 tsp salt, 1 tsp black pepper. 1. Heat large pot over medium-high heat. Brown ground beef 7-8 min, breaking up with spoon. Drain excess fat. 2. Add onion and bell pepper, cook 5 min until softened. Add garlic, cook 1 min. 3. Stir in all spices (chili powder through black pepper), cook 1 min until fragrant. 4. Add beans, crushed tomatoes, tomato paste, and broth. Stir well. 5. Bring to boil, reduce heat to low. Cover and simmer 1.5-2 hours, stirring occasionally, until thick and flavors meld. 6. Adjust seasoning if needed. Serve hot with desired toppings.

ingredients: (15 oz) kidney beans, drained and rinsed
Chili mac.directions:
Ingredients needed: 1 lb ground beef, 8 oz elbow macaroni, 1 can (15 oz) kidney beans, drained and rinsed, 1 can (15 oz) diced tomatoes with juice, 1 can (8 oz) tomato sauce, 1 cup water, 1 medium onion, diced (1 cup), 2 cloves garlic, minced, 2 tbsp chili powder, 1 tsp cumin, 1 tsp paprika, 1/2 tsp cayenne pepper (optional), 1 tsp salt, 1/2 tsp black pepper, 1 cup shredded cheddar cheese, 2 tbsp vegetable oil. 1. Heat 2 tbsp vegetable oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add 1 cup diced onion and cook 5 minutes until softened.
2. Add 2 cloves minced garlic and cook 1 minute until fragrant.
3. Add 1 lb ground beef, increase heat to medium-high, and cook 8-10 minutes until browned, breaking it up as it cooks. Drain excess fat.
4. Stir in 2 tbsp chili powder, 1 tsp cumin, 1 tsp paprika, 1/2 tsp cayenne, 1 tsp salt, and 1/2 tsp black pepper. Cook 1 minute.
5. Add 1 can diced tomatoes, 1 can tomato sauce, 1 cup water, and kidney beans. Bring to a boil.
6. Add 8 oz macaroni, stir well, reduce heat to medium-low, and simmer covered for 12-15 minutes, stirring occasionally, until pasta is tender.
7. Remove from heat and stir in 1 cup shredded cheddar cheese until melted. Serve hot.

Tuna casserole.directions: Ingredients needed: 12 oz egg noodles, 3 cans (5 oz each) tuna (drained), 1 can (10.5 oz) cream of mushroom soup, 1 cup sour cream, 1 cup frozen peas, 1 cup shredded cheddar cheese, 1/2 cup milk, 1/2 cup diced celery, 1/2 cup diced onion, 2 cups crushed potato chips or breadcrumbs, 3 tbsp butter (melted). 1. Preheat oven to 375°F, grease 9x13 inch baking dish. 2. Cook egg noodles according to package directions until al dente, drain. 3. In large bowl, mix cream of mushroom soup, sour cream, milk, salt, and pepper. 4. Add cooked noodles, tuna, peas, celery, onion, and half the cheese, stir to combine. 5. Pour mixture into prepared baking dish, spread evenly. 6. Sprinkle remaining cheese on top. 7. Mix crushed potato chips with melted butter, sprinkle over casserole. 8. Bake 30-35 min until bubbly and golden brown on top. 9. Let rest 5 min before serving.

Chicken salad sandwich.directions: Ingredients needed: 3 cups cooked chicken breast diced, 3/4 cup mayonnaise, 1/2 cup celery diced, 1/4 cup red onion minced, 1/4 cup dried cranberries, 1/4 cup sliced almonds toasted, 2 tbsp lemon juice, 1 tsp Dijon mustard, 1/2 tsp salt, 1/4 tsp black pepper, 2 tbsp fresh parsley chopped, 8 slices bread. 1. Place diced chicken in large bowl. Add celery, onion, cranberries, and almonds. 2. In small bowl, whisk mayo, lemon juice, mustard, salt, and pepper until smooth. 3. Pour dressing over chicken mixture, fold gently until evenly coated. 4. Stir in fresh parsley. Taste and adjust seasoning if needed. 5. Cover and refrigerate at least 1 hour before serving. 6. Serve chicken salad on bread with lettuce leaves.

BLT without the L and T.directions: Ingredients needed: 12 strips thick-cut bacon, 8 slices bread (white or sourdough), 1/2 cup mayonnaise, 1 avocado sliced (optional), 2 tbsp butter. 1. Preheat oven to 400°F. Arrange bacon on baking sheet. Bake 15-20 min until crispy, flipping halfway. Drain on paper towels. 2. Toast bread until golden brown and crispy. Butter if desired. 3. Spread mayo generously on all bread slices. 4. On 4 slices, layer 3 strips bacon each and avocado slices if using. 5. Top with remaining bread slices. Cut diagonally and serve immediately.

Club sandwich.directions: Ingredients needed: 12 slices white or wheat bread, 8 slices cooked turkey breast, 8 slices cooked bacon, 4 slices Swiss or cheddar cheese, 4 leaves lettuce, 2 large tomatoes sliced, 1/2 cup mayonnaise. 1. Toast all bread slices until golden brown. 2. Spread mayo on one side of each slice. 3. For each sandwich: Place 1 bread slice mayo-side up, add lettuce, 2 turkey slices, 1 cheese slice. 4. Add second bread slice mayo-side down, then flip and spread mayo on top. Add tomato slices (seasoned with salt and pepper) and 2 bacon strips. 5. Top with third bread slice mayo-side down. 6. Secure with toothpicks in 4 corners. Cut into 4 triangular quarters and serve.

Reuben.directions:
Ingredients needed: 8 slices rye bread, 1 lb corned beef, thinly sliced, 8 slices Swiss cheese, 1 cup sauerkraut, well drained, 1/2 cup Thousand Island dressing, 4 tbsp butter, softened. 1. For each sandwich: Spread 1 tbsp Thousand Island dressing on one side of 2 slices of rye bread.
2. On the dressing side of one slice, layer 1 slice Swiss cheese, 4 oz sliced corned beef, 1/4 cup well-drained sauerkraut, another slice of Swiss cheese, then top with the second bread slice (dressing side down).
3. Butter the outside of both bread slices with 1/2 tbsp butter per side.
4. Heat a large skillet or griddle over medium heat (about 350°F).
5. Place sandwich in skillet and cook 4-5 minutes until golden brown and crispy.
6. Carefully flip and cook another 3-4 minutes until second side is golden and cheese is melted.
7. Remove from heat, let rest 1 minute, cut in half diagonally, and serve hot. Repeat for remaining sandwiches.

Philly cheesesteak (no peppers/onions).directions: Ingredients needed: 1.5 lbs ribeye steak thinly sliced, 2 tbsp vegetable oil, 8 slices provolone or American cheese, 4 hoagie rolls, 4 tbsp butter (optional). 1. Freeze steak 30 min for easier slicing. Slice as thinly as possible against the grain. 2. Heat oil in large skillet or griddle over high heat. 3. Add steak in single layer (work in batches if needed), season with salt and pepper. Cook undisturbed 2-3 min until browned, then stir and cook 2 min more until just cooked through. 4. Divide steak into 4 portions on griddle, top each with 2 cheese slices. Let melt 1-2 min. 5. Split hoagie rolls, butter and toast if desired. 6. Scoop steak and cheese into rolls. Serve immediately.

Pulled pork sandwich.directions: Ingredients needed: 4-5 lb pork shoulder (Boston butt), 3 tbsp brown sugar, 2 tbsp paprika, 1 tbsp garlic powder, 1 tbsp onion powder, 2 tsp salt, 1 tsp black pepper, 1 tsp cayenne, 1 cup apple cider vinegar, 1 cup BBQ sauce, 8 hamburger buns. 1. Preheat oven to 300°F. Mix brown sugar with all spices to make rub. 2. Pat pork dry, massage rub all over meat. Place in roasting pan, add vinegar. Cover tightly with foil. 3. Roast 6-7 hours until meat is fall-apart tender (internal temp 195-205°F). 4. Remove from oven, let rest 20 min. Shred meat with two forks, discarding excess fat. 5. Mix shredded pork with BBQ sauce and some pan juices. 6. Pile onto buns, top with coleslaw and serve.

ingredients: beef chuck roast, cut into large chunks
Chopped onion and cilantro for serving
Birria tacos.directions: Ingredients needed: 3 lbs beef chuck roast, cut into large chunks, 5 dried guajillo chiles, 3 dried ancho chiles, 1 large onion, quartered, 6 cloves garlic, 2 tomatoes, halved, 4 cups beef broth, 2 tbsp apple cider vinegar, 1 tbsp cumin, 1 tbsp oregano, 1 tsp cinnamon, 3 bay leaves, 24 corn tortillas, 2 cups shredded Oaxaca or mozzarella cheese. 1. Toast chiles in dry skillet 2 min. Remove stems and seeds, soak in hot water 20 min. 2. Blend chiles with 1 cup soaking liquid, tomatoes, garlic, cumin, oregano, cinnamon, and vinegar until smooth. 3. Season beef with salt and pepper. Sear in Dutch oven over high heat 3-4 min per side. Add onion quarters, chile sauce, broth, and bay leaves. 4. Bring to boil, cover, reduce to low simmer. Cook 3-4 hours until beef shreds easily. Or pressure cook 75 min. 5. Remove beef, shred with forks. Strain consommé, skim fat. 6. Dip tortillas in consommé. Heat on griddle, add cheese and beef. Fold in half, cook 2 min per side until crispy. 7. Serve with small bowl of consommé for dipping, garnish with onion, cilantro, and lime.

ingredients: shredded cheese (cheddar, Monterey Jack, or blend)
Cheese enchiladas.directions: Ingredients needed: 12 corn tortillas, 3 cups shredded cheese (cheddar, Monterey Jack, or blend), 2 cups red enchilada sauce, 1/2 cup diced onion, 1/4 cup vegetable oil, 1/2 cup sour cream, 1/4 cup chopped cilantro. 1. Preheat oven to 350°F. Spread 1/2 cup enchilada sauce in bottom of 9x13 baking dish. 2. Heat oil in skillet over medium heat. Quickly fry each tortilla 5-10 sec per side to soften (don't let crisp). Drain on paper towels. 3. Dip each tortilla in enchilada sauce to coat lightly. Place 1/4 cup cheese and 1 tsp onion in center. Roll tightly, place seam-side down in dish. 4. Pour remaining sauce over enchiladas. Sprinkle remaining cheese on top. 5. Cover with foil, bake 20 min. Remove foil, bake 10 min more until cheese bubbles. 6. Let stand 5 min. Drizzle with sour cream, sprinkle cilantro. Serve hot.

ingredients: Toppings: sour cream, cilantro, diced tomatoes, sliced olives
Beef enchiladas.directions: Ingredients needed: 1.5 lbs ground beef, 12 corn tortillas, 3 cups shredded cheese, 2.5 cups red enchilada sauce, 1 s mall onion, diced, 2 cloves garlic, minced, 1 tbsp chili powder, 1 tsp cumin, 1/4 cup vegetable oil. 1. Brown beef in skillet over medium-high heat 6-8 min. Add onion, cook 3-4 min. Add garlic, chili powder, cumin, salt, pepper. Cook 1 min. Drain fat. Stir in 1/2 cup enchilada sauce. 2. Preheat oven to 350°F. Spread 1/2 cup sauce in 9x13 baking dish. 3. Heat oil in small skillet. Fry tortillas 5-10 sec per side to soften. Drain on paper towels. 4. Fill each tortilla with beef mixture and 2 tbsp cheese. Roll tightly, place seam-side down in dish. 5. Pour remaining sauce over top. Sprinkle with remaining cheese. 6. Cover with foil, bake 20 min. Uncover, bake 10 min until bubbly. Let stand 5 min. Add toppings and serve.

ingredients: filling: shredded pork, chicken, or cheese with peppers
Tamales.directions: Ingredients needed: 4 cups masa harina, 1 lb lard or vegetable shortening, 2.5 cups chicken broth, warm, 1 tsp baking powder, 1 tsp salt, 30-40 dried corn husks, 3 cups filling: shredded pork, chicken, or cheese with peppers, 2 cups red or green salsa. 1. Soak corn husks in hot water 30 min until pliable. Drain and pat dry. 2. Beat lard with electric mixer 1 min until fluffy. Mix masa, baking powder, and salt. Gradually add to lard, alternating with warm broth, beating until dough is light and spreadable (test: small ball should float in water). 3. To assemble: lay husk smooth side up, wide end toward you. Spread 2-3 tbsp masa in center, leaving 1-inch border on sides and wide end, 2-inch on narrow end. 4. Place 1.5 tbsp filling in center of masa. Fold sides of husk inward, then fold up narrow end. Leave wide end open. 5. Stand tamales upright (open end up) in steamer basket. Steam over boiling water 1-1.5 hours until masa pulls away from husk easily. Check water level every 30 min. 6. Let rest 10 min before serving. Serve with salsa.

Chicken pot pie (no veg).directions: Ingredients needed: 3 cups cooked chicken, diced, 1/2 cup butter, 1/2 cup all-purpose flour, 2 cups chicken broth, 1.5 cups heavy cream, 1 tsp garlic powder, 1 tsp onion powder, 1 tsp dried thyme, 1 tsp salt, 1/2 tsp black pepper, 2 refrigerated pie crusts, 1 egg, beaten, 2 tbsp fresh parsley, chopped. 1. Preheat oven to 375°F. 2. In large saucepan, melt butter over medium heat. Whisk in flour and cook 3-4 minutes, stirring constantly until golden and fragrant. 3. Gradually whisk in chicken broth, then heavy cream. Bring to simmer, whisking frequently. Cook 7-10 minutes until thickened to gravy consistency. 4. Stir in garlic powder, onion powder, thyme, salt, pepper, and parsley. Add diced chicken and mix well. Remove from heat. 5. Press one pie crust into 9-inch deep dish pie pan. Pour chicken filling into crust. 6. Top with second pie crust. Trim excess and crimp edges to seal well. Cut 5-6 slits in top for steam vents. Brush entire top with beaten egg. 7. Place on baking sheet. Bake 45-55 minutes until crust is deep golden brown and filling is bubbly through vents. Let rest 15 minutes before serving.

Cornbread.directions: Ingredients needed: 3 cups fresh corn, 1/2 cup all-purpose flour, 3 large eggs, 1/4 cup (4 tbsp) butter, 3 tablespoons butter, 1 tablespoon baking powder, 8 oz baking soda, 1/4 cup sugar. Mix dry ingredients. Mix wet ingredients. Combine, don't overmix. Pour into buttered cast iron skillet. Bake at 425°F 20-25 minutes until golden and toothpick comes out clean. Brush with butter.

Cornbread with honey butter.directions: Ingredients needed: 2 cups corn kernels, 1/4 cup flour, 3 large eggs, 4 tablespoons butter, 1/4 cup (4 tbsp) butter, 1 teaspoon baking powder, 1/4 cup honey. Make cornbread batter. Bake in cast iron at 425°F 20-25 minutes. Whip soft butter with honey. Serve hot cornbread with honey butter melting on top.

Hush puppies.directions: Ingredients needed: 2 cups corn kernels, 1/4 cup flour, 3 large eggs, 3 tablespoons butter, 2 teaspoons baking powder, 1/4 cup sugar, 2 tablespoons vegetable oil, 1 large onion, diced. Mix cornmeal, flour, baking powder, salt, sugar, onion powder. Add beaten egg and buttermilk to form thick batter. Drop by spoonfuls into 350°F oil. Fry 3-4 minutes until golden brown, turning as needed.

Cheese bread.directions: Ingredients needed: 4 slices bread, 4 tablespoons butter, 1.5 cups shredded cheese, 1/2 cup grated parmesan cheese, 6 cloves garlic, minced, 1/3 cup fresh parsley. Mix soft butter with minced garlic, parsley, parmesan. Spread on halved French bread. Top with shredded mozzarella. Bake at 375°F 15 minutes until cheese is bubbly and golden.

Garlic bread.directions: Ingredients needed: 6 slices thick-cut bread, 3 tablespoons butter, 5 cloves garlic, minced, 1/3 cup fresh parsley, 1/2 cup grated parmesan cheese. Mix soft butter with minced garlic, parsley, parmesan, salt. Halve bread lengthwise. Spread butter generously on cut sides. Wrap in foil. Bake at 375°F 15 minutes. Open foil, broil 2 minutes until golden.

Cheesy garlic bread.directions: Ingredients needed: 6 slices thick-cut bread, 1/4 cup (4 tbsp) butter, 6 cloves garlic, minced, 8 oz shredded cheese, 1/2 cup grated parmesan cheese, 2 tablespoons dried parsley. Mix soft butter with minced garlic, parsley, parmesan. Halve bread, spread mixture on cut sides. Top with shredded mozzarella. Bake at 375°F 15 minutes until cheese bubbles.

Pizza.directions: Ingredients needed: 12 oz pizza dough, 1 (24 oz) jar marinara sauce, 1.5 cups shredded cheese, 1/4 cup olive oil, 2 teaspoons Italian seasoning. Stretch dough on oiled sheet or stone. Spread thin layer of sauce. Top with shredded mozzarella. Drizzle olive oil, sprinkle Italian seasoning. Bake at 475°F 10-12 minutes until crust is golden and cheese bubbly.

Deep dish pizza.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 (16 oz) ball pizza dough, 8 oz shredded cheese, 1 lb Italian sausage, 2 (14.5 oz) cans diced tomatoes, 1/2 cup grated parmesan cheese, 1/4 cup olive oil, 1 tablespoon Italian seasoning, 5 cloves garlic, minced. Press dough into oiled deep dish pan, going up sides. Layer sliced mozzarella on bottom. Add cooked sausage. Top with seasoned crushed tomatoes. Sprinkle parmesan. Bake at 425°F 25-30 minutes until crust is golden and cheese bubbly.

Calzone.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 (16 oz) ball pizza dough, 8 oz shredded cheese, 1.5 cups shredded cheese, 1 lb smoked sausage, sliced, 2 cups marinara sauce, 1 tablespoon Italian seasoning, 4 large eggs. Roll dough into circle. Spread ricotta on half. Add mozzarella and cooked sausage. Fold over, crimp edges. Brush with egg. Bake at 425°F 20-25 minutes until golden. Serve with marinara.

Stromboli.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 (16 oz) ball pizza dough, 1.5 lbs Italian meats, 8 oz shredded cheese, 2 cups shredded cheddar cheese, 1 tablespoon Italian seasoning, 6 eggs, 4 cloves garlic, minced, 2 cups marinara sauce. Roll dough into rectangle. Layer meats and cheeses. Roll tightly, seal edges. Place seam down. Brush with egg wash. Bake at 400°F 20-25 minutes until golden. Brush with garlic butter. Slice. Serve with marinara.

Pizza rolls.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 lb pizza dough, 8 oz pepperoni, 1.5 cups shredded cheese, 1 (24 oz) jar marinara sauce, 1/4 cup (4 tbsp) butter, 6 cloves garlic, minced, 1.5 teaspoons Italian seasoning. Roll dough into rectangle. Layer pepperoni and cheese. Roll tightly. Slice into 1-inch rounds. Place cut-side up in baking dish. Brush with garlic butter. Bake at 375°F 20-25 minutes until golden. Serve with marinara for dipping.

Focaccia.directions: Ingredients needed: 1/4 cup flour, 2 1/4 teaspoons active dry yeast (1 packet), 3 tablespoons olive oil, 1 tablespoon dried rosemary, 1/4 cup sugar, 3 cups water. Mix flour, yeast, salt, sugar. Add warm water and 2 tbsp olive oil. Knead until smooth. Rise 1 hour. Press into oiled sheet pan. Dimple with fingers. Drizzle generously with olive oil, sprinkle rosemary and flaky salt. Rise 30 minutes. Bake at 425°F 20-25 minutes.

Soft pretzels.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 cup flour, 1 packet (2 1/4 tsp) instant yeast, 1/4 cup sugar, 4 tablespoons butter, 1 cup baking soda, 1 tablespoon coarse salt, 2 cups water. Make dough with flour, yeast, sugar, salt, butter, water. Rise 1 hour. Roll into ropes, shape into pretzels. Dip in baking soda water bath. Sprinkle with coarse salt. Bake at 450°F 12-15 minutes until golden.

Cheese sauce.directions: Ingredients needed: 4 tablespoons butter, 1/4 cup flour, 1 cup milk, 1.5 cups shredded cheese, 2 tablespoons yellow mustard, 1/4 tsp cayenne pepper. Make roux with butter and flour. Whisk in milk, simmer until thickened. Remove from heat. Add shredded cheddar, stir until melted. Season with salt, mustard, cayenne.

Beer cheese dip.directions: Ingredients needed: 8 oz shredded cheese, 8 oz cream cheese, softened, 1 (12 oz) bottle beer, 5 cloves garlic, minced, 3 tablespoons Dijon mustard, 3 tablespoons Worcestershire sauce, 2 teaspoons hot sauce. Melt cream cheese in saucepan. Add shredded cheddar gradually. Add beer, garlic, mustard, Worcestershire, hot sauce. Stir until smooth. Keep warm for serving with soft pretzels or bread.

Fondue.directions: Ingredients needed: 2 cups shredded cheddar cheese, 2 cups shredded cheddar cheese, 3/4 cup white wine, 5 cloves garlic, minced, 1 tablespoon cornstarch, 1/4 cup lemon juice, 2 cups kirsch, 4 slices bread. Rub pot with garlic. Add wine, heat until simmering. Toss shredded cheeses with cornstarch. Add gradually, stirring constantly. Once melted and smooth, add lemon juice and kirsch. Serve immediately with cubed bread for dipping.

Welsh rarebit.directions: Ingredients needed: 1.5 cups shredded cheese, 1 cup beer, 3 tablespoons butter, 2 tablespoons Worcestershire sauce, 1 tablespoon mustard, 1/4 tsp cayenne pepper, 6 slices thick-cut bread, 3 large eggs. Melt butter, add cheese, stir until melted. Add beer, Worcestershire, mustard, cayenne. Stir until smooth. Toast bread. Pour cheese mixture over. Broil until bubbly. Optional: top with poached egg.

Cheese souffl\u00e9.directions: Ingredients needed: 4 tablespoons butter, 1/2 cup all-purpose flour, 1.5 cups milk, 1.5 cups shredded cheese, 6 eggs, 1 tablespoon Dijon mustard, 1/4 tsp cayenne pepper. Make thick béchamel. Cool slightly. Beat in yolks, cheese, mustard, cayenne. Whip whites to stiff peaks. Fold in gently. Pour into buttered ramekins. Bake at 375°F 25-30 minutes until puffed and golden.

Popovers.directions: Ingredients needed: 4 large eggs, 2 cups whole milk, 1/4 cup flour, 3 tablespoons butter. Heat popover pan in 450°F oven with butter in each cup. Blend eggs, milk, flour, salt until smooth. Pour into hot cups. Bake 20 minutes, reduce to 350°F, bake 15 more minutes. Don't open oven door. Serve immediately.

Yorkshire pudding.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 cup all-purpose flour, 1/2 tsp salt, 3 large eggs, 1 cup whole milk, 1/4 cup beef drippings or vegetable oil. 1. Whisk flour and salt in bowl. Make well, add eggs, whisk. Gradually add milk, whisking until very smooth with no lumps. Let batter rest at room temp 30 min (or up to 2 hours). 2. Preheat oven to 450°F. Put 1 tsp drippings in each cup of 12-cup muffin tin. Place tin in oven 5 min until fat is smoking hot. 3. Working quickly, pour batter into cups, filling each about halfway. Immediately return to oven. 4. Bake 20-25 min without opening oven door until dramatically puffed and deep golden brown. 5. Serve immediately while still puffed. Perfect with roast beef and gravy.

Toad in the hole.directions: Ingredients needed: 8 British pork sausages (Cumberland or similar), 1 cup all-purpose flour, 3 large eggs, 1 1/4 cups whole milk, 1/2 tsp salt, 1/4 tsp black pepper, 3 tbsp vegetable oil or beef drippings. 1. Preheat oven to 425°F. 2. Make batter: Whisk flour and salt in bowl. Make well in center. Add eggs, whisk. Gradually add milk, whisking until smooth. Stir in pepper and thyme. Let rest 30 min. 3. Put sausages in 9x13 metal baking pan. Drizzle with 1 tbsp oil. Bake 10 min. 4. Remove pan from oven. Add remaining 2 tbsp oil to pan, swirl to coat. Return to oven 5 min until oil is smoking hot. 5. Working quickly, pour batter around sausages. Immediately return to oven. Don't open door. 6. Bake 25-30 min until Yorkshire pudding is puffed, golden brown, and crispy. Center should be cooked through. 7. Serve immediately with onion gravy.

Scotch eggs.directions: Ingredients needed: 8 large eggs, 2 lbs breakfast sausage, 2 cups all-purpose flour, 3 large eggs, beaten, 3 cups panko breadcrumbs, 1 tsp black pepper, 1 tsp salt, 1 tsp dried sage, 1/2 tsp cayenne pepper. 1. Place 8 eggs in pot, cover with cold water. Bring to boil, then immediately remove from heat, cover, and let sit for 9 minutes. 2. Transfer eggs to ice bath for 5 minutes, then peel carefully. 3. Divide sausage into 8 equal portions. Flatten each portion into thin oval patty. 4. Dry each peeled egg thoroughly. Wrap each egg completely in sausage, pressing firmly to seal with no gaps. 5. Set up breading station: flour in one dish, beaten eggs in second dish, panko mixed with pepper, salt, sage, and cayenne in third dish. 6. Roll each sausage-wrapped egg in flour, dip in beaten egg, then coat thoroughly in seasoned panko. 7. Heat 3 inches of vegetable oil in large heavy pot to 350°F. 8. Fry Scotch eggs in batches of 2-3 for 8-10 minutes, turning occasionally, until deep golden brown and sausage is cooked through (internal temp 160°F). 9. Drain on wire rack. Let cool for 5 minutes before serving. 10. Cut in half to reveal perfect golden yolk. Serve with mustard and hot sauce.

ingredients: Fresh chives or parsley for garnish
Optional: bacon bits, relish, hot sauce
Deviled eggs.directions: Ingredients needed: 12 eggs, 1/2 cup mayonnaise, 2 tsp Dijon mustard, 1 tsp white vinegar, 1/4 tsp salt, 1/8 tsp black pepper. 1. Place eggs in single layer in pot, cover with water by 1 inch. Bring to boil over high heat. 2. Remove from heat, cover, let stand 12 min. 3. Transfer to ice bath, cool 5 min. Peel eggs. 4. Slice eggs in half lengthwise, scoop yolks into bowl. Arrange whites on serving platter. 5. Mash yolks with fork, add mayonnaise, mustard, vinegar, salt, pepper. Mix until smooth and creamy. 6. Spoon or pipe filling into egg white halves. Sprinkle with paprika and herbs. Refrigerate until serving.

Hot and sour soup (simplified).directions:
Ingredients needed: 6 cups chicken broth, 8 oz pork loin, julienned, 1 block (14 oz) firm tofu, julienned, 1 cup shiitake mushrooms, sliced, 1/2 cup bamboo shoots, julienned, 3 tbsp soy sauce, 3 tbsp rice vinegar (or more to taste), 2 tbsp cornstarch mixed with 3 tbsp water, 1 tbsp chili oil, 1 tsp sugar, 1 tsp white pepper (or more to taste), 2 large eggs, beaten, 2 g reen onions, sliced, 1 tbsp sesame oil. 1. In large pot, bring chicken broth to boil over high heat.
2. Add pork strips, cook for 3-4 minutes until no longer pink.
3. Add shiitake mushrooms and bamboo shoots. Simmer for 3 minutes.
4. Add tofu, soy sauce, rice vinegar, chili oil, sugar, and white pepper. Stir gently and bring back to simmer.
5. Stir in cornstarch slurry, stirring constantly until soup thickens (about 2 minutes).
6. Reduce heat to low. Create gentle whirlpool by stirring in circular motion.
7. Slowly drizzle beaten eggs into soup while stirring. Let sit 30 seconds for eggs to set.
8. Taste and adjust seasoning - add more vinegar for sourness or white pepper for heat.
9. Remove from heat, drizzle with sesame oil and garnish with green onions. Serve hot.

Wonton soup.directions:
Ingredients needed: 40-50 wonton wrappers, 12 oz ground pork, 1/2 lb shrimp, peeled, deveined, and minced, 3 g reen onions, minced, 2 tbsp soy sauce, 1 tbsp sesame oil, 1 tbsp ginger, minced, 1/2 tsp white pepper, 8 cups chicken broth, 2 tbsp soy sauce (for soup), 1 tsp sesame oil (for soup), 2 cups baby bok choy, chopped, 2 g reen onions, sliced (for garnish). 1. Make filling: Mix ground pork, minced shrimp, minced green onions, 2 tbsp soy sauce, 1 tbsp sesame oil, ginger, and white pepper until well combined.
2. Place 1 tsp filling in center of each wonton wrapper.
3. Wet edges with water. Fold in half diagonally to form triangle, pressing to seal.
4. Bring two bottom corners together, overlapping slightly, and press to seal.
5. Bring large pot of water to boil. Cook wontons in batches for 3-4 minutes until they float. Remove with slotted spoon.
6. In separate large pot, bring chicken broth to boil. Add 2 tbsp soy sauce and 1 tsp sesame oil.
7. Add bok choy, cook for 2 minutes until wilted.
8. Divide cooked wontons among serving bowls (6-8 wontons per bowl).
9. Ladle hot broth and bok choy over wontons.
10. Garnish with sliced green onions and serve immediately.

Dumplings/potstickers.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 lb ground pork, 1 cup wonton wrappers, 6 cups shredded cabbage, 1/3 cup soy sauce, 1.5 tablespoons sesame oil, 2 teaspoons grated ginger, 4 cloves garlic, minced, 3 tablespoons vegetable oil, 1 cup jasmine rice. Finely chop cabbage, salt, squeeze dry. Mix with pork, soy sauce, sesame oil, ginger, garlic. Fill wrappers, pleat edges. Pan-fry bottoms golden, add 1/3 cup water, cover, steam 5 minutes. Uncover to evaporate water and re-crisp bottoms.

Steamed pork buns.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 lb ground pork, 1/2 cup all-purpose flour, 2 1/4 teaspoons active dry yeast (1 packet), 1/4 cup sugar, 1/4 cup soy sauce, 1/4 cup hoisin sauce, 1 tablespoon sesame oil, 1 teaspoon ground ginger, 4 s callions, sliced. Make dough with flour, yeast, sugar, warm water. Let rise. Season pork with soy, hoisin, sesame oil, ginger. Wrap filling in dough rounds, pleat closed. Steam for 15 minutes until fluffy.

Fried rice with everything.directions: Ingredients needed: 4 cups cooked day-old rice, 1/2 lb shrimp (peeled and deveined), 1/2 lb chicken breast (diced), 4 oz Chinese sausage (sliced), 3 eggs (beaten), 4 tbsp vegetable oil (divided), 1/2 cup onion (diced), 1 cup mixed vegetables (peas, 3 cloves garlic (minced), 3 tbsp soy sauce, 1 tbsp oyster sauce, 2 tsp sesame oil, 3 g reen onions (sliced). 1. Heat 1 tbsp oil in large wok over high heat, cook chicken 4-5 min until done, set aside. 2. Add Chinese sausage, cook 2-3 min, set aside. 3. Add shrimp, cook 2-3 min until pink, set aside. 4. Heat 1 tbsp oil, scramble eggs 2 min, set aside. 5. Heat remaining 2 tbsp oil, add onion, cook 2 min. 6. Add garlic, cook 30 sec. 7. Add rice, stir-fry 4-5 min breaking up clumps. 8. Add mixed vegetables, cook 2 min. 9. Return all cooked proteins and eggs to wok. 10. Add soy sauce, oyster sauce, sesame oil, and white pepper, toss 2 min. 11. Garnish with green onions and serve hot.

ingredients: reen onions, white and green parts separated
Toppings: shredded chicken, fried shallots, soft-boiled egg, soy sauce, sesame oil, cilantro, peanuts
Congee/rice porridge.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 cup jasmine or short-grain rice, 8 cups chicken broth or water, 1 inch fresh ginger, sliced, 2 g reen onions, white and green parts separated, 1 tsp salt. 1. Rinse rice until water runs clear. 2. Combine rice, broth, ginger, white parts of green onions, salt in large pot. Bring to boil over high heat. 3. Reduce heat to low, partially cover. Simmer 1-1.5 hours, stirring occasionally, until rice breaks down and mixture is creamy. Add more liquid if too thick. 4. Remove ginger slices. 5. Ladle into bowls, top with shredded chicken, soft-boiled egg, fried shallots, sliced green onions, cilantro, peanuts. Drizzle with soy sauce and sesame oil.

Risotto.directions: Ingredients needed: 6 cups chicken broth, 3 tbsp olive oil, 1 medium yellow onion, chopped, 2 cups Arborio rice, 1/2 cup dry white wine, 4 tbsp butter, 1 cup Parmesan cheese, grated, 2 cups Salt and pepper to taste, 1/4 cup fresh parsley, chopped. 1. Heat chicken broth in saucepan, keep warm over low heat. 2. Heat oil in large heavy-bottomed pot over medium heat. Add onion, cook 4-5 min until soft and translucent. 3. Add rice, stir to coat with oil. Toast 2-3 min, stirring constantly, until edges become translucent. 4. Add wine, stir until absorbed, about 2 min. 5. Add warm broth 1 ladle (about 3/4 cup) at a time, stirring constantly. Wait until each addition is almost completely absorbed before adding next ladle. Continue 18-20 min until rice is creamy and al dente. You may not need all the broth. 6. Remove from heat. Stir in butter and Parmesan vigorously until creamy. Season with salt and pepper. The risotto should be flowing, not stiff. Serve immediately garnished with parsley and more Parmesan.

Cheese risotto with sausage.directions: Ingredients needed: 6 cups chicken broth, 2 tbsp olive oil, 1 lb Italian sausage, casings removed, 2 medium onions, diced, 2 cups Arborio rice, 1/2 cup dry white wine, 4 tbsp butter, 1 cup Parmesan, grated, 1 cup Gruyere, shredded, 1/2 cup Fontina, shredded, 1.5 cups Salt and pepper to taste, 1/4 cup fresh parsley, chopped. 1. Heat chicken broth in saucepan, keep warm over low heat. 2. Heat oil in large heavy-bottomed pot over medium-high heat. Add sausage, breaking up with spoon. Cook 8 min until browned. Remove, leaving drippings. 3. Add onion to pot, cook 4-5 min until soft. Add rice, stir to coat. Toast 2-3 min, stirring, until edges translucent. 4. Add wine, stir until absorbed, about 2 min. Add warm broth 1 ladle (3/4 cup) at a time, stirring constantly. Wait until almost absorbed before adding next ladle. Continue 18-20 min until rice is creamy and al dente. 5. Return sausage to pot. Remove from heat. Stir in butter, Parmesan, Gruyere, and Fontina vigorously until creamy and cheeses melt. Season with salt and pepper. 6. Serve immediately garnished with parsley and more Parmesan.

Arancini.directions: Ingredients needed: 2 cups white rice, 4 cups chicken broth, 8 oz shredded cheese, 1/2 cup grated parmesan cheese, 3 large eggs, 1 cup breadcrumbs, 1/2 cup all-purpose flour, 2 tablespoons vegetable oil. Make risotto with broth and parmesan. Cool. Form balls around cube of mozzarella. Dredge in flour, egg, breadcrumbs. Deep fry at 350°F until golden, 4-5 minutes.

Rice and gravy.directions: Ingredients needed: 2 lbs ground beef, 1 cup jasmine rice, 6 cups beef broth, 1/4 cup flour, 4 tablespoons butter, 1/2 tsp (to taste) black pepper, 2 medium onions, diced. Brown beef, drain. Make roux with butter and flour. Add broth, simmer until gravy forms. Season with salt, pepper, onion powder. Add beef back. Serve over cooked rice.

Dirty rice.directions: Ingredients needed: 2 cups white rice, 1 lb ground beef, 4 lbs chicken, 1 tablespoon Cajun seasoning, 2 cups chicken broth, 3 tablespoons butter, 5 cloves garlic, minced. Finely chop or process chicken livers. Brown beef and livers. Add garlic and Cajun seasoning. Add rice and broth. Cover, simmer 20 minutes until rice is tender. Stir in butter. Season.

Spanish rice.directions: Ingredients needed: 2 cups long-grain white rice, 2 medium onions, diced, 2 bell peppers, sliced, 4 cloves garlic, minced, 1 can (14 oz) diced tomatoes, 3 cups chicken broth, 1 tsp smoked paprika, 1/2 tsp cumin, 1/2 cup frozen peas, 1/4 cup olive oil, 1/2 tsp (to taste) black pepper, 1/2 cup cilantro. 1. Heat olive oil in large skillet over medium heat. Sauté onion and bell pepper 6 min until soft. Add garlic, cook 1 min. 2. Add rice, stir to coat, toast 3 min until slightly golden. 3. Add paprika and cumin, cook 30 sec. Add tomatoes with juice, cook 2 min. 4. Pour in broth, season with 1 tsp salt and pepper. Bring to boil. 5. Reduce heat to low, cover tightly. Simmer 18-20 min until rice is tender and liquid absorbed. 6. Stir in peas, cover, let stand off heat 5 min. Fluff with fork. Garnish with cilantro.

Rice pudding.directions: Ingredients needed: 1/4 cup sugar. Cook rice in milk until soft. Add cream, sugar, vanilla, cook until creamy. Temper in beaten egg. Cook 2 more minutes, stirring. Serve warm or chilled, dusted with cinnamon.

Oatmeal.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 cup old-fashioned rolled oats, 2 cups water or milk, 1/4 tsp salt, 2 tbsp brown sugar or honey, 1/2 tsp cinnamon, 1/4 cup raisins or dried cranberries, 1/4 cup chopped nuts (walnuts or almonds), 2 tbsp butter. 1. Bring water or milk to boil in medium saucepan. 2. Stir in oats and salt, reduce heat to medium-low. 3. Cook, stirring occasionally, 5-7 min until oats are tender and liquid absorbed. 4. Remove from heat, stir in brown sugar, cinnamon, butter. 5. Let stand 2 min to thicken. 6. Divide into bowls, top with raisins, nuts, and fresh berries. Drizzle with honey if desired.

Baked oatmeal.directions: Ingredients needed: 2 cups old-fashioned rolled oats, 1/3 cup brown sugar, 1 tsp baking powder, 1 tsp cinnamon, 1/2 tsp salt, 2 cups milk, 1 egg, 3 tbsp melted butter, 1 tsp vanilla extract, 1 cup fresh or frozen berries, 1/2 cup chopped nuts (optional). 1. Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease 8x8 inch baking dish. 2. Mix oats, brown sugar, baking powder, cinnamon, salt in large bowl. 3. In separate bowl, whisk milk, egg, melted butter, vanilla. 4. Pour wet ingredients into dry, stir to combine. Fold in berries and nuts. 5. Pour into prepared dish, spread evenly. 6. Bake 35-40 min until top is golden and center is set. Let cool 5 min. Serve warm with milk or yogurt.

Grits.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 cup stone-ground grits, 4 tablespoons butter, 1.5 cups milk, 1/2 tsp (to taste) black pepper, 1.5 cups shredded cheese. Bring 4 cups salted water and 1 cup milk to boil. Slowly whisk in 1 cup grits. Reduce heat, cook stirring frequently 20-25 minutes until thick and creamy. Stir in butter and cheese. Season with salt and pepper.

Shrimp and grits.directions: Ingredients needed: 12 oz shrimp, 1 cup stone-ground grits, 6 slices bacon, 4 tablespoons butter, 2 cups shredded cheddar cheese, 4 cups chicken broth, 4 cloves garlic, minced, 1/2 tsp (to taste) black pepper, 1 cup heavy cream. Cook grits in broth with cream until thick, stir in butter and cheese. Cook bacon until crispy, crumble. Sauté garlic in bacon fat, add shrimp, cook until pink. Season with salt and pepper. Serve shrimp over grits, top with bacon.

Polenta.directions: Ingredients needed: 8 oz polenta, 3 tablespoons butter, 1/2 cup grated parmesan cheese, 3 cups chicken broth, 1/2 tsp (to taste) black pepper. Bring broth to boil. Slowly whisk in polenta. Reduce heat, cook stirring frequently 30-40 minutes until creamy and thick. Stir in butter and parmesan. Season with salt and pepper.

Fried polenta.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 cup polenta, 4 tablespoons butter, 1/2 cup grated parmesan cheese, 1/2 tsp (to taste) black pepper, 1/4 cup olive oil. Cook polenta with butter and parmesan until thick. Spread in sheet pan, refrigerate until firm. Cut into squares or triangles. Pan-fry in oil until golden and crispy on both sides. Season with salt.

Cream of wheat.directions: Ingredients needed: 3/4 cup cream, 1.5 cups milk, 3 tablespoons butter, 1/4 cup packed brown sugar, 1.5 teaspoons cinnamon. Bring milk and water to boil with salt. Slowly whisk in cream of wheat. Reduce heat, cook stirring 2-3 minutes. Stir in butter. Serve with brown sugar and cinnamon.

Cinnamon rolls.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 cup flour, 1 packet (2 1/4 tsp) instant yeast, 1 cup milk, 1/4 cup (4 tbsp) butter, 3 large eggs, 1/4 cup sugar, 1.5 teaspoons cinnamon, 1/4 cup packed brown sugar, 8 oz cream cheese, softened, 1/4 cup powdered sugar. Make enriched dough. Roll out, spread with butter, cinnamon, brown sugar. Roll tightly, slice. Rise in pan. Bake at 350°F 25-30 minutes. Top with cream cheese frosting.

Monkey bread.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 lb biscuit dough, 3 tablespoons butter, 1/4 cup packed brown sugar, 1.5 teaspoons cinnamon, 1/4 cup sugar. Cut biscuits into quarters. Roll in cinnamon-sugar mixture. Layer in buttered bundt pan. Melt butter with brown sugar, pour over. Bake at 350°F 35-40 minutes until golden. Invert onto plate while warm.

Bread pudding.directions: Ingredients needed: 1/4 cup sugar. Cube bread, dry out. Mix eggs, milk, cream, sugar, vanilla, cinnamon. Pour over bread with raisins. Let soak 30 minutes. Bake at 350°F 45-50 minutes until set. Serve with bourbon sauce.

Cheese danish.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 (17 oz) package puff pastry, 4 oz cream cheese, 1/4 cup sugar, 3 large eggs, 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract, 1 lemon, juiced. Beat cream cheese with sugar, egg yolk, vanilla, lemon zest. Cut pastry into squares. Fold corners to center, add filling in center well. Brush with egg wash. Bake at 400°F 15-18 minutes.

Croissants.directions: Ingredients needed: 1/2 cup all-purpose flour, 2 1/4 teaspoons active dry yeast (1 packet), 2 cups whole milk, 1/4 cup sugar, 3 tablespoons butter, 6 eggs. Make détrempe dough. Fold in cold butter through multiple turns (lamination). Chill between folds. Shape into crescents. Rise 2 hours. Egg wash. Bake at 400°F 15-18 minutes until golden and flaky.

Beignets.directions: Ingredients needed: 1/4 cup flour, 1 packet (2 1/4 tsp) instant yeast, 1.5 cups milk, 4 large eggs, 4 tablespoons butter, 1/4 cup sugar, 3 tablespoons vegetable oil, 1/4 cup powdered sugar. Warm milk, bloom yeast with 2 tbsp sugar. Add flour, eggs, melted butter, salt. Knead until smooth. Rise 2 hours. Roll 1/4 inch thick, cut squares. Fry at 360°F until puffed and golden. Bury under powdered sugar.

Donuts.directions: Ingredients needed: 1/2 cup all-purpose flour, 1 tablespoon active dry yeast, 1.5 cups milk, 1/4 cup (4 tbsp) butter, 6 eggs, 1/4 cup sugar, 3 tablespoons vegetable oil, 1/4 cup powdered sugar. Warm milk, add yeast and sugar to bloom. Mix with flour, butter, eggs, salt. Knead until smooth. Rise 1 hour. Roll 1/2 inch thick, cut rings. Rise 30 minutes. Fry at 350°F 1-2 minutes per side. Glaze with powdered sugar mixed with milk.

Churros.directions: Ingredients needed: 1/4 cup flour, 3 cups water, 4 tablespoons butter, 3 large eggs, 1/4 cup sugar, 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon, 2 tablespoons vegetable oil, 3 tablespoons chocolate sauce. Boil water with butter and salt. Add flour, stir until ball forms. Cool slightly, beat in eggs. Pipe through star tip into 350°F oil. Fry until golden. Roll in cinnamon-sugar. Serve with chocolate sauce.

Sopapillas.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 cup flour, 1 teaspoon baking powder, 3 tablespoons lard, 3 cups water, 3 tablespoons vegetable oil, 1/4 cup honey, 1/4 cup cinnamon sugar. Mix flour, baking powder, salt, lard. Add water to form dough. Rest 30 minutes. Roll thin, cut into squares. Fry at 375°F until puffed and golden. Serve with honey or dust with cinnamon sugar.

Funnel cake.directions: Ingredients needed: 1/4 cup sugar, 1/4 cup powdered sugar. Mix flour, baking powder, sugar, salt. Add eggs, milk, vanilla to form thin batter. Pour through funnel in circular motion into 375°F oil. Fry 2 minutes per side until golden. Dust heavily with powdered sugar.

ingredients: melted butter, plus more for pan
Crepes.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 cup all-purpose flour, 6 eggs, 1/2 cup whole milk, 1/2 cup water, 2 tablespoons melted butter, plus more for pan, 1/4 teaspoon salt, 2 tablespoons granulated sugar (for sweet crepes), 1/2 cup heavy cream. In a blender, combine flour, eggs, milk, water, melted butter, salt, and sugar. Blend 30 seconds until smooth. Refrigerate batter for at least 30 minutes (or up to 24 hours). Heat an 8-inch non-stick skillet over medium heat. Lightly butter the pan. Pour 1/4 cup batter into center of pan, immediately tilting and swirling to coat bottom evenly. Cook 1-2 minutes until bottom is light golden and edges start to curl. Using a spatula, flip crepe. Cook another 30-60 seconds. Transfer to a plate. Repeat with remaining batter, buttering pan as needed. Stack crepes between parchment paper to prevent sticking. Fill with desired toppings, fold or roll, and serve immediately.

Blintzes.directions: Ingredients needed: 1/2 cup all-purpose flour, 6 eggs, 1.5 cups milk, 1/4 cup (4 tbsp) butter, 1.5 cups shredded cheese, 8 oz cream cheese, softened, 1/4 cup sugar, 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract, 2 lemons, juiced and zested. Make thin crepes. Fill with sweetened ricotta-cream cheese mixture with vanilla and lemon zest. Fold envelope style. Pan-fry in butter until golden. Serve with sour cream and berries.

Dutch baby.directions: Ingredients needed: 3 large eggs, 1/2 cup all-purpose flour, 2 cups whole milk, 4 tablespoons butter, 1/4 cup sugar, 1 teaspoon vanilla extract, 1/4 cup lemon juice, 1/4 cup powdered sugar. Preheat oven to 425°F with cast iron skillet inside. Blend 3 eggs, 1/2 cup flour, 1/2 cup milk, 1 tbsp sugar, vanilla, salt. Add 3 tbsp butter to hot skillet, swirl. Pour in batter. Bake 20-25 minutes until puffed and golden. Serve with lemon juice and powdered sugar.

Clafoutis.directions: Ingredients needed: 1/2 cup cherries, 3 large eggs, 1/4 cup sugar, 1/4 cup flour, 1 cup milk, 4 tablespoons butter, 2 teaspoons vanilla, 1/4 cup powdered sugar. Butter baking dish, arrange cherries. Blend eggs, sugar, flour, milk, vanilla until smooth. Pour over cherries. Bake at 350°F 40-45 minutes until puffed and golden. Dust with powdered sugar.

Flan.directions: Ingredients needed: 1/4 cup sugar. Make caramel: melt 1 cup sugar until amber, pour into pan. Blend 5 eggs, condensed milk, evaporated milk, vanilla. Pour over caramel. Bake in water bath at 325°F 1 hour until set. Cool, refrigerate overnight. Invert to serve.

Cr\u00e8me br\u00fbl\u00e9e.directions: Ingredients needed: 1/4 cup sugar. Heat cream with vanilla. Whisk yolks with 1/2 cup sugar. Temper in cream. Pour into ramekins. Bake in water bath at 325°F 40-45 minutes. Chill. Sprinkle sugar, torch until caramelized.

Panna cotta.directions: Ingredients needed: 3/4 cup heavy cream, 1/4 cup sugar, 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract, 8 oz gelatin, 1 cup milk. Bloom gelatin in cold milk. Heat cream with sugar until sugar dissolves. Add bloomed gelatin, stir until dissolved. Add vanilla. Pour into ramekins. Refrigerate 4+ hours until set. Unmold or serve in ramekin with berries.

Cheesecake.directions: Ingredients needed: 1/4 cup sugar, 1/2 cup sour cream. Make crust, bake briefly. Beat cream cheese with sugar until smooth. Add eggs one at a time. Add sour cream and vanilla. Pour into crust. Bake at 325°F 55-65 minutes until center barely jiggles. Cool slowly.

No-bake cheesecake.directions: Ingredients needed: 1/4 cup powdered sugar. Beat cream cheese with powdered sugar and vanilla until smooth. Whip heavy cream to stiff peaks. Fold into cream cheese mixture with lemon juice. Spread in crust. Refrigerate 4+ hours until set.

Icebox cake.directions: Ingredients needed: 1/4 cup sugar. Whip cream with sugar and vanilla to stiff peaks. Spread cream on cookies, stack into a log. Cover with remaining cream. Refrigerate overnight. Slice on diagonal to serve.

Tres leches cake.directions: Ingredients needed: 1/4 cup sugar. Make sponge cake with eggs, sugar, flour, baking powder, vanilla. Bake at 350°F 25-30 minutes. Mix three milks. Poke holes in warm cake, slowly pour milk mixture over. Refrigerate overnight. Top with whipped cream.

Pound cake.directions: Ingredients needed: 1/4 cup sugar. Cream 1 lb butter with 2 cups sugar. Add 4 eggs one at a time. Mix in 3 cups flour, vanilla, salt. Pour into greased loaf pan. Bake at 325°F 60-75 minutes until toothpick comes out clean. Cool in pan.

Butter cake.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 box (15.25 oz) yellow cake mix, 4 large eggs, divided, 1/2 cup unsalted butter, melted, 16 oz cream cheese, softened, 1 lb powdered sugar, 1 tsp vanilla extract, 1/4 cup unsalted butter, melted (for topping). 1. Preheat oven to 325°F. Grease 9x13-inch baking pan with butter. 2. In large bowl, combine cake mix, 2 eggs, and 1/2 cup melted butter. Mix until dough forms. It will be thick. 3. Press dough evenly into bottom of prepared pan. 4. In separate bowl, beat cream cheese until fluffy, about 2 minutes. 5. Add remaining 2 eggs, powdered sugar, and vanilla. Beat until smooth and creamy, about 3 minutes. 6. Pour cream cheese mixture over cake layer, spreading evenly. 7. Drizzle 1/4 cup melted butter over top. 8. Bake for 45-50 minutes until edges are golden brown and center is set but still slightly gooey. 9. Remove from oven and let cool completely in pan (at least 2 hours). The center will firm up as it cools. 10. Dust generously with powdered sugar before cutting into squares. Serve at room temperature or chilled.

Snickerdoodles.directions: Ingredients needed: 1/4 cup flour, 1/4 cup (4 tbsp) butter, 1/4 cup sugar, 4 large eggs, 1 cup heavy cream, 8 oz baking soda, 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon. Cream butter and sugar. Add eggs. Mix in flour, cream of tartar, baking soda, salt. Roll into balls. Roll in cinnamon-sugar mixture. Bake at 375°F 10-12 minutes until edges set but centers soft.

Sugar cookies.directions: Ingredients needed: 1/2 cup all-purpose flour, 1/4 cup (4 tbsp) butter, 1/4 cup sugar, 3 large eggs, 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract, 1 tablespoon baking powder. Cream butter and sugar. Add eggs and vanilla. Mix in flour, baking powder, salt. Chill 1 hour. Roll out, cut shapes. Bake at 350°F 8-10 minutes until edges barely golden. Cool before frosting if desired.

Peanut butter cookies.directions: Ingredients needed: 1/4 cup sugar, 1/4 cup packed brown sugar. Cream peanut butter with sugars. Add egg, vanilla, baking soda, and salt. Roll into balls, flatten with fork in crosshatch pattern. Bake at 350°F for 10-12 minutes.

Shortbread.directions: Ingredients needed: 3 tablespoons butter, 1/4 cup sugar, 1/4 cup flour, 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract. Cream 1 cup butter with 1/2 cup sugar. Add vanilla, salt, 2 cups flour. Press into pan. Prick with fork. Chill 30 minutes. Bake at 325°F 25-30 minutes until pale golden. Cut while warm.

Chocolate chip cookies.directions: Ingredients needed: 1/4 cup sugar, 1/4 cup packed brown sugar. Cream butter with sugars. Add eggs and vanilla. Mix flour, baking soda, salt. Combine. Fold in chocolate chips. Drop onto sheets. Bake at 375°F 9-11 minutes until edges golden.

Brownies.directions: Ingredients needed: 3 tablespoons butter, 1/4 cup sugar, 1/2 teaspoon cocoa powder, 4 large eggs, 1 cup flour, 2 teaspoons vanilla, 8 oz chocolate chips. Melt butter with sugar and cocoa. Cool slightly. Beat in eggs and vanilla. Fold in flour and salt. Add chocolate chips. Pour into 9x9 pan. Bake at 350°F 25-30 minutes. Cool before cutting.

ingredients: For gravy: 1 cup chicken broth, 2 tbsp soy sauce, 1 tbsp cornstarch, 1 tsp sugar
Egg foo young.directions: Ingredients needed: 6 eggs, beaten, 1 cup bean sprouts, 1/2 cup diced cooked shrimp or pork, 1/4 cup sliced mushrooms, 1/4 cup diced onions, 2 g reen onions, sliced, 1 tsp soy sauce, 1/4 tsp white pepper, 3 tbsp vegetable oil. 1. Make gravy: Whisk broth, soy sauce, cornstarch, sugar in small pot. Bring to boil, simmer 2 min until thickened. Keep warm. 2. Mix eggs, bean sprouts, shrimp, mushrooms, onions, green onions, soy sauce, white pepper in bowl. 3. Heat 1 tbsp oil in skillet over medium-high heat. 4. Ladle 1/2 cup egg mixture into skillet, cook 3 min until bottom sets and browns. Flip, cook 2 min more. 5. Repeat with remaining mixture, adding oil as needed. 6. Serve patties with gravy poured over.

Fried rice cakes.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 lb Korean rice cakes (tteok/garae-tteok), 3 tbsp vegetable oil, 1/2 lb protein (beef, 1 cup cabbage (sliced), 1/2 cup carrot (julienned), 1/2 cup onion (sliced), 4 cloves garlic (minced), 3 tbsp soy sauce, 1 tbsp oyster sauce, 1 tbsp sesame oil, 1 tsp sugar, 2 g reen onions (cut into 2-inch pieces). 1. Soak rice cakes in warm water 10 min if frozen, drain. 2. Heat 2 tbsp oil in large wok over high heat, stir-fry protein 3-4 min until cooked, set aside. 3. Heat remaining oil, add onion and carrot, stir-fry 2 min. 4. Add cabbage, cook 2 min until softened. 5. Add garlic, cook 30 sec. 6. Add rice cakes, stir-fry 3-4 min until lightly golden. 7. Return protein to wok. 8. Add soy sauce, oyster sauce, sugar, and white pepper, toss 2 min. 9. Add green onions and sesame oil, toss 1 min. 10. Garnish with sesame seeds and serve hot.

Bibimbap (no veg).directions: Ingredients needed: 1 cup jasmine rice, 12 oz beef sirloin, 3 large eggs, 2 tablespoons gochujang, 3 tablespoons soy sauce, 1 tablespoon sesame oil, 4 cloves garlic, minced, 1 tablespoon sesame seeds, 2 tablespoons vegetable oil. Cook rice. Marinate sliced beef in soy sauce, sesame oil, garlic. Cook beef until caramelized. Fry egg sunny-side up. Assemble: rice in hot stone bowl, top with beef, fried egg, gochujang. Drizzle sesame oil, sprinkle sesame seeds. Mix before eating.

Gyudon.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 lb thinly sliced beef (ribeye or sirloin), 1 large onion, diced, 1 cup dashi stock (or beef broth), 1/4 cup soy sauce, 3 tablespoons mirin, 2 tablespoons sake, 2 tablespoons sugar, 1 tablespoon vegetable oil, 4 cups cooked short grain rice, 2 g reen onions, sliced, 1 teaspoon ground ginger, 3 large eggs. In bowl, combine dashi, soy sauce, mirin, sake, and sugar. Stir until sugar dissolves. Heat oil in large skillet over medium-high heat. Add onions and cook 4-5 minutes until softened. Add beef slices, separating them. Cook 2-3 minutes until beef is no longer pink. Pour sauce mixture over beef and onions. Bring to simmer. Reduce heat to medium-low. Simmer 8-10 minutes until sauce reduces and flavors concentrate. Taste and adjust seasoning if needed (add soy sauce for saltiness or sugar for sweetness). Divide hot rice among 4 bowls. Spoon beef and onion mixture with sauce over rice. Garnish with sliced green onions and pickled ginger. Add soft-boiled egg if desired. Serve immediately while hot.

Katsudon.directions: Ingredients needed: 3 lbs pork butt, 1 cup jasmine rice, 4 large eggs, 3 tablespoons soy sauce, 2 tablespoons mirin, 1.5 cups dashi, 1/4 cup sugar, 1.5 cups breadcrumbs, 1/2 cup all-purpose flour, 1/4 cup vegetable oil. Make tonkatsu: bread and fry cutlet. Slice into strips. Simmer soy sauce, mirin, dashi, sugar. Add cutlet. Beat eggs lightly, pour around cutlet. Cover, cook until eggs just set. Slide over hot rice in bowl.

Oyakodon.directions: Ingredients needed: 8 boneless skinless chicken thighs (2 lbs), 3 large eggs, 1 cup jasmine rice, 3 tablespoons soy sauce, 3 tablespoons mirin, 1.5 cups dashi, 1/4 cup sugar, 1 large onion, diced. Simmer soy sauce, mirin, dashi, sugar. Add sliced chicken, cook 5 minutes. Beat eggs lightly, pour around chicken. Cover, cook until eggs just set. Slide over hot rice. Garnish with green onions.

Tonkatsu.directions: Ingredients needed: 3 lbs pork butt, 1 cup flour, 4 large eggs, 1 cup breadcrumbs, 1/2 tsp (to taste) black pepper, 1/4 cup vegetable oil, 1/4 cup tonkatsu sauce, 6 cups shredded cabbage. Pound cutlets thin. Season with salt and pepper. Dredge in flour, beaten egg, panko. Deep fry at 350°F 5-6 minutes until deep golden. Rest, slice. Serve with shredded cabbage and tonkatsu sauce.

ingredients: boneless skinless chicken breasts (6 oz each)
For tonkatsu sauce: 1/4 cup ketchup, 2 tablespoons Worcestershire sauce, 1 tablespoon soy sauce, 1 tablespoon sugar
Chicken katsu.directions: Ingredients needed: 4 boneless skinless chicken breasts (6 oz each), 1 cup all-purpose flour, 3 large eggs, 2 cups panko breadcrumbs, 2 cups Salt and pepper to taste, 6 cups shredded cabbage. Pound chicken breasts to even 1/2-inch thickness between plastic wrap using meat mallet. Season both sides with salt and pepper. Set up breading station: flour in first dish, beaten eggs in second, panko in third. Coat each chicken breast in flour, shaking off excess. Dip in egg, then press into panko to coat thoroughly. Heat 1 inch oil in large skillet to 350°F over medium-high heat. Fry chicken 3-4 minutes per side until golden brown and internal temp reaches 165°F. Drain on wire rack or paper towels. Make sauce: Whisk together ketchup, Worcestershire, soy sauce, and sugar. Slice chicken into strips. Serve over rice with shredded cabbage, tonkatsu sauce, and lemon wedges.

Japanese curry.directions: Ingredients needed: 2.5 lbs beef, 4 medium russet potatoes, cubed, 1 lb Japanese curry roux, 2 cups water, 3 tablespoons vegetable oil, 1.5 cups long-grain white rice. Cut beef into cubes, brown in oil. Add cubed potatoes and water. Simmer 20 minutes until potatoes are tender. Break curry roux blocks into pot, stir until dissolved and thickened. Serve over rice.

ingredients: boneless skinless chicken thighs, cut into bite-sized pieces
For teriyaki sauce: 1/2 cup soy sauce, 1/4 cup mirin, 1/4 cup sake, 3 tablespoons sugar, 2 cloves garlic minced, 1 teaspoon ginger grated
Teriyaki chicken.directions: Ingredients needed: 1.5 lbs boneless skinless chicken thighs, cut into bite-sized pieces, 2 tablespoons vegetable oil, 1 tablespoon cornstarch mixed with 2 tablespoons water, 1 large onion, diced, 2 cups white rice. Combine soy sauce, mirin, sake, sugar, garlic, and ginger in bowl. Whisk until sugar dissolves. Heat oil in large skillet over medium-high heat. Add chicken pieces in single layer. Cook 3-4 minutes without moving until golden brown. Flip and cook another 3-4 minutes until cooked through (165°F internal temp). Pour teriyaki sauce over chicken. Bring to simmer. Cook 2-3 minutes, turning chicken to coat in sauce. Stir cornstarch slurry and add to pan. Cook 1-2 minutes until sauce thickens and becomes glossy. Remove from heat when sauce coats chicken nicely. Serve over steamed rice. Garnish with sesame seeds and green onions.

Teriyaki beef.directions: Ingredients needed: 12 oz beef sirloin, 1/4 cup soy sauce, 3 tablespoons mirin, 1/3 cup sake, 1/4 cup packed brown sugar, 6 cloves garlic, minced, 1 tablespoon fresh ginger, minced, 1 tablespoon sesame seeds, 2 cups white rice. Slice beef thin. Make teriyaki: simmer soy sauce, mirin, sake, sugar until slightly thickened. Stir-fry beef quickly over high heat. Add teriyaki sauce. Serve over rice with sesame seeds.

Yakitori.directions: Ingredients needed: 2 lbs chicken thighs, 3 tablespoons soy sauce, 2 tablespoons mirin, 1/3 cup sake, 1/4 cup sugar, 4 cloves garlic, minced, 1 tablespoon sesame seeds. Cut chicken into bite-sized pieces. Make tare: simmer soy sauce, mirin, sake, sugar until slightly thickened. Thread chicken on skewers. Grill, brushing with tare frequently, until charred and cooked through. Garnish with sesame seeds.

Tsukune.directions: Ingredients needed: 4 lbs chicken, 4 egg yolks, 1/4 cup soy sauce, 3 tablespoons mirin, 1/4 cup sake, 1/4 cup sugar, 2 teaspoons grated ginger, 1 cup panko breadcrumbs. Mix ground chicken with panko, ginger, salt. Form into oval meatballs on skewers. Grill, basting with tare made from soy, mirin, sake, sugar. Serve with raw egg yolk for dipping.

Gyoza.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 lb ground pork, 1/2 cup gyoza wrappers, 6 cups shredded cabbage, 4 cloves garlic, minced, 2 teaspoons grated ginger, 1/4 cup soy sauce, 1.5 tablespoons sesame oil, 2 tablespoons vegetable oil, 1 cup jasmine rice. Finely chop cabbage, salt and squeeze dry. Mix with pork, garlic, ginger, soy sauce, sesame oil. Fill wrappers, pleat and seal. Pan-fry bottom until golden, add water, cover to steam 5 minutes. Remove lid to evaporate water and crisp. Serve with soy-vinegar dipping sauce.

Ramen (simplified).directions: Ingredients needed: 4 packages instant ramen noodles, 6 cups chicken broth, 2 tbsp soy sauce, 1 tbsp miso paste, 2 tsp sesame oil, 4 eggs (soft boiled), 1 cup sliced pork (cooked), 2 g reen onions (sliced), 1 cup bamboo shoots, 4 s heets nori (seaweed). 1. Bring chicken broth to boil in large pot. 2. Add soy sauce, miso paste, and sesame oil, stir to combine. 3. Add ramen noodles, cook 3-4 min until tender. 4. Soft boil eggs 6-7 min, cool in ice bath, peel and halve. 5. Divide noodles and broth among 4 bowls. 6. Top each with sliced pork, green onions, bamboo shoots, nori sheet, and soft boiled egg. 7. Drizzle with chili oil if desired. 8. Serve immediately.

Shoyu ramen.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 lb fresh ramen noodles, 2 tbsp soy sauce, 1 tbsp sake, 1 tbsp mirin, 4 s oft boiled eggs (halved), 2 cups bamboo shoots, 4 s heets nori, 2 g reen onions (sliced), 1 tsp sesame oil per bowl. 1. Make broth: combine chicken stock, soy sauce, sake, and mirin in pot, bring to boil, simmer 10 min. 2. Cook ramen noodles in separate pot according to package, drain. 3. Prepare chashu pork and soft boil eggs. 4. Divide noodles among 4 bowls. 5. Ladle hot broth over noodles. 6. Top each with chashu pork slices, bamboo shoots, soft boiled egg, nori, and green onions. 7. Drizzle 1 tsp sesame oil over each bowl. 8. Serve immediately.

Miso ramen.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 lb fresh ramen noodles, 1/4 cup red miso paste, 2 tbsp white miso paste, 2 tbsp sake, 1 tbsp sesame paste (tahini), 2 cloves garlic (minced), 1 tbsp ginger (minced), 4 s oft boiled eggs, 2 cups corn kernels, 2 cups bean sprouts, 2 g reen onions (sliced). 1. Heat chicken stock in large pot. 2. Whisk in miso pastes, sake, sesame paste, garlic, and ginger, simmer 15 min. 3. Cook ground pork in skillet with garlic until browned. 4. Cook ramen noodles according to package, drain. 5. Soft boil eggs 6-7 min. 6. Divide noodles among 4 bowls. 7. Ladle hot miso broth over noodles. 8.
