Gently mix crab with mayo, egg, Dijon, Worcestershire, Old Bay, and enough breadcrumbs to bind. Form into patties, refrigerate 1 hour. Coat lightly with more breadcrumbs. Pan-fry in butter over medium heat 4 minutes per side until golden.

Crab rangoon.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 cup wonton wrappers, 8 oz cream cheese, softened, 12 oz crab meat, 5 cloves garlic, minced, 2 tablespoons Worcestershire sauce, 3 tablespoons vegetable oil, 3 tablespoons sweet chili sauce. Mix cream cheese, crab, garlic powder, Worcestershire, salt. Place 1 tsp filling on wonton wrapper. Wet edges, fold into triangle, press to seal. Deep fry at 350°F 2-3 minutes until golden. Serve with sweet chili sauce.

ingredients: thick cod or haddock fillets, cut into 4-6 pieces
1/2 cups cold beer or sparkling water
Fish and chips.directions: Ingredients needed: 2 lbs thick cod or haddock fillets, cut into 4-6 pieces, 2 lbs russet potatoes, cut into 1/2-inch chips, 2 cups all-purpose flour, divided, 1 cup cornstarch, 2 tsp baking powder, 1 tsp salt, plus more for seasoning, 1/2 tsp black pepper, 1 1/2 cups cold beer or sparkling water. 1. Heat oil in deep fryer or large heavy pot to 325°F for chips. 2. Rinse potato chips in cold water, pat completely dry with towels. 3. Fry chips in batches 5-6 min until tender but not browned. Drain on paper towels. Set aside. 4. Increase oil temperature to 375°F. 5. Pat fish completely dry. Season with salt and pepper. Dust lightly with 1/2 cup flour, shake off excess. 6. Make batter: Whisk together 1 1/2 cups flour, cornstarch, baking powder, and 1 tsp salt. Add cold beer, whisk until smooth but slightly lumpy. Don't overmix. Batter should coat spoon thickly. 7. Dip fish pieces in batter, let excess drip off. Carefully lower into 375°F oil. Fry 2-3 pieces at a time, 5-7 min, turning once, until deep golden and crispy. Internal temp 145°F. Drain on paper towels. 8. Return chips to 375°F oil in batches, fry 2-3 min until golden and crispy. Drain, season immediately with salt. 9. Serve fish and chips hot with malt vinegar, lemon wedges, and tartar sauce.

Blackened fish.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 lb white fish fillets, 2 teaspoons Cajun seasoning, 1/2 teaspoon paprika, 1/4 tsp cayenne pepper, 4 cloves garlic, minced, 2 teaspoons dried oregano, 3 tablespoons butter. Coat fish with melted butter then blackening spice generously. Heat cast iron until smoking. Cook fish 3-4 minutes per side. Spices will char, creating the 'blackened' crust.

Pan-seared salmon.directions: Ingredients needed: 1.5 lbs salmon fillet, 3 tablespoons olive oil, 4 tablespoons butter, 1/4 cup lemon juice, 5 cloves garlic, minced, 2 tablespoons fresh dill, chopped, 1/2 tsp (to taste) black pepper. Season salmon with salt and pepper. Heat oil in oven-safe skillet. Sear skin-side down 4 minutes. Flip, add butter and garlic. Transfer to 400°F oven 5 minutes. Finish with lemon and dill.

Teriyaki salmon.directions: Ingredients needed: 6 (5 oz) salmon portions, 1/4 cup soy sauce, 1/4 cup mirin, 3 tablespoons sake, 1/4 cup packed brown sugar, 6 cloves garlic, minced, 1 tablespoon fresh ginger, minced, 1 tablespoon sesame seeds, 1 cup jasmine rice. Make teriyaki sauce: simmer soy, mirin, sake, sugar, garlic, ginger. Marinate salmon 30 minutes. Broil or pan-sear, basting with sauce, until caramelized. Serve over rice with sesame seeds.

Miso glazed salmon.directions: Ingredients needed: 4 (6 oz) salmon fillets, 2 tablespoons miso paste, 2 tablespoons mirin, 1/3 cup sake, 1/4 cup packed brown sugar, 1/3 cup soy sauce. Mix miso, mirin, sake, sugar, soy sauce. Marinate salmon 30 minutes to 2 hours. Remove from marinade. Broil 4-6 minutes until caramelized and fish flakes, watching closely as it can burn quickly.

Salmon patties.directions: Ingredients needed: 1.5 lbs salmon fillet, 1 cup breadcrumbs, 4 large eggs, 1/4 cup mayonnaise, 1 tablespoon Dijon mustard, 2 tablespoons lemon juice, 1/2 tsp (to taste) black pepper, 4 tablespoons butter. Mix drained salmon with breadcrumbs, egg, mayo, Dijon, lemon juice, salt, pepper. Form patties. Pan-fry in butter over medium heat 4-5 minutes per side until golden and heated through.

Tuna patties.directions: Ingredients needed: 4 (6 oz) tuna steaks, 1.5 cups breadcrumbs, 4 large eggs, 1/4 cup mayonnaise, 2 tablespoons Dijon mustard, 2 tablespoons lemon juice, 1/2 tsp (to taste) black pepper, 4 tablespoons butter. Mix drained tuna with breadcrumbs, egg, mayo, Dijon, lemon juice, salt, pepper. Form patties. Pan-fry in butter 3-4 minutes per side until golden.

ingredients: (10.5 oz each) cream of celery soup
butter (2 for sauté, 2 melted for topping)
Tuna noodle casserole.directions: Ingredients needed: 3 cans (5 oz each) tuna, drained, 12 oz egg noodles, 2 cans (10.5 oz each) cream of celery soup, 1 cup mayonnaise, 1 cup frozen peas and carrots, 1 cup shredded Swiss cheese, 1 cup crushed Ritz crackers, 1/2 cup milk, 1 s mall onion, finely diced, 2 celery stalks, diced, 4 tbsp butter (2 for sauté, 2 melted for topping), 1 tsp lemon juice, 1/2 tsp salt, 1/4 tsp black pepper, 1/4 tsp celery salt. 1. Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease a 9x13 baking dish. 2. Cook egg noodles according to package. Drain. 3. Melt 2 tbsp butter in skillet. Sauté onion and celery 5-6 minutes until softened. 4. In large bowl, mix cream of celery soup, mayonnaise, milk, lemon juice, salt, pepper, and celery salt. 5. Fold in cooked noodles, tuna, sautéed vegetables, frozen peas and carrots, and Swiss cheese. 6. Transfer to baking dish. In small bowl, mix crushed crackers with 2 tbsp melted butter. Sprinkle over casserole. 7. Bake 30-35 minutes until bubbly and topping is golden brown. Let rest 5 minutes.

Tuna rice bowl.directions: Ingredients needed: 4 (6 oz) tuna steaks, 1 cup jasmine rice, 1/3 cup soy sauce, 1.5 tablespoons sesame oil, 2 tablespoons sesame seeds, 2 ripe avocados, diced, 6 nori sheets, 1 teaspoon wasabi powder. Cube raw tuna. Marinate briefly in soy sauce and sesame oil. Serve over hot rice. Top with avocado slices, sesame seeds, nori strips. Serve with wasabi on side.

Spam musubi.directions: Ingredients needed: 1/2 cup Spam, 1.5 cups long-grain white rice, 2 s heets nori, 3 tablespoons soy sauce, 1/4 cup sugar, 8 oz furikake. Slice Spam, pan-fry with soy sauce and sugar until glazed. Press rice into musubi mold or Spam can. Top with Spam slice and furikake. Wrap with nori strip.

Spam fried rice.directions: Ingredients needed: 4 cups cooked day-old rice, 1 can (12 oz) Spam (diced), 3 eggs (beaten), 3 tbsp vegetable oil (divided), 1/2 cup onion (diced), 1/2 cup frozen peas and carrots, 3 cloves garlic (minced), 3 tbsp soy sauce, 1 tbsp oyster sauce, 1 tbsp sesame oil, 2 g reen onions (sliced). 1. Heat 1 tbsp oil in large wok over medium-high heat, fry Spam cubes 4-5 min until crispy and browned, set aside. 2. Heat 1 tbsp oil, scramble eggs 2 min, set aside. 3. Heat remaining oil over high heat, add onion, cook 2 min. 4. Add garlic, cook 30 sec. 5. Add rice, stir-fry 4-5 min breaking up clumps. 6. Add peas and carrots, cook 2 min. 7. Return Spam and eggs to wok. 8. Add soy sauce, oyster sauce, sesame oil, and white pepper, toss 2 min. 9. Garnish with green onions and serve hot.

Kalua pork.directions: Ingredients needed: 3-4 lbs pork shoulder, 1 cup Hawaiian salt, 1/2 cup liquid smoke. Score pork shoulder. Rub generously with Hawaiian salt and liquid smoke. Wrap tightly in foil. Slow roast at 275°F 8-10 hours until very tender. Shred with forks.

Chicken long rice.directions: Ingredients needed: 8 boneless skinless chicken thighs (2 lbs), 12 oz wide noodles, 3 cups chicken broth, 1 teaspoon ground ginger, 1 medium yellow onion, chopped, 3 tablespoons soy sauce, 1.5 tablespoons sesame oil. Simmer chicken in broth with ginger until cooked. Shred chicken. Soak noodles. Add noodles to broth, cook until tender. Add soy sauce, sesame oil. Top with chicken and green onions.

Beef stew (no veg).directions: Ingredients needed: 3 lbs beef chuck, cut into 1.5-inch cubes, 1/4 cup all-purpose flour, 6 cups beef broth, 1 cup red wine, 3 tbsp tomato paste, 1 onion, diced, 4 cloves garlic, minced, 2 bay leaves, 1 tbsp Worcestershire sauce, 1 tsp dried thyme, 1 tsp paprika, 2 tbsp vegetable oil. 1. Season beef with salt and pepper, toss with flour. In Dutch oven, heat oil over medium-high. Brown beef in batches, 8-10 min total. Remove and set aside. 2. In same pot, sauté onion 5 min. Add garlic, cook 1 min. Add tomato paste, cook 2 min. 3. Pour in wine, scrape up browned bits. Add broth, Worcestershire, bay leaves, thyme, paprika. 4. Return beef to pot. Bring to boil, reduce to low simmer. Cover and cook 2-2.5 hours until beef is fork-tender. 5. Uncover, simmer 15 min to thicken if desired. Remove bay leaves. Season with salt and pepper. Garnish with parsley.

ingredients: lamb shoulder or beef chuck, cut into 1.5-inch cubes
Irish stew (simplified).directions: Ingredients needed: 2 lbs lamb shoulder or beef chuck, cut into 1.5-inch cubes, 6 medium potatoes, peeled and quartered, 3 large onions, sliced thick, 6 cups beef or chicken broth, 2 tbsp fresh thyme leaves, 2 bay leaves, 2 tbsp butter, 2 tbsp flour. 1. Season meat with salt and pepper. In Dutch oven, brown meat in 2 tbsp oil over medium-high heat, 8-10 min. Remove and set aside. 2. Layer half the onions in pot, then half the potatoes. Add meat. Layer remaining onions and potatoes on top. 3. Add broth, thyme, bay leaves. Bring to boil, reduce to low simmer. Cover and cook 1.5-2 hours until meat is very tender. 4. In small pan, melt butter, whisk in flour to make roux. Cook 2 min. 5. Stir roux into stew to thicken. Simmer 10 min more. Remove bay leaves. Season with salt and pepper. Garnish with parsley.

Lamb chops.directions: Ingredients needed: 1.5 lbs lamb leg, 3 tablespoons olive oil, 6 cloves garlic, minced, 1 tablespoon dried rosemary, 1 teaspoon dried thyme, 1/4 cup (4 tbsp) butter, 1/2 tsp (to taste) black pepper. Season chops with salt and pepper. Sear in hot oil 3-4 minutes per side for medium-rare. Add butter, garlic, rosemary, thyme. Baste with butter. Rest 5 minutes. Serve with pan juices.

Rack of lamb.directions: Ingredients needed: 1.5 lbs lamb leg, 1 tablespoon Dijon mustard, 1 cup breadcrumbs, 6 cloves garlic, minced, 2 tablespoons fresh rosemary, chopped, 1/2 teaspoon thyme, 1/4 cup olive oil, 1/2 tsp (to taste) black pepper. Season rack with salt and pepper. Sear fat-side down 4 minutes. Brush with mustard. Press on herb-breadcrumb mixture. Roast at 400°F 20-25 minutes for medium-rare (130°F). Rest 10 minutes. Slice between bones.

Lamb shanks.directions: Ingredients needed: 3 lbs lamb stew meat, 3 cups beef broth, 1/2 cup dry wine, 1/4 cup tomato paste, 5 cloves garlic, minced, 1 tablespoon dried rosemary, 1 teaspoon dried thyme, 1/4 cup (4 tbsp) butter, 1 cup flour. Season shanks, brown all sides. Remove. Sauté garlic, add tomato paste. Add wine, reduce by half. Add broth, herbs. Return shanks. Braise covered at 325°F 2.5-3 hours until fork tender.

Shepherd's pie (no veg).directions: Ingredients needed: 2 lbs ground lamb, 2 lbs russet potatoes, peeled and cubed, 1 large onion, diced, 4 cloves garlic, minced, 2 cups lamb or beef broth, 2 tbsp tomato paste, 3 tbsp Worcestershire sauce, 2 tbsp flour, 1/2 cup heavy cream, 4 tbsp butter, 2 tsp fresh rosemary, minced, 2 tsp fresh thyme, 1/2 tsp (to taste) black pepper. 1. Preheat oven to 400°F. Boil potatoes in salted water until tender, 15 min. Drain, mash with butter and cream. Season well. 2. Heat 2 tbsp olive oil in skillet over high heat. Brown lamb, breaking up, 8-10 min. Season with salt and pepper. Remove to plate. 3. Sauté onion in same pan 5 min. Add garlic, cook 1 min. 4. Return lamb. Sprinkle flour, stir 2 min. Add tomato paste, cook 1 min. 5. Add broth, Worcestershire, rosemary, and thyme. Simmer 15 min until thick. Adjust seasoning. 6. Transfer to 9x13 dish. Spread mashed potatoes on top. Create texture with fork. 7. Bake 25-30 min until golden and bubbling. Rest 10 min.

ingredients: FOR PASTRY: 3 cups all-purpose flour, 3/4 cup cold butter cubed, 3/4 cup cold lard or shortening cubed, 1 tsp salt, 1/2 cup ice water
FOR FILLING: 1 lb beef skirt steak, diced small, 2 potatoes peeled and diced small, 1 small rutabaga peeled and diced small, 1 onion diced, 2 tbsp butter, salt, black pepper
Cornish pasty (simplified).directions: Ingredients needed: 1 egg beaten for egg wash. 1. MAKE PASTRY: Mix flour and salt. Cut in butter and lard until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Add ice water gradually, mixing until dough comes together. Form into disk, wrap, refrigerate 1 hour. 2. PREPARE FILLING: Mix beef, potatoes, rutabaga, and onion. Season generously with salt and pepper. 3. Preheat oven to 400°F. Line baking sheet with parchment. 4. Divide pastry into 4 pieces. Roll each into 8-inch circle. 5. Mound filling on one half of each circle. Dot with butter. Brush edges with water. Fold over to form half-moon. Crimp edges decoratively to seal. 6. Place on baking sheet. Cut small steam vent in top. Brush with egg wash. 7. Bake 45-50 min until golden brown. Reduce temp to 350°F if browning too quickly. 8. Cool 10 min before eating. Filling should be tender and juicy.

Meat pie.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 lb ground beef, 1 cup pie crust, 2 medium onions, diced, 6 cups beef broth, 3 tablespoons Worcestershire sauce, 1/2 cup all-purpose flour, 3 tablespoons butter, 1 lb 1, sliced pepper. Brown beef with onion. Add flour, then broth and Worcestershire. Season and simmer until thickened. Pour into pie crust, top with second crust, seal edges. Bake at 375°F for 40 minutes until golden.

Steak and kidney pie.directions: Ingredients needed: 1.5 lbs beef chuck cubed, 8 oz beef kidneys cleaned and cubed, 1/4 cup flour, 3 tbsp vegetable oil, 2 onions diced, 8 oz mushrooms sliced, 2 cups beef broth, 1/2 cup red wine, 2 tbsp Worcestershire sauce, 2 bay leaves, 1 tsp thyme, 1 package (14 oz) puff pastry, 1 egg beaten. 1. Preheat oven to 325°F. Toss beef and kidneys with flour, salt, and pepper. 2. Heat oil in Dutch oven over high heat. Brown meat in batches, 3-4 min per batch. Remove and set aside. 3. Add onions and mushrooms, cook 5 min. Return meat to pot. 4. Add broth, wine, Worcestershire, bay leaves, and thyme. Bring to simmer, cover and bake 2 hours until very tender. 5. Remove bay leaves, transfer filling to pie dish. Let cool slightly. Top with puff pastry, brush with egg. 6. Bake at 400°F for 25-30 min until pastry is golden brown and puffed. Serve hot.

Pot roast.directions:
Ingredients needed: 3-4 lbs beef chuck roast, 2 tbsp vegetable oil, 2 cups beef broth, 1 cup red wine (or additional beef broth), 3 tbsp tomato paste, 4 cloves garlic, minced, 2 bay leaves, 1 tbsp Worcestershire sauce, 1 tsp dried thyme, 1 tsp dried rosemary, 2 tsp salt, 1 tsp black pepper, 1 lb carrots, cut into 2-inch pieces, 1 lb small potatoes, halved, 1 large onion, cut into wedges, 3 celery stalks, cut into 2-inch pieces, 3 tbsp flour (for gravy). 1. Preheat oven to 325°F.
2. Pat 3-4 lbs chuck roast dry and season all over with 2 tsp salt and 1 tsp black pepper.
3. Heat 2 tbsp oil in a large Dutch oven over medium-high heat. Sear roast 4-5 minutes per side until deeply browned on all sides. Remove to a plate.
4. Add 4 cloves minced garlic to pot and cook 30 seconds. Add 3 tbsp tomato paste and cook 1 minute, stirring.
5. Add 2 cups beef broth, 1 cup red wine, 1 tbsp Worcestershire sauce, 1 tsp thyme, 1 tsp rosemary, and 2 bay leaves. Stir and scrape up browned bits.
6. Return roast to pot. Arrange 1 lb carrots, 1 lb potatoes, 1 onion (cut into wedges), and 3 celery stalks around the roast.
7. Bring to a simmer, then cover and transfer to oven.
8. Braise at 325°F for 3-3.5 hours until meat is fork-tender and vegetables are soft.
9. Remove roast and vegetables to a serving platter. Cover with foil to keep warm.
10. Remove bay leaves from liquid. Skim fat from surface. In a small bowl, whisk 3 tbsp flour with 1/4 cup of the cooking liquid until smooth. Whisk into pot.
11. Bring to a simmer on stovetop over medium heat. Cook 3-5 minutes, stirring, until gravy thickens. Season with salt and pepper.
12. Slice roast and serve with vegetables and gravy.

Yankee pot roast.directions: Ingredients needed: 3-4 lb chuck roast, 2 tbsp vegetable oil, 2 tsp salt, 1 tsp black pepper, 4 carrots cut into chunks, 1 lb baby potatoes halved, 1 onion quartered, 4 cloves garlic, 2 cups beef broth, 1 cup red wine, 3 sprigs fresh thyme, 2 bay leaves, 2 tbsp tomato paste. 1. Preheat oven to 325°F. Pat roast dry and season generously with salt and pepper. 2. Heat oil in Dutch oven over medium-high heat. Sear roast 4-5 min per side until deep brown crust forms. Remove and set aside. 3. Add onion, carrots, and garlic to pot. Cook 3-4 min. Stir in tomato paste, cook 1 min. 4. Add wine, scraping up browned bits. Add broth, thyme, and bay leaves. Bring to simmer. 5. Return roast to pot with potatoes. Cover tightly with lid. 6. Braise in oven 3-3.5 hours until meat is fork-tender. 7. Let rest 15 min. Slice and serve with vegetables and pan sauce.

Beef on weck.directions: Ingredients needed: 3 lbs beef brisket, 2 cups kummelweck rolls, 2.5 lbs beef, 2 tablespoons prepared horseradish. Warm thinly sliced roast beef in jus. Dip bottom of roll in jus. Pile beef on roll. Spread horseradish on top bun. The caraway and salt on the roll are essential.

Roast beef and gravy.directions: Ingredients needed: 2 lbs beef chuck roast, 3 cups beef broth, 1 cup flour, 3 tablespoons butter, 1/2 tsp (to taste) black pepper, 4 cloves garlic, minced, 2 teaspoons fresh thyme. Season roast with salt, pepper, garlic powder, thyme. Roast at 325°F until desired doneness. Rest. Make gravy with pan drippings: add butter and flour, cook 1 minute, whisk in broth until thick. Slice beef, serve with gravy.

Prime rib.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 cup prime rib roast, 1/2 tsp (to taste) black pepper, 4 cloves garlic, minced, 1/2 teaspoon thyme, 1 tablespoon dried rosemary, 1/4 cup (4 tbsp) butter. Season roast generously, refrigerate overnight uncovered. Bring to room temp 2 hours before cooking. Roast at 500°F 15 minutes, reduce to 325°F. Cook until internal temp 120°F for medium-rare. Rest 20 minutes.

ingredients: ribeye steaks (1.5 inches thick, about 12 oz each)
Ribeye steak.directions: Ingredients needed: 2 ribeye steaks (1.5 inches thick, about 12 oz each), 2 tsp coarse salt, 1 tsp black pepper, 2 tbsp vegetable oil, 4 tbsp butter, 4 cloves garlic smashed, 2 sprigs fresh thyme, 2 sprigs fresh rosemary. 1. Remove steaks from refrigerator 1 hour before cooking. Pat completely dry, season generously with salt and pepper on all sides. 2. Heat cast iron skillet over high heat until smoking. Add oil. 3. Place steaks in skillet, cook undisturbed 3-4 min until deep brown crust forms. Flip and cook 3-4 min more. 4. Reduce heat to medium. Add butter, garlic, and herbs. Tilt pan and continuously baste steaks with melted butter 2-3 min until internal temp reaches 125°F (medium-rare) or 135°F (medium). 5. Transfer steaks to cutting board, tent with foil, rest 5-10 min. 6. Slice against the grain and serve with pan juices.

New York strip.directions: Ingredients needed: 2 lbs ribeye steak, 1/2 tsp (to taste) black pepper, 1/4 cup (4 tbsp) butter, 6 cloves garlic, minced, 1 teaspoon dried thyme. Bring steak to room temp. Season heavily with salt and pepper. Sear in very hot pan 4-5 minutes per side for medium-rare. Add butter, garlic, thyme. Baste. Rest 5 minutes.

Filet mignon.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 cup filet mignon, 1/2 tsp (to taste) black pepper, 1/4 cup (4 tbsp) butter, 4 cloves garlic, minced, 2 tablespoons olive oil. Season filet with salt and pepper. Sear in hot oil and butter 4 minutes per side for medium-rare. Add garlic last minute, baste with butter. Rest 5 minutes. Internal temp 130°F for medium-rare.

ingredients: filet mignon or strip steaks (8 oz each), 1 1/2 inches thick
Steak au poivre.directions: Ingredients needed: 4 filet mignon or strip steaks (8 oz each), 1 1/2 inches thick, 3 tbsp black peppercorns, coarsely crushed, 2 tbsp olive oil, 2 tbsp butter, 1/4 cup cognac or brandy, 1 cup heavy cream, 1 tbsp Dijon mustard. 1. Pat steaks completely dry. Season with salt. Press crushed peppercorns firmly onto both sides of each steak. Let stand 20 min at room temp. 2. Heat olive oil in large heavy skillet over medium-high heat until shimmering. 3. Add steaks, cook without moving 4 min until dark crust forms. Flip, cook 3-4 min more for medium-rare (130°F internal temp). Adjust time for desired doneness. Transfer to plate, tent with foil. 4. Reduce heat to medium. Pour off excess fat. Add cognac to pan, carefully ignite with long match or tip pan toward flame. Let flames die down. 5. Add cream and mustard, scraping up browned bits. Simmer 3-4 min until sauce thickens enough to coat spoon. 6. Swirl in butter. Taste, adjust seasoning with salt. 7. Pour sauce over steaks. Serve immediately with frites or mashed potatoes.

Steak diane.directions: Ingredients needed: 4 beef tenderloin steaks (6 oz each, 4 tbsp butter (divided), 2 tbsp olive oil, 3 s hallots (minced), 8 oz mushrooms (sliced), 3 cloves garlic (minced), 1/4 cup cognac, 1 cup beef stock, 2 tbsp Worcestershire sauce, 1 tbsp Dijon mustard, 1/2 cup heavy cream, 2 tbsp fresh parsley (chopped). 1. Season steaks generously with salt and pepper. 2. Heat oil and 2 tbsp butter in large skillet over high heat until smoking. 3. Sear steaks 2-3 min per side for medium-rare, remove and keep warm. 4. Reduce heat to medium, add remaining butter, shallots, and mushrooms, sauté 5-6 min until golden. 5. Add garlic, cook 1 min until fragrant. 6. Remove from heat, add cognac, return to heat and flambe carefully until flames subside. 7. Add beef stock, Worcestershire, and mustard, simmer 3-4 min until reduced by half. 8. Stir in cream, simmer 2-3 min until sauce thickens. 9. Return steaks to pan with any accumulated juices, spoon sauce over, cook 1 min. 10. Garnish with parsley and serve immediately.

ingredients: ribeye or strip steaks (12 oz each, 1.5 inches thick)
For fries: 4 large russet potatoes, vegetable oil for frying, salt
Steak frites.directions: Ingredients needed: 2 ribeye or strip steaks (12 oz each, 1.5 inches thick), 2 tsp salt, 1 tsp black pepper, 2 tbsp vegetable oil, 4 tbsp butter, 4 cloves garlic smashed, 2 sprigs thyme. 1. For fries: Cut potatoes into 1/4-inch sticks, soak in cold water 30 min. Drain and pat dry. Heat oil to 325°F, fry 5-7 min until tender but not browned. Drain. Increase oil to 375°F, fry again 3-4 min until golden and crispy. Drain and season with salt. 2. For steaks: Remove from refrigerator 1 hour before cooking. Pat dry, season generously with salt and pepper. 3. Heat oil in cast iron skillet over high heat. Sear steaks 3-4 min per side. 4. Reduce heat to medium, add butter, garlic, and thyme. Baste steaks 2-3 min until internal temp reaches 130°F for medium-rare. 5. Let rest 10 min. Slice steaks and serve with hot fries.

Country fried steak.directions: Ingredients needed: 4 (8 oz) sirloin steaks, 1/2 cup all-purpose flour, 4 large eggs, 1.5 cups milk, 1/2 tsp (to taste) black pepper, 4 cloves garlic, minced, 2 tablespoons vegetable oil. Pound steaks thin. Season flour with salt, pepper, garlic powder. Beat egg with milk. Dredge steaks in flour, egg wash, flour again. Fry in 1/2 inch oil at 350°F 4-5 minutes per side. Drain. Make white gravy with drippings.

ingredients: For gravy: 3 tbsp flour, 2.5 cups beef broth, 1/2 cup heavy cream, Salt and pepper
Cube steak and gravy.directions: Ingredients needed: 4 cube steaks (about 1.5 lbs), 1 cup all-purpose flour, 2 tsp salt, 1 tsp black pepper, 1 tsp garlic powder, 1 tsp paprika, 4 tbsp vegetable oil. 1. Season cube steaks with salt and pepper. Mix flour with salt, pepper, garlic powder, and paprika in shallow dish. 2. Dredge steaks in seasoned flour, coating both sides. 3. Heat oil in large skillet over medium-high heat. Fry steaks 3-4 min per side until golden brown. Remove and set aside. 4. Pour off all but 3 tbsp drippings. Sprinkle 3 tbsp flour into skillet, whisk and cook 2 min. 5. Gradually add broth, whisking constantly. Bring to simmer, cook 5 min until thickened. Stir in cream. 6. Return steaks to skillet, simmer in gravy 5 min. Season with salt and pepper and serve.

Swiss steak.directions: Ingredients needed: 2 lbs round steak cut into 6 pieces, 1/2 cup all-purpose flour, 2 tsp salt, 1 tsp black pepper, 3 tbsp vegetable oil, 1 can (28 oz) crushed tomatoes, 1 onion diced, 2 carrots diced, 2 celery stalks diced, 3 cloves garlic minced, 2 cups beef broth, 2 bay leaves, 1 tsp dried thyme. 1. Preheat oven to 325°F. Pound steaks to 1/2-inch thickness. Season with salt and pepper, dredge in flour. 2. Heat oil in Dutch oven over medium-high heat. Brown steaks 3-4 min per side. Remove and set aside. 3. Add onion, carrots, and celery to pot. Cook 5 min until softened. Add garlic, cook 1 min. 4. Add crushed tomatoes, broth, bay leaves, and thyme. Bring to simmer. 5. Return steaks to pot, spooning sauce over top. Cover and transfer to oven. 6. Braise 2-2.5 hours until meat is very tender. Remove bay leaves and serve with sauce.

Smash burger with caramelized cheese cru.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 lb ground beef (80/20), 4 slices American cheese, 4 hamburger buns, 2 tbsp butter, 1 cup shredded cheddar cheese. 1. Divide beef into 4 balls (4 oz each). Season generously with salt. 2. Heat cast iron over high heat until smoking. Sprinkle 1/4 cup shredded cheddar in 4-inch circle on griddle. 3. Place beef ball on cheese, immediately smash flat with spatula. Season with pepper. Cook 2-3 min until edges are crispy and cheese underneath is crispy and lacy. 4. Flip burger (cheese crust is now on top), add American cheese slice. Cook 1 min more. 5. Toast buns in butter. Assemble with pickles, onion, and condiments. 6. Serve immediately with crispy cheese crust facing up.

Butter-basted ribeye with bone marrow bu.directions: Ingredients needed: 2 lbs ribeye steak, 2 lbs beef chuck roast, 4 tablespoons butter, 6 cloves garlic, minced, 1 teaspoon dried thyme, 2 tablespoons fresh rosemary, chopped, 1/2 tsp (to taste) black pepper. Roast marrow bones, scrape out marrow, mash with soft butter. Sear steak 4 minutes per side. Add marrow butter, garlic, herbs. Baste. Rest with a dollop of marrow butter on top.

Nashville hot chicken.directions: Ingredients needed: 3 lbs whole chicken, cut into pieces, 3 tablespoons butter, 1/2 cup all-purpose flour, 1/4 tsp cayenne pepper, 1/4 cup packed brown sugar, 1/2 teaspoon paprika, 6 cloves garlic, minced, 1/4 cup lard, 1/2 tsp (to taste) black pepper. Marinate chicken in buttermilk overnight. Season flour with salt, pepper, some cayenne. Dredge and fry at 350°F until done. Make hot oil: melt lard, add cayenne, brown sugar, paprika, garlic powder. Brush hot chicken generously with spicy oil. Serve on white bread with pickles.

Birria grilled cheese.directions: Ingredients needed: 8 slices bread (sourdough or bolillo rolls), 2 cups shredded birria beef, 2 cups Oaxaca cheese (shredded), 1 cup Monterey Jack cheese (shredded), 4 tbsp butter, 1/2 cup white onion (diced), 1/4 cup cilantro (chopped), 2 cups birria consommé for dipping. 1. Heat large skillet over medium heat. 2. Butter one side of each bread slice. 3. Place bread buttered-side down in pan. 4. Layer Oaxaca cheese, birria beef, Monterey Jack cheese, onion, and cilantro on 4 slices. 5. Top with remaining bread slices, buttered-side up. 6. Cook 4-5 min until bottom is golden and crispy. 7. Flip carefully, press down gently. 8. Cook another 4-5 min until golden and cheese is melted. 9. Heat birria consommé in small pot. 10. Serve sandwiches hot with consommé for dipping.

Korean corn dog.directions: Ingredients needed: 10 hot dogs, 8 oz mozzarella sticks, 1/2 cup all-purpose flour, 4 large eggs, 3/4 cup panko breadcrumbs, 1/4 cup sugar, 3 tablespoons vegetable oil, 1/2 cup ketchup, 1 tablespoon mustard. Skewer hot dogs or mozzarella (or half and half). Coat in flour, then egg, then panko mixed with a bit of sugar. Deep fry at 350°F until golden, 3-4 minutes. Brush with sugar. Serve with ketchup and mustard.

Elote-style loaded fries.directions: Ingredients needed: 1/4 cup mayonnaise. Fry crispy fries. Mix mayo with crema. Drizzle over fries. Top with crumbled cotija, chili powder, squeeze of lime, fresh cilantro. Street corn flavors on fries.

Truffle shuffle mac and cheese.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 lb elbow macaroni, 6 tbsp butter, 6 tbsp flour, 4 cups whole milk, 3 cups shredded Gruyere cheese, 2 cups shredded fontina cheese, 1 cup grated Parmesan, 3 tbsp truffle oil, 1 tsp salt, 1/2 tsp white pepper, 1 cup panko breadcrumbs, 2 tbsp melted butter. 1. Preheat oven to 375°F. Cook macaroni 6-7 min until al dente. Drain. 2. Melt 6 tbsp butter in large pot over medium heat. Whisk in flour, cook 2 min. 3. Gradually add milk, whisking constantly. Simmer 5 min until thickened. 4. Remove from heat. Stir in Gruyere, fontina, and half the Parmesan until melted. Add truffle oil, salt, and white pepper. 5. Fold in cooked macaroni. Transfer to greased 9x13 dish. 6. Mix panko with melted butter and remaining Parmesan. Sprinkle over top. Bake 25-30 min until bubbly and golden. Garnish with shaved truffle and chives.

Lobster mac and cheese.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 lb cavatappi pasta, 1 lb cooked lobster meat, chopped, 6 tbsp unsalted butter, 1/2 cup all-purpose flour, 4 cups whole milk, 2 cups heavy cream, 4 cups shredded Gruyere cheese, 2 cups shredded sharp white cheddar cheese, 1 cup grated Parmesan cheese, 1 tsp black pepper, 1/2 tsp cayenne pepper, 2 tsp salt, 2 cups panko breadcrumbs, 4 tbsp butter, melted, 1/4 cup chopped fresh chives, 1 tsp Old Bay seasoning. 1. Preheat oven to 375°F. Butter large baking dish (9x13-inch or equivalent). 2. Cook pasta in salted boiling water until al dente (about 2 minutes less than package directions). Drain and set aside. 3. In large pot over medium heat, melt 6 tbsp butter. Whisk in flour and cook for 2-3 minutes, stirring constantly. 4. Gradually whisk in milk and cream. Bring to simmer and cook, whisking frequently, for 8-10 minutes until thick. 5. Remove from heat. Stir in Gruyere, white cheddar, and 1/2 cup Parmesan until melted and smooth. Season with black pepper, cayenne, and salt. 6. Fold in cooked pasta and lobster meat. Pour into prepared baking dish. 7. Mix panko with melted butter, remaining 1/2 cup Parmesan, and Old Bay seasoning. Sprinkle evenly over mac and cheese. 8. Bake for 25-30 minutes until bubbly and golden brown on top. 9. Broil for 2-3 minutes for extra crispy topping. Let stand 5 minutes. 10. Garnish with chives and serve immediately.

ingredients: large russet potatoes, peeled and cubed
Loaded potato soup in a bread bowl.directions: Ingredients needed: 6 large russet potatoes, peeled and cubed, 6 cups chicken broth, 1 onion, diced, 4 cloves garlic, minced, 1/2 cup butter, 1/2 cup flour, 2 cups heavy cream, 1 cup sour cream, 3 cups shredded cheddar cheese, 8 slices bacon, cooked and crumbled, 1/2 cup green onions, sliced, 4 large round bread loaves. 1. In large pot, combine potatoes, broth, onion, garlic. Boil, then simmer 20 min until very tender. Mash some potatoes, leaving chunks. 2. Melt butter in pan, whisk in flour, cook 2 min. Gradually whisk in cream until smooth. 3. Add cream mixture to soup, simmer 5 min. Stir in sour cream and cheese until melted. Season with salt and pepper. 4. Cut tops off bread loaves, hollow out centers. Brush insides with melted butter, toast at 350°F for 10 min. 5. Ladle soup into bread bowls. Top with bacon, green onions, extra cheese.

ingredients: sesame seeds and green onions for garnish
Double-fried Korean fried chicken.directions: Ingredients needed: 3 lbs chicken wings and drumettes, 1 cup potato starch, 1/2 cup cornstarch, 1 tsp baking powder, 1 tsp salt, 1/2 tsp white pepper, 3 tbsp honey, 2 tbsp soy sauce, 2 tbsp rice vinegar, 4 cloves garlic (minced), 1 tbsp ginger (minced), 2 tbsp sesame oil, 2 tbsp water. 1. Pat chicken completely dry with paper towels. 2. Mix potato starch, cornstarch, baking powder, salt, and white pepper in large bowl. 3. Coat chicken pieces thoroughly in starch mixture, shake off excess. 4. Heat oil to 325°F in large pot or deep fryer. 5. Fry chicken in batches 8-10 min until cooked through but not browned, drain on rack. 6. Let chicken rest 10 min. 7. Make sauce: whisk all sauce ingredients in bowl. 8. Heat oil to 375°F. 9. Fry chicken again 5-7 min until deep golden and extra crispy. 10. Toss hot chicken in sauce or serve sauce on side, garnish with sesame seeds and green onions.

Beef Wellington.directions: Ingredients needed: 2.5 lbs beef, 2 s heets puff pastry, 8 oz sliced mushrooms, 6 oz prosciutto, thinly sliced, 1 tablespoon Dijon mustard, 3 large eggs, 1/2 teaspoon thyme, 1/2 tsp (to taste) black pepper. Sear seasoned tenderloin all sides. Brush with mustard. Finely chop mushrooms, cook until dry. Layer plastic wrap, prosciutto, mushrooms. Place beef, roll tight. Wrap in puff pastry. Brush with egg. Bake at 425°F 25-30 minutes.

ingredients: tomahawk ribeye steak (2.5-3 lbs, 2 inches thick)
Reverse-sear tomahawk steak.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 tomahawk ribeye steak (2.5-3 lbs, 2 inches thick), 2 tbsp coarse salt, 1 tbsp cracked black pepper, 2 tbsp vegetable oil, 4 tbsp butter, 6 cloves garlic smashed, 4 sprigs fresh thyme, 4 sprigs fresh rosemary. 1. Remove steak from refrigerator 2 hours before cooking. Pat completely dry, season all over with salt and pepper. 2. Preheat oven to 250°F. Place steak on wire rack over baking sheet. Roast 45-60 min until internal temp reaches 120°F for medium-rare. 3. Remove from oven, let rest 10 min. Heat cast iron skillet over high heat until smoking. Add oil. 4. Sear steak 1-2 min per side until deep brown crust forms. 5. Add butter, garlic, and herbs. Baste steak with butter 1 min. 6. Remove, let rest 10 min. Slice and serve with herb butter.

ingredients: wood chips for smoking (hickory or applewood)
Smoked then fried chicken wings.directions: Ingredients needed: 4 lbs chicken wings, 1 tbsp garlic powder, 1 tbsp onion powder, 1 tbsp brown sugar, 2 tsp salt, 1 tsp black pepper, 1 tsp cayenne pepper, 1 cup flour, 1 cup cornstarch, 4 tbsp melted butter. 1. Pat wings dry, coat with dry rub, refrigerate 2-4 hours. 2. Preheat smoker to 225°F with wood chips. 3. Smoke wings 90 min until internal temp reaches 165°F. 4. Remove wings, let cool 15 min, then refrigerate 1 hour. 5. Heat oil to 375°F in deep fryer or large pot. 6. Mix flour and cornstarch in bowl. 7. Dredge smoked wings in flour mixture. 8. Fry wings in batches 5-7 min until golden brown and extra crispy. 9. Mix hot sauce and butter for buffalo sauce. 10. Toss fried wings in sauce and serve immediately.

ingredients: pork loin chops (8 oz each), bone removed
Pork schnitzel the size of the plate.directions: Ingredients needed: 4 pork loin chops (8 oz each), bone removed, 1 cup all-purpose flour, 3 large eggs, 2 1/2 cups plain breadcrumbs, 1/2 cup lard or vegetable oil, 2 tbsp butter, 1/2 tsp (to taste) black pepper, 2 lemons, juiced and zested, 8 oz lingonberry jam for serving. 1. Place pork chops between plastic wrap. Pound aggressively with meat mallet until very thin, about 1/8-inch thick and 10-12 inches across. Season generously with salt and pepper. 2. Set up breading station: flour in first dish, beaten eggs in second, breadcrumbs in third. 3. Dredge pork in flour, coating both sides. Shake off excess. Dip in egg wash, let excess drip. Press into breadcrumbs, coating thoroughly and pressing firmly. 4. Heat lard and butter in very large skillet over medium-high heat until shimmering, about 350°F. 5. Fry schnitzels one at a time, 2-3 min per side until deep golden brown and crispy. Shake pan gently to keep schnitzel swimming in fat. Don't press down. 6. Drain on paper towels. Season with salt immediately. Serve hot with lemon wedges and lingonberry jam. Traditional sides: potato salad, cucumber salad, or parsley potatoes.

Juicy Lucy.directions: Ingredients needed: 2 lbs ground beef, 1 1/2 cups american cheese, shredded, 1 cup medium, diced onion, 1 lb pickles, 2 cups burger bun. 1. Preheat oven to 325°F. Line baking sheet with foil or parchment. 2. Season main ingredients with salt, pepper, and spices. Arrange in single layer on prepared sheet. 3. Drizzle with oil or dot with butter. 4. Bake 30-35 min, flipping halfway through if needed. 5. Top with cheese last 5 min of cooking. 6. Let rest 5 min, garnish and serve hot.

ingredients: For Thousand Island: 1/2 cup mayo, 2 tbsp ketchup, 1 tbsp sweet relish, 1 tsp lemon juice, 1/2 tsp paprika
Patty melt on marbled rye with thousand.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 lb ground beef (80/20), 2 large onions thinly sliced, 8 slices marbled rye bread, 8 slices Swiss cheese, 4 tbsp butter (plus 2 tbsp for onions). 1. Make dressing: Mix mayo, ketchup, relish, lemon juice, and paprika. Refrigerate. 2. Melt 2 tbsp butter over medium heat, add onions. Cook 15-20 min until caramelized. 3. Form beef into 4 thin oval patties, season with salt and pepper. Cook 3-4 min per side. 4. Butter one side of each bread slice. Place 4 slices butter-side down in skillet. Spread Thousand Island on top side. 5. Top with cheese, patty, caramelized onions, more cheese, then bread butter-side up. 6. Cook 3-4 min per side until golden and cheese melts. Cut in half and serve.

Cast iron deep dish pizza.directions: Ingredients needed: 12 oz pizza dough, 2 cups shredded cheddar cheese, 1 lb smoked sausage, sliced, 1 (28 oz) can crushed tomatoes, 1/2 cup grated parmesan cheese, 2 tablespoons olive oil, 1 tablespoon Italian seasoning, 4 cloves garlic, minced. Oil cast iron. Press dough up sides. Layer sliced mozzarella on bottom. Add cooked sausage. Top with seasoned crushed tomatoes. Sprinkle parmesan. Bake at 425°F 25-30 minutes.

Detroit-style pizza.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 lb pizza dough, 1.5 cups shredded cheese, 6 oz pepperoni slices, 1 (28 oz) can crushed tomatoes, 2 tablespoons olive oil, 2 teaspoons dried oregano, 4 cloves garlic, minced, 1/4 cup sugar. Oil Detroit-style pan. Press dough to edges, let rise 1 hour. Cube cheese, spread to edges (key for crispy cheese edges). Add pepperoni. Top with stripes of seasoned tomato sauce. Bake at 500°F 12-15 minutes until cheese edges caramelize.

Vodka rigatoni with burrata.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 lb rigatoni, 4 tbsp butter, 2 cups 1 shallot, minced, 6 cloves garlic, minced, 1 tsp red pepper flakes, 6 oz tomato paste, 3/4 cup vodka, 2 cups heavy cream, 1 cup Parmesan, grated, 1 lb Salt and pepper to taste, 8 oz burrata cheese, 2 teaspoons dried basil. 1. Cook rigatoni in salted boiling water until al dente. Reserve 1.5 cups pasta water before draining. 2. Melt butter in large skillet over medium heat. Add shallot, cook 3 min until soft. Add garlic and red pepper flakes, cook 1 min. 3. Add tomato paste, cook 3-4 min, stirring constantly, until paste is deep red and fragrant. 4. Add vodka, stir well. Simmer 5-7 min until alcohol cooks off and mixture is thick and jammy. 5. Reduce heat to medium-low. Stir in cream, bring to gentle simmer. Cook 6-8 min, stirring, until sauce thickens and turns vibrant coral. Add Parmesan, stir until melted. Season with salt and pepper. 6. Add drained rigatoni, toss to coat. Add pasta water 2 tbsp at a time if needed for silky texture. Divide among bowls. Top each serving with torn burrata and fresh basil. Drizzle with olive oil.

Cacio e pepe with a parmesan crisp bowl.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 lb spaghetti or tonnarelli, 2 cups Pecorino Romano, finely grated, 1 cup Parmesan, finely grated (for bowls), 2 tbsp black peppercorns, coarsely cracked. 1. Make Parmesan bowls: Preheat oven to 375°F. Line baking sheet with parchment. Make 4 circles of grated Parmesan, 6 inches wide, 1/4 inch thick. Bake 6-8 min until melted and golden. Immediately drape each over inverted bowl to form cup shape. Cool completely. 2. Bring large pot of salted water to boil. Cook pasta until al dente. Reserve 2.5 cups pasta water before draining. 3. While pasta cooks, toast cracked black pepper in large dry skillet over medium heat 1-2 min until fragrant. Add 1 cup reserved pasta water, bring to simmer. 4. Add drained pasta to skillet, toss vigorously for 1 min. Remove from heat. Working quickly, add Pecorino in 3-4 additions, tossing constantly and vigorously. Add pasta water 2-3 tbsp at a time while tossing to create creamy emulsion. Keep tossing off heat 2-3 min total. 5. Place Parmesan crisp bowls on plates, fill with cacio e pepe. Serve immediately with more pepper and Pecorino.

Carbonara with guanciale and runny yolk.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 lb spaghetti, 8 oz guanciale, diced, 6 egg yolks, 4 large eggs, 1.5 cups Pecorino Romano, finely grated, 1/2 cup Parmesan, grated, 2 tsp black pepper, freshly cracked, 1 lb penne pasta. 1. Bring large pot of salted water to boil. Cook spaghetti until al dente, 8-10 min. Reserve 1.5 cups pasta water before draining. 2. While pasta cooks, cook guanciale in large skillet over medium heat 8-10 min until fat renders and meat is crispy. Remove from heat. 3. In bowl, whisk together 4 egg yolks, 2 whole eggs, Pecorino, Parmesan, and lots of black pepper. 4. Add hot drained pasta to skillet with guanciale, toss off heat for 30 seconds. 5. Working quickly, pour egg mixture over pasta, tossing vigorously. Add pasta water 2 tbsp at a time, tossing constantly, until creamy sauce forms that coats pasta (not scrambled). 6. Plate pasta immediately. Make well in center of each serving, carefully place remaining raw egg yolk in well. Top with more Pecorino and cracked pepper. Break yolk and mix in while eating.

Short rib ragu pappardelle.directions: Ingredients needed: 2 lbs beef chuck roast, 1 lb penne pasta, 2 (14.5 oz) cans diced tomatoes, 1 cup dry white wine, 6 cups beef broth, 5 cloves garlic, minced, 1/2 teaspoon thyme, 3 bay leaves, 1/2 cup grated parmesan cheese. Brown short ribs. Add wine, reduce. Add tomatoes, broth, garlic, herbs. Braise covered at 300°F 3-4 hours. Shred meat into sauce. Cook pappardelle. Toss with ragu and parmesan.

Oxtail ragu.directions: Ingredients needed: 3 lbs oxtail pieces, 1 (28 oz) can crushed tomatoes, 1 cup dry white wine, 3 cups beef broth, 2 tablespoons tomato paste, 4 cloves garlic, minced, 1 teaspoon dried thyme, 2 bay leaves, 1 lb penne pasta. Brown oxtails. Add wine, reduce. Add tomatoes, broth, tomato paste, garlic, herbs. Braise covered at 300°F 4 hours until meat falls off bone. Shred meat into sauce. Serve over pappardelle.

Lamb shank osso buco style.directions: Ingredients needed: 4 lamb shanks, 1 cup flour, 4 tbsp olive oil, 4 tbsp butter, 1 onion, diced, 2 carrots, diced, 2 celery stalks, diced, 6 cloves garlic, minced, 1 cup dry red wine, 28 oz crushed tomatoes, 2 cups beef broth, 3 bay leaves, 2 tsp dried rosemary, 2 tsp dried thyme. 1. Preheat oven to 325°F. Season lamb shanks with salt and pepper, dredge in flour. Heat oil in large Dutch oven over medium-high heat. Brown shanks 4 min per side until golden. Transfer to plate. 2. Add butter to pot. Add onion, carrots, celery. Cook 8 min until softened. Add garlic, cook 1 min. 3. Add wine, scrape up browned bits. Simmer 3 min until reduced by half. Add tomatoes, broth, bay leaves, rosemary, thyme. Bring to boil. 4. Return shanks to pot, nestling into sauce. Cover, transfer to oven. Braise 2.5-3 hours until meat is fall-off-bone tender. 5. Remove shanks, tent with foil. Simmer sauce on stovetop 10 min to thicken. Remove bay leaves. Make gremolata: mix lemon zest, chopped parsley, minced garlic. 6. Serve shanks with sauce, top with gremolata. Serve over polenta or pasta.

Duck fat fries with truffle aioli.directions: Ingredients needed: 2 lbs Yukon gold potatoes, diced, 2 tablespoons duck fat, 1/4 cup mayonnaise, 3 tablespoons oil, 4 cloves garlic, minced, 1/4 cup lemon juice, 1/4 cup fresh parsley, chopped. Make truffle aioli: mayo with truffle oil, minced garlic, lemon juice. Fry potatoes in duck fat until perfectly crispy. Season with salt and parsley. Serve with truffle aioli.

Poutine with braised short rib.directions: Ingredients needed: 2 lbs beef chuck roast, 1 (32 oz) bag frozen fries, 8 oz shredded cheese, 2.5 lbs beef, 1 large onion, diced, 1 cup dry white wine, 3 cups beef broth, 1 teaspoon dried thyme. Braise short ribs with wine, broth, onion, thyme at 325°F for 3 hours. Shred meat. Fry fresh-cut potatoes twice for crispy fries. Top with curds, shredded beef, and hot beef gravy.

Disco fries deluxe.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 (28 oz) bag frozen French fries, 2.5 lbs beef, 2 cups shredded cheddar cheese, 1/2 lb bacon, 1 jalapeño, seeded and minced, 1/2 cup sour cream. Fry crispy fries. Top with hot gravy and shredded mozzarella. Broil until cheese melts. Add bacon bits, sliced jalapeños, dollop of sour cream.

Loaded baked potato bar with all the mea.directions: Ingredients needed: 1/2 cup sour cream, 4-5 lbs brisket, 1/2 tsp (to taste) black pepper. Bake potatoes at 400°F 1 hour until tender. Split open, fluff with fork. Add butter, salt, pepper. Set up toppings: sour cream, shredded cheese, bacon crumbles, pulled pork, chopped brisket. Let people build their own.

Hasselback potatoes with bacon and gruye.directions: Ingredients needed: 4 large russet potatoes, 6 strips bacon, cooked and crumbled, 1 cup grated gruyere cheese, 4 tbsp melted butter, 2 cloves garlic, minced, 1 tsp fresh thyme, 2 tbsp fresh chives. 1. Preheat oven to 425°F. 2. Place potato between two chopsticks or wooden spoons. Slice potato every 1/8 inch, chopsticks prevent cutting through. Repeat with remaining potatoes. 3. Mix melted butter, garlic, thyme, salt, pepper. Brush over potatoes, getting into slices. 4. Place on baking sheet, bake 50-60 min until tender and edges crispy. 5. Remove from oven, stuff bacon and cheese into slices. Return to oven 10 min until cheese melted. 6. Garnish with chives, serve with sour cream.

Pommes souffl\u00e9es.directions: Ingredients needed: 2 lbs Yukon gold potatoes, diced, 1/4 cup vegetable oil. Slice potatoes 1/8 inch thick. Par-fry at 325°F until slightly cooked. Remove, let cool. Fry again at 375°F - potatoes will puff up like pillows. Drain and salt immediately. Serve at once.

Potatoes Anna.directions: Ingredients needed: 2 lbs Yukon gold potatoes, diced, 1/4 cup (4 tbsp) butter, 1.5 cups 1, sliced pepper. Slice potatoes paper thin. Brush pan with clarified butter. Layer potatoes in overlapping spiral, brushing each layer with butter, seasoning with salt and pepper. Bake at 425°F for 45 minutes. Invert onto plate.

Fondant potatoes.directions: Ingredients needed: 2 lbs Yukon gold potatoes, diced, 1/4 cup (4 tbsp) butter, 2 cups chicken broth, 5 cloves garlic, minced, 1/2 teaspoon thyme. Cut potatoes into cylinders. Season and sear in butter until golden on both flat sides. Add broth, garlic, thyme. Braise in 425°F oven until tender and bottoms are crusty.

ingredients: For rub: 1/2 cup coarse black pepper, 1/2 cup coarse salt, 1/4 cup paprika, 2 tbsp garlic powder, 2 tbsp onion powder
Wood chips or chunks (oak, hickory, or mesquite)
For burnt ends: 1 cup BBQ sauce, 1/4 cup butter, 2 tbsp honey
Smoked brisket with burnt ends.directions: Ingredients needed: 10-12 lb whole packer brisket. 1. Trim brisket, leaving 1/4-inch fat cap. Apply rub generously all over. Refrigerate overnight. 2. Prepare smoker to 225-250°F with wood chips. Place brisket fat-side up in smoker. 3. Smoke 10-14 hours, spritzing with water every 2 hours, until internal temp reaches 195-205°F and probe-tender. 4. Separate point from flat. Slice flat for serving. Cube point into 1.5-inch pieces. 5. Toss cubes with BBQ sauce, butter, and honey in pan. Return to smoker 1-2 hours until caramelized. 6. Serve sliced brisket and burnt ends together.

Competition-style ribs.directions: Ingredients needed: 1/4 cup packed brown sugar, 1/2 cup BBQ sauce. Apply rub. Smoke at 225°F 3 hours. Wrap in foil with butter, sugar, honey. Smoke 2 more hours. Unwrap, glaze with sauce, smoke 30 more minutes for set glaze.

Cochon de lait.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 lb whole suckling pig, 2 teaspoons Cajun seasoning, 4 cloves garlic, minced, 4 tablespoons butter, 3 tablespoons vinegar, 1/2 tsp (to taste) black pepper. Season pig inside and out with Cajun spices. Roast slowly in caja china or on spit over coals 6-8 hours until skin is crispy and meat falls off bone. Louisiana style.

ingredients: cooked Peking duck or roasted duck, shredded
Chinese pancakes or small flour tortillas
Peking duck pancakes.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 lb cooked Peking duck or roasted duck, shredded, 12 Chinese pancakes or small flour tortillas, 1/4 cup hoisin sauce, 2 tbsp plum sauce, 1 cucumber, julienned, 6 g reen onions, cut into 2-inch strips, 1 tsp sesame oil, 2 tbsp vegetable oil for crisping duck. 1. If duck is cold, heat 2 tbsp oil in skillet over medium-high heat. Add shredded duck, crisp for 4-5 min. Drizzle with sesame oil. 2. Steam pancakes in bamboo steamer or wrap in damp towel and microwave 1-2 min until warm and pliable. 3. Mix hoisin and plum sauce. 4. To assemble: spread sauce on pancake, add duck, cucumber strips, and green onion. Roll up like a burrito. 5. Serve immediately while pancakes are warm.

Char siu burnt ends.directions: Ingredients needed: 3-4 lbs pork shoulder. Cube pork. Marinate in char siu sauce. Smoke at 250°F 2 hours. Toss with more sauce and honey. Continue smoking, stirring occasionally, until sticky and caramelized. Top with sesame seeds.

XO fried rice.directions: Ingredients needed: 4 cups cooked day-old rice, 3 tbsp XO sauce, 3 tbsp vegetable oil (divided), 3 eggs (beaten), 1/2 lb shrimp (peeled and deveined), 4 oz Chinese sausage (diced), 1/2 cup onion (diced), 3 cloves garlic (minced), 2 tbsp soy sauce, 1 tbsp sesame oil, 3 g reen onions (sliced). 1. Heat 1 tbsp oil in large wok over high heat, cook shrimp 2-3 min until pink, set aside. 2. Add Chinese sausage, cook 2-3 min until crispy, set aside. 3. Heat 1 tbsp oil, scramble eggs 2 min, set aside. 4. Heat remaining oil, add onion, cook 2 min. 5. Add garlic and XO sauce, stir-fry 1 min until fragrant. 6. Add rice, stir-fry 4-5 min breaking up clumps. 7. Return shrimp, sausage, and eggs to wok. 8. Add soy sauce, sesame oil, and white pepper, toss 2 min. 9. Garnish with green onions and serve hot.

Loco moco with wagyu patty.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 lb ground beef, 1.5 cups long-grain white rice, 3 large eggs, 8 oz brown gravy, 2 medium onions, diced, 3 cups beef broth, 1/4 cup (4 tbsp) butter, 3 tablespoons soy sauce. Form wagyu patties, season and cook to medium. Make gravy with caramelized onions, broth, soy sauce. Serve over hot rice, top with patty, fried egg, and plenty of gravy.

Croque madame.directions: Ingredients needed: 8 slices thick-cut white bread, 8 tbsp unsalted butter, softened, 8 slices Black Forest ham, 2 cups shredded Gruyere cheese, 4 tbsp unsalted butter (for sauce), 1/4 cup all-purpose flour, 2 cups whole milk, 1/2 tsp nutmeg, 1 tsp black pepper, 1 tsp salt, 1/2 cup grated Parmesan cheese, 4 large eggs, 2 tbsp butter (for frying eggs). 1. Preheat oven to 400°F. Line baking sheet with parchment paper. 2. Make béchamel sauce: In saucepan over medium heat, melt 4 tbsp butter. Whisk in flour and cook for 2 minutes. Gradually whisk in milk. Simmer, whisking frequently, for 5-7 minutes until thick. Season with nutmeg, pepper, and salt. Stir in Parmesan. Keep warm. 3. Butter one side of each bread slice. Place 4 slices butter-side down on baking sheet. 4. Top each with 2 slices ham, 1/4 cup Gruyere, and generous spoonful of béchamel sauce. 5. Top with remaining bread slices, butter-side up. 6. Spread more béchamel sauce on top of each sandwich. Sprinkle with remaining Gruyere. 7. Bake for 10-12 minutes until cheese is melted and bubbly. Broil for 2-3 minutes until golden brown. 8. While sandwiches bake, fry eggs: Heat 2 tbsp butter in skillet over medium heat. Fry eggs sunny-side up until whites are set but yolks are still runny, about 4 minutes. 9. Top each sandwich with fried egg. Garnish with parsley and serve immediately.

Croque monsieur grilled cheese.directions: Ingredients needed: 8 slices white sandwich bread, 8 slices Black Forest ham, 2 cups shredded Gruyère cheese, 4 tbsp butter, softened, 2 tbsp Dijon mustard. 1. Spread mustard on 4 bread slices. Top each with 2 slices ham, 1/4 cup cheese, then another bread slice. 2. Butter outside of sandwiches. 3. Heat skillet over medium heat. Cook sandwiches 3-4 min per side, pressing down, until golden and cheese melts. 4. Serve hot.

Monte Cristo.directions: Ingredients needed: 4 slices bread, 2 cups diced ham (12 oz), 8 oz turkey, 2 cups shredded cheddar cheese, 4 large eggs, 2 cups whole milk, 3 tablespoons butter, 1/4 cup powdered sugar, 1 lb raspberry jam. Layer ham, turkey, Swiss between bread slices. Beat eggs with milk. Dip sandwich in egg mixture. Grill in butter until golden on both sides and cheese melts. Dust with powdered sugar. Serve with raspberry jam.

ingredients: Cheese Whiz or American cheese sauce
Cheesesteak with whiz wit no wit.directions: Ingredients needed: 1.5 lbs ribeye steak thinly sliced, 2 tbsp vegetable oil, 2 onions sliced, 4 hoagie rolls, 8 oz Cheese Whiz or American cheese sauce. 1. Freeze steak 30 min for easier slicing. Slice as thinly as possible against the grain. 2. Heat 1 tbsp oil in large skillet or griddle over medium-high heat. Add onions, cook 7-8 min until caramelized. Remove and set aside. 3. Add remaining oil, increase heat to high. Add steak in single layer, season with salt and pepper. Cook undisturbed 2-3 min until browned, then stir and cook 2 min more. 4. Mix caramelized onions back into steak. Divide into 4 portions on griddle. 5. Split hoagie rolls. Fill with steak and onions. 6. Drizzle or spread Cheese Whiz generously over filling. Serve immediately.

Prime rib French dip with horseradish cr.directions: Ingredients needed: 8 oz prime rib, 6 slices thick-cut bread, 3 lbs beef brisket, 3 tablespoons horseradish, 1/2 cup sour cream, 2 cups shredded cheddar cheese, 3 tablespoons butter. Slice prime rib thin. Toast split French bread in butter. Layer with provolone and prime rib. Mix horseradish with sour cream. Serve sandwich with warm au jus for dipping and horseradish cream.

Thanksgiving sandwich.directions: Ingredients needed: 8 slices bread (white or sourdough), 1 lb leftover turkey (sliced), 2 cups leftover stuffing, 1 cup cranberry sauce, 1 cup leftover gravy (warmed), 1/2 cup mayonnaise, 4 tbsp butter (softened), 1 cup leftover mashed potatoes. 1. Butter one side of each bread slice. 2. Heat large skillet or griddle over medium heat. 3. On unbuttered side of bread, spread mayonnaise. 4. Layer in order: stuffing, turkey slices, mashed potatoes, cranberry sauce. 5. Top with second bread slice (buttered side out). 6. Grill sandwiches 4-5 min per side until bread is golden brown and filling is heated through. 7. Warm gravy in small pot. 8. Slice sandwiches diagonally, serve with gravy on the side for dipping or pour over top.

Muffuletta with olive tapenade.directions: Ingredients needed: 4 slices bread, 1/2 cup olive tapenade, 6 oz salami, 8 oz capicola, 8 oz mortadella, 2 cups shredded cheddar cheese, 2 cups diced ham (12 oz). Make olive tapenade with mixed olives, giardiniera, garlic, olive oil. Slice bread horizontally. Spread tapenade on both sides. Layer meats and cheese. Press sandwich, let marinate 30 minutes before slicing.

ingredients: boneless skinless chicken breasts pounded thin
For spicy honey: 1/2 cup honey, 2 tbsp hot sauce, 1 tbsp butter
Fried chicken sandwich with spicy honey.directions: Ingredients needed: 4 boneless skinless chicken breasts pounded thin, 2 cups buttermilk, 2 cups flour, 2 tbsp paprika, 1 tbsp cayenne pepper, 2 tsp garlic powder, 2 tsp salt, 1 tsp black pepper, 4 brioche buns. 1. Marinate chicken in buttermilk 2-4 hours. Mix flour with all spices. 2. Heat 1 inch oil in skillet to 350°F. Dredge chicken in seasoned flour, pressing to adhere. 3. Fry chicken 5-6 min per side until golden brown and 165°F internal temp. Drain on rack. 4. Make spicy honey: Heat honey, hot sauce, and butter in small saucepan until combined. 5. Toast brioche buns. 6. Place fried chicken on bottom buns, drizzle generously with spicy honey, top with pickles and top bun. Serve immediately.

Breakfast burger.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 lb ground beef (80/20), 4 slices American cheese, 4 burger buns, 4 fried eggs, 8 strips cooked bacon, 4 hash brown patties (frozen or homemade). 1. Form beef into 4 patties, season with salt and pepper. Cook on grill or in skillet over medium-high heat 4-5 min per side. Add cheese during last minute. 2. Cook hash brown patties according to package directions until crispy. 3. Fry eggs sunny-side up or over-easy. 4. Toast burger buns. 5. Assemble: Bottom bun, burger patty with cheese, hash brown patty, 2 bacon strips, fried egg, ketchup and hot sauce to taste, top bun. 6. Serve immediately.

Donut burger.directions: Ingredients needed: 2 lbs ground beef, 2 cups glazed donut, 8 strips thick-cut bacon, 1 cup american cheese, shredded, 2 eggs fried egg, 1 cup 1/4 cup maple syrup. 1. Heat oil in deep pot to 350°F for frying. 2. Prepare breading station: flour in first bowl, beaten eggs in second, breadcrumbs in third. 3. Coat items in flour, dip in egg, roll in breadcrumbs. For extra crispy, double bread by repeating egg and breadcrumb steps. 4. Fry in batches 2-3 min until golden brown. Don't overcrowd. Maintain oil temperature. 5. Drain on paper towels, season with salt immediately. Serve hot.

Peanut butter bacon burger.directions: Ingredients needed: 2 lbs ground beef (80/20), 2 tsp salt, 1 tsp black pepper, 12 strips thick-cut bacon, 4 brioche buns, toasted, 1 cup creamy peanut butter, 4 slices cheddar cheese, 1/2 cup strawberry jam, 4 slices red onion, 4 pickle slices, 4 lettuce leaves. 1. Cook bacon in skillet over medium heat until crispy, about 8-10 minutes. Drain on paper towels. 2. Divide ground beef into 4 equal portions. Form into patties about 3/4-inch thick, making slight indentation in center. Season both sides generously with salt and pepper. 3. Heat grill or large cast iron skillet over high heat (450°F). 4. Cook burgers for 4-5 minutes per side for medium (internal temp 145°F), or to desired doneness. 5. During last minute of cooking, top each burger with cheddar cheese. Cover to melt. 6. While burgers cook, spread peanut butter generously on bottom half of each toasted bun (about 1/4 cup per burger). 7. Spread strawberry jam on top half of each bun (about 2 tbsp per burger). 8. On peanut butter side, place lettuce, then burger with melted cheese. 9. Top burger with 3 strips of crispy bacon, breaking to fit. 10. Add onion slice and pickle. Crown with jam-covered top bun. Serve immediately with plenty of napkins.

ingredients: (4 oz) diced green chiles or 2 fresh roasted Hatch chiles diced
Green chile cheeseburger.directions: Ingredients needed: 1.5 lbs ground beef (80/20), 6 slices pepper Jack cheese, 6 hamburger buns, 1 can (4 oz) diced green chiles or 2 fresh roasted Hatch chiles diced, 3 tbsp butter. 1. Form beef into 6 patties, season generously with salt and pepper. 2. Heat grill or cast iron to medium-high heat (375-400°F). 3. Cook patties 4-5 min per side for medium doneness. 4. During last minute, top each with green chiles and cheese slice. Cover to melt cheese. 5. Toast buns with butter on grill 1-2 min until golden. 6. Assemble burgers with mayo, lettuce, and tomato. Serve immediately.

ingredients: For Russian dressing: 1/2 cup mayo, 2 tbsp ketchup, 1 tbsp horseradish, 1 tsp Worcestershire
Pastrami burger.directions: Ingredients needed: 1.5 lbs ground beef (80/20), 1/2 lb pastrami sliced thin, 6 slices Swiss cheese, 6 burger buns. 1. Make Russian dressing: Mix mayo, ketchup, horseradish, and Worcestershire. Set aside. 2. Form beef into 6 patties, season with salt and pepper. Cook on grill or in skillet 4-5 min per side. 3. In separate pan, heat pastrami until warm and slightly crispy, 2-3 min. 4. During last minute of cooking burgers, top each with Swiss cheese. Cover to melt. 5. Toast buns. Spread Russian dressing on both sides. 6. Assemble: Bottom bun, burger with cheese, pastrami, sauerkraut, pickles, top bun. Serve immediately.

ingredients: Sea salt and cracked black pepper
Patty melt with Wagyu.directions: Ingredients needed: 1.5 lbs Wagyu ground beef, 2 large onions thinly sliced, 8 slices sourdough or rye bread, 8 slices aged Swiss or Gruyere cheese, 4 tbsp butter (plus 2 tbsp for onions), 2 tbsp truffle oil (optional). 1. Caramelize onions in 2 tbsp butter over medium heat 20-25 min until deep golden. Set aside. 2. Form Wagyu into 4 thin oval patties. Season minimally with sea salt and pepper (Wagyu has rich flavor). 3. Cook patties in dry skillet over medium-high heat 2-3 min per side (Wagyu renders its own fat). 4. Butter one side of each bread slice. If using truffle oil, brush inside of bread with it. 5. Place 4 slices butter-side down in skillet. Top with cheese, Wagyu patty, caramelized onions, more cheese, then bread butter-side up. 6. Cook 3-4 min per side until golden and cheese melts. Serve immediately.

Quesabirria with consomm\u00e9.directions: Ingredients needed: 1/2 cup all-purpose flour, 2.5 lbs birria, 8 oz birria consommé, 2 cups shredded cheddar cheese, 1/3 cup fresh cilantro, 1 large onion, diced. Dip tortilla in red birria consommé. Place on hot griddle, add shredded birria and cheese. Fold, cook until crispy and cheese melts. Serve with warm consommé for dipping, topped with cilantro and onion.

Stacked enchiladas New Mexico style.directions: Ingredients needed: 8 (6-inch) corn tortillas, 1 lb ground beef, 2 tablespoons red chile sauce, 1.5 cups shredded cheese, 6 eggs, 1 large onion, diced, 6 cups torn lettuce, 1/2 cup sour cream. Brown beef with onion. Dip tortillas in red chile sauce. Stack tortilla, beef, cheese, repeat 3 times. Bake until cheese melts. Top each stack with fried egg, lettuce, sour cream.

Wet burrito smothered in both sauces.directions: Ingredients needed: 1/4 cup flour, 1 lb ground beef, 2 cups refried beans, 2 cups white rice, 8 oz shredded cheese, 2 cups enchilada sauce, 3 tablespoons green chile sauce, 1/2 cup sour cream, 1 large onion, diced. Fill tortilla with seasoned beef, beans, rice, cheese. Roll burrito. Place in baking dish. Cover half with red sauce, half with green. Top with more cheese. Bake until bubbly. Top with sour cream and onion.

Chimichanga deep fried and smothered.directions: Ingredients needed: 1/4 cup flour, 2.5 lbs beef, 8 oz shredded cheese, 1 cup queso, 1.5 teaspoons cumin, 1.5 tablespoons chili powder, 5 cloves garlic, minced, 1/4 cup vegetable oil, 1/2 cup sour cream, 1 cup guacamole. Fill tortilla with seasoned beef and cheese. Roll tightly, secure with toothpicks. Deep fry at 375°F until golden and crispy all over. Remove picks. Smother with hot queso. Top with sour cream and guacamole.

Carnitas with the crispy bits.directions: Ingredients needed: 3-4 lbs pork shoulder, 1/2 cup fresh orange juice, 3 limes, 2 teaspoons cumin, 1 teaspoon dried oregano, 6 cloves garlic, minced, 1/4 cup lard. Cube pork, season well. Simmer covered in juices with lard until tender. Remove lid, increase heat. Let liquid evaporate and pork crisp in rendered fat. Make sure to get those crispy caramelized bits.

ingredients: beef short ribs or chuck roast
dried guajillo chiles, stemmed and seeded
dried ancho chiles, stemmed and seeded
Birria consomm\u00e9 ramen.directions: Ingredients needed: 3 lbs beef short ribs or chuck roast, 5 dried guajillo chiles, stemmed and seeded, 3 dried ancho chiles, stemmed and seeded, 8 cups beef broth, 1 onion, quartered, 6 cloves garlic, 1 tbsp cumin, 1 tbsp oregano, 1 tsp cinnamon, 3 bay leaves, 1/4 cup apple cider vinegar, 4 packs ramen noodles. 1. Toast dried chiles in dry skillet 30 seconds per side. Soak in hot water 15 min. Blend with 2 cups soaking liquid, onion, garlic, cumin, oregano, cinnamon until smooth. 2. In Dutch oven, combine beef, chile mixture, broth, bay leaves, vinegar. Bring to boil, reduce to low simmer. Cook covered 3-4 hours until beef is fall-apart tender. 3. Remove beef, shred, discard bones. Strain broth, skim fat. Return beef and broth to pot. 4. Cook ramen noodles according to package, drain. 5. Serve noodles in bowls, ladle hot birria consommé over. Top with shredded beef, cilantro, diced onion, lime. Serve with tortillas dipped in consommé and griddled.

ingredients: oft-boiled eggs, marinated in soy sauce
Tonkotsu ramen with all the fixings.directions: Ingredients needed: 4 lbs pork bones, 2 lbs pork belly, 16 cups water, 1 onion, halved, 1 head garlic, halved, 3 inch ginger, sliced, 4 packs fresh ramen noodles, 6 s oft-boiled eggs, marinated in soy sauce, 2 cups bamboo shoots, 4 s heets nori, 6 g reen onions, sliced, 2 cups bean sprouts. 1. Blanch bones in boiling water 5 min, drain, rinse well. 2. In large pot, combine bones, pork belly, 16 cups water, onion, garlic, ginger. Bring to vigorous boil, maintain 6-8 hours, adding water as needed. Broth should be milky white and creamy. 3. Remove pork belly after 2.5 hours, marinate in soy sauce, slice. 4. Strain broth, season with salt and white pepper. 5. Prepare eggs: boil 6.5 min, ice bath, peel, marinate in soy sauce mixture 4 hours. 6. Cook noodles 2-3 min, drain. 7. Assemble: noodles in bowl, ladle broth, top with pork belly, halved egg, bamboo shoots, nori, green onions, bean sprouts, sesame seeds, drizzle of mayu and chili oil.

Miso ramen with torched pork belly.directions: Ingredients needed: 8 cups chicken and pork broth, 1/3 cup red miso paste, 2 tbsp white miso paste, 2 tbsp soy sauce, 1 tbsp sesame oil, 2 tbsp mirin, 1 tbsp chili bean paste, 4 cloves garlic, minced, 2 inch ginger, grated, 2 lbs pork belly, scored, 4 packs ramen noodles, 4 s oft-boiled eggs, 2 cups corn, 4 g reen onions. 1. Roast pork belly at 275°F for 3 hours until tender. Chill, slice, torch surface with kitchen torch until charred and crispy. 2. In pot, bring broth to boil. Whisk in both miso pastes until smooth. Add soy sauce, sesame oil, mirin, chili bean paste, garlic, ginger. Simmer 20 min. 3. Prepare eggs: boil 6.5 min, ice bath, peel, halve. 4. Cook noodles according to package, drain, toss with small pat of butter. 5. Assemble: noodles in bowl, ladle broth, top with torched pork belly, egg, corn, green onions, nori.

Spicy miso with ground pork bomb.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 lb egg noodles, 1 lb ground pork, 1/4 cup miso, 2 tablespoons chili paste, 2 teaspoons sesame oil, 4 cups chicken broth, 6 cloves garlic, minced, 1 teaspoon ground ginger, 6 g reen onions, chopped, 4 large eggs. Season pork with garlic, ginger, chili paste. Form into ball. Make spicy miso broth. Cook noodles. Place pork bomb in center of bowl, add noodles and broth. Top with egg and scallions. Break apart pork to eat.

Dan dan noodles with chili crisp oil.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 lb ground pork, 1 lb fresh Chinese egg noodles, 1/4 cup chili crisp oil, 3 tbsp soy sauce, 2 tbsp sesame paste or peanut butter, 2 tbsp black vinegar, 1 tbsp sugar, 2 tsp Sichuan peppercorns toasted and ground, 4 cloves garlic minced, 2 tbsp vegetable oil, 4 g reen onions sliced. 1. Make sauce: Whisk chili crisp oil, soy sauce, sesame paste, vinegar, sugar, and Sichuan peppercorns in bowl. Set aside. 2. Heat vegetable oil in wok over high heat. Add pork, cook 5-6 min breaking up until browned and crispy. Add garlic, cook 1 min. 3. Cook noodles in boiling water 3-4 min until tender. Drain, reserving 1/2 cup cooking water. 4. Toss hot noodles with sauce, adding cooking water to thin if needed. 5. Divide noodles among bowls. Top with ground pork, green onions, and crushed peanuts. 6. Serve immediately.

Mapo tofu if you have tofu.directions:
Ingredients needed: 1 lb silken tofu, cut into 3/4-inch cubes, 8 oz ground pork, 3 tbsp vegetable oil, 2 tbsp doubanjiang (spicy bean paste), 4 cloves garlic, minced, 2 tbsp ginger, minced, 1 tbsp Sichuan peppercorns, toasted and ground, 1 cup chicken broth, 2 tbsp soy sauce, 1 tbsp Shaoxing wine, 2 tsp sugar, 2 tbsp cornstarch mixed with 3 tbsp water, 3 g reen onions, sliced, 1 tsp chili oil (optional). 1. Bring pot of water to boil. Add tofu cubes, simmer for 2 minutes. Drain gently and set aside.
2. Heat wok over high heat (450°F). Add 2 tbsp vegetable oil.
3. Add ground pork, breaking it up with spatula. Cook for 4-5 minutes until browned and crispy. Remove and set aside.
4. Add remaining 1 tbsp oil to wok. Add doubanjiang, stir-fry for 30 seconds until fragrant.
5. Add garlic and ginger, stir-fry for 15 seconds.
6. Return pork to wok. Add chicken broth, soy sauce, Shaoxing wine, and sugar. Bring to boil.
7. Reduce heat to medium (350°F). Gently add tofu cubes, simmer for 3-4 minutes.
8. Add ground Sichuan peppercorns. Stir gently to avoid breaking tofu.
9. Pour in cornstarch slurry, stirring gently until sauce thickens (about 1 minute).
10. Transfer to serving dish, garnish with green onions and drizzle with chili oil if desired. Serve with steamed rice.

ingredients: cold water; Filling: 1 lb ground pork
sesame oil; black vinegar and ginger slivers for serving
Xiao long bao.directions: Ingredients needed: 1/2 cup boiling water, 1/4 cup cold water; Filling: 1 lb ground pork, 1/4 lb pork skin (for gelatin), 2 cups chicken stock, 3 tbsp soy sauce, 1 tbsp rice wine, 2 tsp ginger (minced), 2 g reen onions (minced), 1 tsp sugar, 1/2 tsp white pepper, 1 tsp sesame oil; black vinegar and ginger slivers for serving. 1. Make aspic: boil pork skin in chicken stock 2 hours, strain, refrigerate overnight until solid gelatin forms. 2. Make dough: mix flour with boiling water, then add cold water, knead 10 min until smooth, rest 30 min. 3. Chop aspic into small cubes, refrigerate. 4. Mix pork, soy sauce, rice wine, ginger, green onions, sugar, pepper, and sesame oil. 5. Gently fold cold aspic cubes into pork mixture. 6. Roll dough into long rope, cut into 20 pieces, roll each into 3-inch circles with thin edges. 7. Place 1 tbsp filling in center of each wrapper. 8. Pleat edges 18-20 times while rotating, twist top to seal. 9. Place dumplings in bamboo steamer lined with parchment, leaving 1-inch space between each. 10. Steam over boiling water 8-10 min until translucent. 11. Serve immediately with black vinegar and ginger.

Peking duck fat fried rice.directions: Ingredients needed: 4 cups cooked day-old rice, 1/4 cup rendered Peking duck fat, 1 cup leftover Peking duck meat (shredded), 3 eggs (beaten), 2 tbsp vegetable oil, 1/2 cup onion (diced), 1/2 cup scallions (sliced), 3 cloves garlic (minced), 2 tbsp soy sauce, 1 tbsp oyster sauce, 1 tsp sesame oil. 1. Heat duck fat in large wok over high heat until shimmering. 2. Add rice, press down and let crisp 2-3 min without stirring. 3. Break up rice, stir-fry 4-5 min until heated through and coated with duck fat. 4. Push rice to side, add vegetable oil to empty space. 5. Add beaten eggs, scramble 2 min, then mix with rice. 6. Add onion and garlic, stir-fry 2 min. 7. Add shredded duck meat, heat through 2 min. 8. Add soy sauce, oyster sauce, white pepper, toss to combine. 9. Drizzle with sesame oil, add scallions, toss 1 min. 10. Serve immediately.

Szechuan dry fried chicken.directions: Ingredients needed: 2 lbs chicken thighs cut into 1-inch pieces, 1/2 cup cornstarch, 1 tsp salt, 2 tbsp Sichuan peppercorns, 6 dried red chilies, 4 cloves garlic minced, 1- inch piece ginger minced, 2 g reen onions sliced, 2 tbsp soy sauce, 1 tbsp Chinese black vinegar, 1 tsp sugar. 1. Toss chicken with cornstarch and salt until coated. Let sit 15 min. 2. Heat 1 inch oil in wok to 375°F. Fry chicken in batches 5-6 min until golden and crispy. Drain on rack. 3. Pour off all but 2 tbsp oil. Toast Sichuan peppercorns and dried chilies 1 min until fragrant. 4. Add garlic and ginger, stir-fry 30 seconds. Add chicken back to wok. 5. Add soy sauce, vinegar, and sugar. Toss vigorously over high heat 2-3 min until chicken is dry and crispy. 6. Add green onions and sesame seeds. Toss and serve immediately.

Salt and pepper pork chop.directions: Ingredients needed: 4 (8 oz) thick-cut pork chops, 3/4 teaspoon white pepper, 2 teaspoons five spice powder, 5 cloves garlic, minced, 1 jalapeño, seeded and minced, 3 tablespoons cornstarch, 1/4 cup oil, 6 g reen onions, chopped. Cut pork into strips, coat in cornstarch. Deep fry until golden and crispy. Stir-fry garlic and jalapeños. Add fried pork, toss with salt, white pepper, five spice. Garnish with scallions.

Honey walnut shrimp.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 lb large shrimp, peeled and deveined, 1/2 cup walnut pieces, 1/4 cup mayonnaise, 1/4 cup honey, 2 cups whole milk, 1 tablespoon cornstarch, 4 large eggs, 2 tablespoons vegetable oil. Candy walnuts in sugar water, bake until crispy. Coat shrimp in egg and cornstarch. Fry until golden. Mix mayo, honey, and condensed milk. Toss fried shrimp in sauce, top with candied walnuts.

Peking pork chops.directions: Ingredients needed: 1/4 cup sugar. Pound pork thin, dredge in flour, dip in egg, coat in cornstarch. Fry until golden. Make sauce with ketchup, Worcestershire, sugar, soy, vinegar. Simmer until glossy. Pour over crispy pork chops.

XO crispy noodles.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 lb fresh Hong Kong-style egg noodles, 4 tbsp vegetable oil (divided), 3 tbsp XO sauce, 1/2 lb shrimp (peeled and deveined), 4 oz scallops, 1 cup bok choy (chopped), 1/2 cup carrots (julienned), 1 red bell pepper (sliced), 4 cloves garlic (minced), 2 tbsp soy sauce, 1 tbsp oyster sauce, 1 tsp sesame oil, 1/4 cup chicken stock, 2 g reen onions (sliced). 1. Boil noodles 2-3 min until just tender, drain and toss with 1 tbsp oil. 2. Heat 2 tbsp oil in large skillet over medium-high heat, spread noodles in even layer. 3. Cook without stirring 5-7 min until bottom is golden and crispy, flip and cook other side 5 min, set aside on plate. 4. Heat remaining oil in wok over high heat, cook shrimp and scallops 3-4 min until done, set aside. 5. Add garlic and XO sauce, stir-fry 1 min. 6. Add vegetables, stir-fry 3-4 min. 7. Return seafood to wok, add soy sauce, oyster sauce, and chicken stock, toss 2 min. 8. Pour seafood and vegetables over crispy noodles. 9. Drizzle with sesame oil, garnish with green onions and serve.

Salt and pepper crab.directions: Ingredients needed: 12 oz crab meat, 1 teaspoon white pepper, 4 cloves garlic, minced, 1 tablespoon fresh ginger, minced, 1 jalapeño, seeded and minced, 6 g reen onions, chopped, 2 tablespoons cornstarch, 1/4 cup oil. Clean and quarter crab. Coat pieces in cornstarch. Deep fry until shell is crispy. Stir-fry garlic, ginger, jalapeños. Add fried crab, toss with salt and white pepper. Garnish with scallions.

ingredients: boneless skinless chicken thighs, cut into 1-inch cubes
General Tso's but actually crispy.directions:
Ingredients needed: 1.5 lbs boneless skinless chicken thighs, cut into 1-inch cubes, 1 cup all-purpose flour, 1/2 cup cornstarch, 2 large eggs, beaten, 1 tsp salt, 1 tsp baking powder, 2 tbsp vegetable oil for stir-fry, 8-10 dried red chilies, 4 cloves garlic, minced, 2 tbsp ginger, minced, 1/4 cup soy sauce, 3 tbsp rice vinegar, 3 tbsp hoisin sauce, 3 tbsp sugar, 2 tbsp Shaoxing wine, 1 tbsp cornstarch mixed with 2 tbsp water, 1 tsp sesame oil, 3 g reen onions, cut into 1-inch pieces. 1. Season chicken with salt. Mix flour, cornstarch, and baking powder in bowl.
2. Dip chicken in beaten eggs, then dredge in flour mixture until well coated. Let rest 5 minutes.
3. Heat 2 inches of vegetable oil in wok to 350°F.
4. Fry chicken in batches for 4-5 minutes until golden and crispy (internal temp 165°F). Drain on paper towels.
5. Increase oil temperature to 375°F. Fry chicken again for 1-2 minutes for extra crispiness. Drain.
6. Mix sauce: combine soy sauce, rice vinegar, hoisin sauce, sugar, and Shaoxing wine. Set aside.
7. Heat 2 tbsp oil in clean wok over high heat (450°F). Add dried chilies, stir-fry for 30 seconds.
8. Add garlic and ginger, stir-fry for 15 seconds until fragrant.
9. Pour in sauce mixture, bring to boil.
10. Add cornstarch slurry, stir until sauce thickens (about 1 minute).
11. Add fried chicken and green onions, toss quickly for 30 seconds to coat (don't oversoak or chicken will lose crispness).
12. Drizzle with sesame oil and serve immediately over steamed rice.

Orange beef.directions: Ingredients needed: 2 lbs ribeye steak, 1/4 cup orange juice, 1 cup orange zest, 1/3 cup soy sauce, 1/4 cup packed brown sugar, 5 cloves garlic, minced, 1 tablespoon fresh ginger, minced, 2 tablespoons cornstarch, 2 tablespoons vegetable oil. Slice beef thin, coat with cornstarch. Fry until crispy. Make sauce: simmer orange juice, zest, soy sauce, sugar, garlic, ginger until reduced. Thicken with cornstarch slurry. Toss beef in sauce.

Mongolian beef with crispy edges.directions: Ingredients needed: 1.5 lbs flank steak, 1/4 cup soy sauce, 1/4 cup packed brown sugar, 6 cloves garlic, minced, 1 tablespoon fresh ginger, minced, 1 tablespoon cornstarch, 1/4 cup vegetable oil, 2 tablespoons sesame seeds, 2 medium onions, diced. Slice beef thin, coat heavily with cornstarch. Deep fry until very crispy edges. Make thick sauce: soy sauce, brown sugar, garlic, ginger, thicken with cornstarch. Toss beef in sauce quickly. Top with sesame seeds and green onions.

Bulgogi with the char.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 lb beef sirloin, thinly sliced, 1/4 cup soy sauce, 1/4 cup packed brown sugar, 2 teaspoons sesame oil, 4 cloves garlic, minced, 2 teaspoons grated ginger, 2 ripe pears, diced, 1/2 tsp (to taste) black pepper, 2 medium onions, diced. Blend marinade with pear. Marinate very thin beef 4+ hours. Cook on blazing hot grill or cast iron for maximum char, 1-2 minutes per side. Top with green onions.

ingredients: For chicken: 2 lbs chicken thighs, 1 cup potato starch, 1 tsp salt, vegetable oil
For sauce: 1/2 cup gochujang, 1/4 cup honey, 2 tbsp soy sauce, 1 tbsp sesame oil
For waffles: 2 cups flour, 2 tbsp sugar, 1 tbsp baking powder, 1/2 tsp salt, 2 eggs, 1.75 cups milk, 1/2 cup melted butter
Maple syrup and butter for serving
Korean fried chicken and waffles.directions: 1. Fry chicken: Coat thighs in potato starch and salt. Fry at 350°F for 12-15 min until golden and 165°F internal temp. Drain. 2. Make sauce: Mix gochujang, honey, soy sauce, and sesame oil. Toss chicken in sauce. 3. For waffles: Mix flour, sugar, baking powder, salt. Whisk eggs, milk, melted butter. Combine wet and dry ingredients. 4. Cook waffles in preheated waffle iron 4-5 min until golden and crispy. 5. Serve Korean fried chicken on top of waffles with maple syrup and butter.

ingredients: sesame seeds and seaweed strips for garnish
Kimchi fried rice with crispy rice botto.directions: Ingredients needed: 4 cups cooked day-old rice, 1 1/2 cups kimchi (chopped), 1/4 cup kimchi juice, 1/2 lb pork belly or bacon (diced), 3 eggs, 4 tbsp vegetable oil (divided), 1/2 cup onion (diced), 3 cloves garlic (minced), 2 tbsp gochugaru (Korean chili flakes), 2 tbsp soy sauce, 1 tbsp sesame oil, 2 g reen onions (sliced). 1. Cook pork belly in large wok over medium-high heat 5-7 min until crispy, remove excess fat leaving 2 tbsp. 2. Add onion, cook 2 min. 3. Add garlic and kimchi, stir-fry 4-5 min until kimchi is caramelized. 4. Add rice, kimchi juice, gochugaru, and soy sauce, mix well. 5.
