Poach or 'cook' shrimp in lime juice. Add diced tomatoes, cucumber, red onion, serrano, cilantro. Season with hot sauce and salt. Serve chilled with tostadas.

Ceviche mixto.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 cup white fish, 12 oz shrimp, 1.5 lbs baby octopus, 2 limes, juiced, 1 medium yellow onion, chopped, 1/4 cup fresh cilantro, chopped, 3 tablespoons aji amarillo paste, 3 cups fresh corn, 1/2 cup sweet potato. Cook octopus until tender, slice. 'Cook' diced fish and shrimp in lime juice. Combine with octopus, onion, cilantro, aji. Serve with corn kernels and sweet potato slices.

Crab ceviche.directions: Ingredients needed: 8 oz lump crab meat, 2 limes, juiced, 2 ripe avocados, diced, 1/2 cup cilantro, 1 lb 1 serrano pepper, diced, 2 medium onions, diced, 1 (28 oz) can crushed tomatoes, 1/2 cup tostadas. Combine crab with lime juice, diced avocado, tomatoes, onion, serrano, cilantro. Season with salt. Serve chilled on tostadas.

Octopus ceviche.directions: Ingredients needed: 2 lbs octopus, 2 limes, juiced, 1 large onion, diced, 1/2 cup cilantro, 1/2 cup aji limo, 1/4 cup olive oil, 1 lb sweet potato, 1 (15 oz) can corn, drained. Boil octopus until tender. Slice thin. Marinate in lime juice with sliced red onion, aji limo, cilantro. Season with salt and olive oil. Serve with sweet potato and toasted corn.

Pulpo a la gallega.directions: Ingredients needed: 1.5 lbs baby octopus, 2 lbs Yukon gold potatoes, diced, 2 teaspoons paprika, 1/4 cup olive oil, 1.5 teaspoons coarse salt. Freeze and thaw octopus to tenderize. Boil in unsalted water, dipping 3 times before submerging. Cook 45 minutes. Boil potatoes in same water. Slice both. Drizzle with olive oil, paprika, and coarse salt.

Pulpo a la parrilla.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 (2 lb) octopus, 1/4 cup olive oil, 5 cloves garlic, minced, 1 lemon, juiced, 2 tablespoons dried parsley, 2 teaspoons paprika. Boil octopus until tender. Drain and dry. Grill over high heat until charred. Slice, drizzle with garlic olive oil, lemon juice, smoked paprika. Garnish with parsley.

Gambas a la plancha.directions: Ingredients needed: 1.5 lbs shrimp (21-25 count), 1/4 cup olive oil, 2 teaspoons coarse salt, 6 cloves garlic, minced, 2 tablespoons dried parsley, 2 lemons, juiced and zested. Heat plancha or cast iron until smoking. Season shrimp with salt. Cook in olive oil 1-2 minutes per side. Finish with garlic, parsley, lemon. Simple and perfect.

Calamares fritos.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 lb squid, cleaned and sliced, 1/2 cup all-purpose flour, 3 tablespoons vegetable oil, 1 lemon, juiced, 2 cups aioli. Clean and slice squid into rings. Dredge in seasoned flour. Fry at 375°F 2-3 minutes until golden and crispy. Don't overcook. Serve with lemon and aioli.

ingredients: rabbit, cut into pieces (or more chicken)
squid, cleaned and sliced into rings
Paella mixta.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 lb chicken thighs, cut into pieces, 1/2 lb rabbit, cut into pieces (or more chicken), 1/2 lb Spanish chorizo, sliced, 1/2 lb large shrimp, peeled, deveined, 1/2 lb squid, cleaned and sliced into rings, 1/2 lb mussels, scrubbed, 1/2 lb clams, scrubbed, 2 1/2 cups bomba rice, 2 medium onions, diced, 2 bell peppers, sliced, 6 cloves garlic, minced, 4 large tomatoes, diced, 6 cups chicken stock, hot, 1 tsp saffron threads, 2 tsp smoked paprika, 1 cup green beans, cut into 2-inch pieces, 1 cup frozen peas, 1/2 cup olive oil, 1/2 tsp (to taste) black pepper, 1 large lemon, 1/3 cup fresh parsley. 1. Crush saffron, steep in 1/2 cup warm stock. Keep remaining stock hot. 2. Heat olive oil in 16-inch paella pan over medium-high heat. Season chicken and rabbit with salt and pepper. Brown 4-5 min per side. Remove. 3. Cook chorizo until browned, 3 min. Remove. 4. Reduce to medium heat. Sauté onion and bell pepper 6 min. Add garlic, cook 1 min. Stir in paprika, cook 30 sec. 5. Add grated tomatoes, cook 4 min until thick. Stir in green beans, cook 2 min. 6. Add rice, stir to coat with mixture, toast 2 min. 7. Pour in hot stock and saffron. Arrange chicken, rabbit, and chorizo evenly over rice. Don't stir from this point. Bring to strong boil over high heat. 8. Reduce to medium heat, cook 10 min. Reduce to low, cook 10 min more. 9. Nestle shrimp, squid, mussels, and clams into rice. Scatter peas over top. Cook 8-10 min until seafood is cooked, rice is al dente, and liquid absorbed. 10. Remove from heat. Cover with foil, rest 5 min. Garnish with parsley and lemon wedges. Serve from pan.

ingredients: large shrimp, peeled and deveined, shells reserved
squid, cleaned and cut into rings
firm white fish (monkfish or halibut), cubed
fish stock or seafood broth, hot
Paella de mariscos.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 lb large shrimp, peeled and deveined, shells reserved, 1 lb mussels, scrubbed and debearded, 1 lb clams, scrubbed, 1/2 lb squid, cleaned and cut into rings, 1/2 lb firm white fish (monkfish or halibut), cubed, 2 1/2 cups bomba rice, 1 medium yellow onion, chopped, 6 cloves garlic, minced, 1 (28 oz) can crushed tomatoes, 1 tsp saffron threads, 2 tsp smoked paprika, 6 cups fish stock or seafood broth, hot, 1/2 cup dry white wine, 1/2 cup olive oil, 1/2 tsp (to taste) black pepper, 1/4 cup fresh parsley, chopped, 1 large lemon. 1. Make quick shrimp stock: Sauté reserved shrimp shells in 2 tbsp olive oil 3 min. Add 2 cups water, simmer 15 min. Strain, add to fish stock. Keep hot. 2. Crush saffron, steep in 1/2 cup warm stock. 3. Heat remaining olive oil in paella pan over medium heat. Sauté onion 5 min until soft. Add garlic, cook 1 min. Add paprika, cook 30 sec. 4. Add grated tomatoes, cook 5 min until thick. Add wine, reduce 2 min. 5. Stir in rice, coat with mixture, toast 2 min. 6. Pour in hot stock and saffron. Don't stir from this point. Bring to boil over high heat. 7. Reduce to medium heat, cook 10 min. Reduce to medium-low, cook 8 min more. 8. Arrange fish cubes on rice. Nestle in shrimp, squid, mussels, and clams. Cook 8-10 min until seafood is done, rice is al dente, and liquid absorbed. 9. Remove from heat, cover with foil, rest 5 min. Discard unopened shellfish. Garnish with parsley and lemon. Serve immediately.

Fideu\u00e0.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 lb egg noodles, 1 lb large shrimp, peeled and deveined, 2 lbs littleneck clams, 1 lb mussels, 2 cups fish broth, 1/2 teaspoon saffron, 6 cloves garlic, minced, 2 teaspoons paprika, 1/4 cup olive oil, 1 lb aioli. Toast noodles in oil until golden. Add garlic and paprika. Add saffron-infused broth. Simmer 10 minutes. Add seafood, cover 5 minutes until shells open. Let rest 5 minutes. Serve with dollop of aioli.

Arroz negro.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 cup jasmine rice, 1.5 lbs squid tubes, 1.5 lbs squid tubes, 4 cups fish stock, 6 cloves garlic, minced, 2 tablespoons olive oil, 1/4 cup fresh parsley, chopped. Clean squid, reserve ink. Sauté squid and garlic in oil. Add rice, coat in oil. Add broth and squid ink. Simmer covered 18 minutes until rice is tender. Garnish with parsley.

Arroz a banda.directions: Ingredients needed: 2 cups white rice, 2 cups fish broth, 1.5 lbs shrimp (21-25 count), 1/2 teaspoon saffron, 4 cloves garlic, minced, 1/2 teaspoon paprika, 2 tablespoons olive oil, 1 lb aioli. Toast rice in olive oil with garlic and paprika. Add saffron-infused fish broth. Simmer until rice is tender and liquid absorbed. Serve with seared shrimp and aioli.

Cochinillo asado.directions: Ingredients needed: 8 oz suckling pig, 1/4 cup olive oil, 2 bay leaves, 2 teaspoons fresh thyme, 3/4 cup white wine, 5 cloves garlic, minced. Score skin of suckling pig. Season inside with garlic, herbs, salt. Roast at 350°F 2-3 hours, basting with wine and oil, until meat is tender and skin is crackling crisp. Traditional Castilian dish.

Cordero asado.directions: Ingredients needed: 2 lbs lamb shoulder, 5 cloves garlic, minced, 3 sprigs fresh rosemary, 1/2 cup dry wine, 3 tablespoons olive oil, 1/2 tsp (to taste) black pepper, 6 medium potatoes, quartered. Stud lamb with garlic. Season with rosemary, salt, pepper. Roast at 325°F with wine and oil 3-4 hours. Add potatoes last hour. Baste frequently. Spanish roast lamb.

Chulet\u00f3n.directions: Ingredients needed: 8 oz bone-in ribeye, 2 teaspoons coarse salt, 3 tablespoons olive oil, 1/2 tsp (to taste) black pepper. The Spanish tomahawk. Bring 2+ inch thick steak to room temp. Season heavily with coarse salt. Grill over high heat 5-6 minutes per side for medium-rare. Rest. Slice against bone.

Secreto ib\u00e9rico.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 1/2 lbs secreto ibérico (Iberian pork secreto), 3 cloves garlic, minced, 2 tbsp olive oil, 1 tsp smoked paprika, 2 cups coarse sea salt, 3 cups cracked black pepper. 1. Let meat come to room temp 30 min. Pat dry. 2. Rub with olive oil, garlic, and paprika. Season generously with salt and pepper. 3. Heat cast iron skillet or grill to high heat. 4. Sear meat 2-3 min per side for medium-rare (130-135°F). This cut is best served pink. 5. Rest 5 min. Slice against grain. Drizzle with quality olive oil and flaky salt. Serve immediately.

Presa ib\u00e9rica.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 1/2 lbs presa ibérica (Iberian pork shoulder), 3 tbsp olive oil, 3 cloves garlic, minced, 1 tsp fresh rosemary, chopped, 1 lb coarse sea salt. 1. Bring pork to room temp 30 min. Score fat cap in crosshatch. 2. Rub with olive oil, garlic, and rosemary. Season heavily with salt and pepper. 3. Heat grill or cast iron to medium-high. 4. Sear fat-side down first, 3-4 min until crispy. Flip, cook 4-5 min more for medium (140°F). 5. Rest 8 min. Slice thickly. Finish with flaky salt and best olive oil.

Pluma ib\u00e9rica.directions: Ingredients needed: 4 pluma ibérica steaks (6 oz each), 2 tbsp olive oil, 2 cloves garlic, smashed, 2 teaspoons fresh thyme, 1/2 cup coarse sea salt, 2 cups cracked black pepper. 1. Bring steaks to room temp 20 min. Pat dry thoroughly. 2. Season generously with salt and pepper. 3. Heat olive oil with garlic and thyme in skillet over high heat until smoking. 4. Sear steaks 2 min per side for medium-rare (130°F). This marbled cut should be cooked pink. 5. Rest 3 min. Serve whole or sliced with finishing salt.

Jam\u00f3n ib\u00e9rico.directions: Ingredients needed: 8-12 slices Jamón ibérico de bellota (acorn-fed, hand-carved), 1/4 cup olive oil, 3 roma tomatoes, chopped, 2 cups shredded cheddar cheese. 1. Remove jamón from refrigerator 30 min before serving. Must be at room temperature. 2. Arrange slices on plate, allowing them to drape naturally. Don't overlap. 3. Drizzle very lightly with quality olive oil if desired, though purists serve it plain. 4. Serve with crusty bread, manchego, and possibly pan con tomate. Let the ham be the star.

Jam\u00f3n serrano.directions: Ingredients needed: 1/2 cup 8-12 thin slices jamón serrano, 6 slices thick-cut bread, 1/4 cup olive oil, 4 large tomatoes, diced. 1. Bring jamón to room temperature 20 min before serving. 2. Arrange slices on plate. 3. Serve with toasted bread, olive oil, and fresh tomato. Classic Spanish tapa.

Manchego and membrillo.directions: Ingredients needed: 8 oz Manchego cheese (12-month aged), sliced, 6 oz membrillo (quince paste), sliced, 3/4 cup chopped almonds, 6 slices thick-cut bread. 1. Let cheese come to room temp 30 min. 2. Slice manchego into 1/4-inch pieces. Slice membrillo into similar size. 3. Arrange on board alternating cheese and membrillo. Add almonds. Serve with crackers or bread. Perfect match of salty and sweet.

Tortilla espa\u00f1ola loaded.directions: Ingredients needed: 6 Yukon gold potatoes, thinly sliced, 1 onion, thinly sliced, 6 oz Spanish chorizo, diced, 1 red bell pepper, diced, 8 eggs, 1 1/2 cups olive oil. 1. Heat olive oil in 10-inch skillet to 250°F. Cook potatoes and onion gently 25 min until tender. Add chorizo and pepper last 5 min. Drain, reserve oil. 2. Beat eggs with 1 tsp salt and pepper. Fold in potato mixture. Let stand 10 min. 3. Heat 3 tbsp oil in same skillet over medium-high. Pour in mixture, spread evenly. Reduce to medium-low, cook 6 min, shaking pan. 4. Invert onto plate. Slide back in, cook 4 min more. 5. Rest 10 min before cutting.

ingredients: medium potatoes, peeled and diced small
Spanish chorizo or jamón serrano, diced
Huevos rotos.directions: Ingredients needed: 4 medium potatoes, peeled and diced small, 8 oz Spanish chorizo or jamón serrano, diced, 8 eggs, 1/2 cup olive oil, 4 cloves garlic, sliced, 1 tsp smoked paprika. 1. Heat 1/4 cup olive oil in large skillet over medium-high heat. Add potatoes, season with salt. Fry 12-15 min, stirring occasionally, until golden and crispy. Add garlic last 2 min. Remove to plate. 2. In same pan, add chorizo, cook 3-4 min until crispy. Return potatoes to pan, toss with paprika. 3. Heat remaining oil in separate large skillet over medium-high heat. Crack eggs into pan, fry 2-3 min until whites set but yolks very runny. 4. Divide potato-chorizo mixture among plates. Top each with 2 fried eggs. 5. Break yolks with fork, let them run into potatoes (rotos means broken). Season with salt and pepper, garnish with parsley. Serve with crusty bread.

ingredients: FOR BRAVAS SAUCE: 2 tbsp olive oil, 2 cloves garlic minced, 1 tsp smoked paprika, 1/2 tsp cayenne, 1 cup tomato sauce, 1 tbsp sherry vinegar, salt
FOR AIOLI: 1/2 cup mayonnaise, 2 cloves garlic minced, 1 tbsp lemon juice, salt
Patatas bravas with two sauces.directions: Ingredients needed: 2 lbs potatoes, cut into 1-inch cubes, 2 tablespoons vegetable oil, 2 tablespoons dried parsley. 1. MAKE BRAVAS SAUCE: Heat olive oil over medium heat. Cook garlic 1 min. Add paprika and cayenne, cook 30 sec. Add tomato sauce, simmer 10 min. Stir in vinegar, season with salt. Set aside. 2. MAKE AIOLI: Mix mayo, garlic, lemon juice, and salt. Refrigerate. 3. Parboil potatoes in salted water 6 min. Drain, dry completely. 4. Heat 2 inches oil to 350°F. Fry potatoes in batches 5-7 min until golden and crispy. Drain, season with salt. 5. Pile potatoes on plate. Drizzle both sauces over top. Garnish with parsley. Serve immediately.

Croquetas de jam\u00f3n.directions: Ingredients needed: 4 tbsp butter, 1/2 cup flour, 2 cups whole milk, 6 oz jamón serrano, finely diced, 1/4 tsp nutmeg, 6 eggs, 2 cups panko breadcrumbs, 2 tablespoons vegetable oil. 1. Make thick béchamel: Melt butter, whisk in flour, cook 2 min. Gradually add milk, whisking constantly. Cook, stirring, until very thick, 8 min. 2. Stir in jamón, nutmeg, salt, pepper. Spread on plate, cool completely, then refrigerate 3 hours until firm. 3. Shape into 2-inch cylinders. Coat in flour, dip in egg, roll in panko. 4. Heat oil to 350°F. Fry croquetas 2-3 min until deep golden. Drain. Serve hot.

Croquetas de pollo.directions: Ingredients needed: 2.5 lbs chicken pieces, 4 tablespoons butter, 1/2 cup all-purpose flour, 1.5 cups milk, 1/2 teaspoon nutmeg, 6 eggs, 1 cup breadcrumbs, 1/4 cup vegetable oil. Finely shred cooked chicken. Make thick béchamel, fold in chicken. Chill until firm. Shape into cylinders. Dredge in flour, egg, breadcrumbs. Fry at 350°F until golden.

Croquetas de bacalao.directions: Ingredients needed: 1.5 lbs salt cod, 4 tablespoons butter, 1/4 cup flour, 1 cup milk, 1/4 teaspoon ground nutmeg, 6 eggs, 3/4 cup panko breadcrumbs, 3 tablespoons vegetable oil. Desalt and shred cod. Make thick béchamel with butter, flour, milk. Fold in cod. Chill until firm. Shape into cylinders. Bread with flour, egg, breadcrumbs. Fry until golden.

Bu\u00f1uelos de bacalao.directions: Ingredients needed: 1.5 lbs salt cod, 2 lbs Yukon gold potatoes, diced, 6 eggs, 6 cloves garlic, minced, 2 tablespoons dried parsley, 1/4 cup flour, 1/4 cup vegetable oil. Soak and desalt cod. Boil with potatoes until both tender. Mash together with eggs, garlic, parsley. Form fritters. Fry at 350°F until golden. Drain and serve.

Chorizo a la sidra.directions: Ingredients needed: 12 oz Mexican chorizo, 1 lb hard cider, 3 bay leaves. Poke holes in chorizo. Simmer in hard cider with bay leaf 20-25 minutes. Let cider reduce. Chorizo should be cooked through with cider flavor. Serve with crusty bread.

Chorizo al vino.directions: Ingredients needed: 12 oz Mexican chorizo, 3/4 cup white wine, 1 bay leaf, 5 cloves garlic, minced. Poke holes in chorizo. Simmer in red wine with bay leaf and garlic 20-25 minutes until cooked through and wine reduces. Slice and serve with bread to soak up wine sauce.

Boquerones fritos.directions: Ingredients needed: 2 tablespoons anchovy paste, 1/2 cup all-purpose flour, 1/4 cup vegetable oil, 2 lemons, juiced and zested. Clean anchovies, fan out. Dredge in seasoned flour. Deep fry at 375°F until golden and crispy, about 2 minutes. Drain. Season with salt. Serve with lemon.

Boquerones en vinagre.directions: Ingredients needed: 2 tablespoons anchovy paste, 1/2 cup dry wine, 6 cloves garlic, minced, 1/3 cup fresh parsley, 3 tablespoons olive oil. Clean and fillet anchovies. Marinate in vinegar 6-8 hours until white and 'cooked'. Drain. Dress with olive oil, minced garlic, parsley. Serve cold as tapas.

Anchovy toast.directions: Ingredients needed: 6 slices thick-cut bread, 1 lb 6 anchovy fillets, minced, 1/4 cup (4 tbsp) butter, 5 cloves garlic, minced, 3 tablespoons fresh lemon juice, 1/4 cup fresh parsley, chopped. Toast bread. Mash anchovies with softened butter, garlic, lemon juice. Spread on toast. Garnish with parsley.

Pan con tomate... tomato.directions: Ingredients needed: 6 slices thick-cut bread, 2 (14.5 oz) cans diced tomatoes, 3 tablespoons olive oil, 4 cloves garlic, minced. Toast bread. Rub with cut garlic clove. Cut tomato in half, rub onto bread letting pulp soak in. Drizzle generously with olive oil. Sprinkle with salt.

Morcilla.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 lb Spanish morcilla (blood sausage), 2 tbsp olive oil, 3 cups roasted piquillo peppers for serving. 1. Slice morcilla into 1/2-inch thick rounds. 2. Heat olive oil in skillet over medium heat. 3. Cook morcilla 3-4 min per side until crispy outside and heated through. 4. Serve with roasted peppers and crusty bread.

Fabada asturiana.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 (15 oz) can cannellini beans, 8 oz Spanish chorizo, sliced, 1 lb Italian sausage, 3-4 lbs pork shoulder, 6 slices bacon, 1/2 teaspoon saffron, 1 bay leaf, 1/2 tsp (to taste) black pepper. Soak beans overnight. Cover with water, add pork, bacon, bay leaf. Simmer 1.5 hours. Add chorizo, blood sausage, saffron. Simmer 30 more minutes until beans are creamy. Season with salt and pepper. Let rest before serving.

Cocido madrile\u00f1o.directions: Ingredients needed: 2 cups fresh peas, 2.5 lbs beef, 1 lb pork belly, sliced, 12 oz Mexican chorizo, 1 lb morcilla, 8 oz ham steak, diced, 2 lbs Yukon gold potatoes, diced, 6 cups shredded cabbage, 12 oz wide noodles, 1/2 cup tocino. Traditional Madrid version. Slow cook meats with chickpeas. Serve as three vuelcos: soup with noodles, vegetables and chickpeas, then meats sliced on platter.

Callos a la madrile\u00f1a.directions: Ingredients needed: 2 lbs beef chuck roast, 1 lb chorizo, casings removed, 1 lb morcilla, 1 lb ham, cubed, 1 cup frozen peas, 2 cups tomato sauce, 2 teaspoons paprika, 3 bay leaves, 6 cloves garlic, minced. Simmer tripe with ham hock until very tender, 3+ hours. Add sliced chorizo, morcilla, chickpeas, tomato sauce, paprika, bay leaf, garlic. Simmer 30 more minutes until thick.

Rabo de toro.directions: Ingredients needed: 3 lbs oxtail pieces, 3/4 cup white wine, 6 cups beef broth, 1 medium yellow onion, chopped, 2 cups sliced carrots, 4 cloves garlic, minced, 1 (28 oz) can crushed tomatoes, 3 bay leaves, 2 teaspoons fresh thyme, 1/2 cup all-purpose flour. Dredge oxtail in flour, brown well. Sauté vegetables. Add wine, reduce. Add broth and herbs. Braise covered at 300°F for 4+ hours until meat falls off bone. Reduce sauce, serve over mashed potatoes.

Carrillada.directions: Ingredients needed: 3 lbs pork butt, 1/2 cup dry wine, 4 cups beef broth, 1/4 cup tomato paste, 1/2 teaspoon thyme, 3 bay leaves, 5 cloves garlic, minced, 1/2 tsp (to taste) black pepper. Season and brown pork cheeks. Add wine, reduce by half. Add broth, tomato paste, herbs, garlic. Braise covered at 300°F 3 hours until meltingly tender.

Solomillo al whisky.directions: Ingredients needed: 2 lbs pork shoulder, 8 oz whisky, 3/4 cup heavy cream, 1/4 cup (4 tbsp) butter, 2 large shallots, diced, 2 tablespoons yellow mustard, 1/2 tsp (to taste) black pepper. Season and slice tenderloin into medallions. Sear in butter 2-3 minutes per side. Remove. Sauté shallots. Add whisky (flame if desired). Add cream and mustard. Simmer until thickened. Return pork to coat.

Flamenqu\u00edn.directions: Ingredients needed: 3 lbs pork butt, 2 cups diced ham (12 oz), 1/2 cup all-purpose flour, 3 large eggs, 3/4 cup panko breadcrumbs, 1/4 cup vegetable oil, 1/2 tsp (to taste) black pepper. Pound pork thin. Roll around jamón serrano strips. Bread with flour, egg, breadcrumbs. Deep fry until golden and cooked through. Slice on bias. Córdoba specialty.

Lomo en manteca.directions: Ingredients needed: 3 lbs pork butt, 3 tablespoons lard, 2 teaspoons paprika, 6 cloves garlic, minced, 1 teaspoon dried oregano, 2 bay leaves. Cut pork loin into thick slices. Season with salt, paprika, garlic, oregano. Confit in lard with bay leaf at 200°F for 3 hours. Store submerged in fat. Fry pieces as needed until crispy.

Ajo blanco.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 cup slivered almonds, 6 slices thick-cut bread, 6 cloves garlic, minced, 3 tablespoons olive oil, 1/4 cup vinegar, 2 cups water, 1 lb grapes. Soak bread in water. Blend almonds with garlic, bread, olive oil, vinegar until creamy. Add cold water to thin. Season with salt. Serve cold with green grapes.

Gachas.directions: Ingredients needed: 1/4 cup flour, 3 tablespoons olive oil, 1 lb pork belly, sliced, 12 oz Mexican chorizo, 1 teaspoon paprika, 5 cloves garlic, minced, 1 cup water. Fry pork belly and chorizo. Remove. Toast flour in fat. Add paprika, garlic. Slowly add water, stirring to form porridge. Cook until thick. Serve with crispy pork and chorizo on top.

Escudella.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 (15 oz) can white beans, 2 cups fresh peas, 3-4 lbs pork shoulder, 2.5 lbs beef, 2.5 lbs chicken pieces, 1 lb smoked sausage, sliced, 2 lbs Yukon gold potatoes, diced, 6 cups shredded cabbage, 12 oz wide noodles. Catalan Christmas stew. Simmer meats with beans and chickpeas 2-3 hours. Add potatoes and cabbage last 30 minutes. Serve broth with noodles first, then meats and vegetables separately.

Suquet de peix.directions: Ingredients needed: 1/2 cup monkfish, 1.5 lbs manila clams, 4 medium russet potatoes, cubed, 3 cups fish stock, 1 cup slivered almonds, 4 cloves garlic, minced, 2 (14.5 oz) cans diced tomatoes, 1/4 teaspoon saffron threads, 3 tablespoons olive oil, 1/3 cup fresh parsley. Make picada by grinding almonds, garlic, parsley. Fry potatoes and tomato. Add fish stock, saffron, picada. Add fish and clams. Simmer until fish is cooked and clams open. Serve in bowl with broth.

Romesco sauce on anything.directions: Ingredients needed: 1.5 cups nyora peppers, 1 (28 oz) can crushed tomatoes, 1 cup slivered almonds, 2 cups hazelnuts, 5 cloves garlic, minced, 3 tablespoons vinegar, 1/4 cup olive oil, 2 teaspoons paprika. Rehydrate nyoras. Blend with roasted tomatoes, toasted nuts, fried garlic, vinegar, olive oil, and paprika. Serve with grilled vegetables, seafood, bread, or as dipping sauce.

Esqueixada.directions: Ingredients needed: 12 oz salt cod, 1 (28 oz) can crushed tomatoes, 2 medium onions, diced, 1 (6 oz) can sliced olives, 2 bell peppers, sliced, 1/4 cup olive oil, 1/4 cup vinegar. Shred desalted raw cod. Mix with diced tomatoes, onion, olives, pepper. Dress with olive oil and vinegar. Chill before serving. Catalan summer salad.

Brandada de bacalao.directions: Ingredients needed: 12 oz salt cod, 2 lbs Yukon gold potatoes, diced, 2 tablespoons olive oil, 5 cloves garlic, minced, 1.5 cups milk, 1/2 tsp (to taste) black pepper, 2 cups toast. Soak and desalt cod. Poach in milk until flaky. Boil potatoes. Mash cod with potatoes while adding olive oil and garlic until creamy and emulsified. Serve warm with toast.

Bacalao al pil pil.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 lb salt cod, soaked and flaked, 3 tablespoons olive oil, 4 cloves garlic, minced, 1/4 cup fresh dill. Soak and desalt cod. Poach in olive oil with sliced garlic and peppers over very low heat. Remove fish. Emulsify oil by shaking pan vigorously until it forms white pil pil sauce. Pour over cod.

Bacalao a la vizca\u00edna.directions: Ingredients needed: 1.5 lbs salt cod, 1 tablespoon dried red peppers, 2 cups tomato sauce, 3 tablespoons olive oil, 5 cloves garlic, minced, 4 slices bread, 2 lbs Yukon gold potatoes, diced. Soak and desalt cod. Toast peppers, soak, blend into paste with fried bread. Fry garlic, add pepper paste and tomato sauce. Add cod and sliced potatoes. Simmer until potatoes tender.

Marmitako.directions: Ingredients needed: 4 (8 oz) sirloin steaks, 2 lbs Yukon gold potatoes, diced, 1 (8 oz) can tomato sauce, 3 cups fish broth, 1 teaspoon paprika, 4 cloves garlic, minced, 2 tablespoons olive oil, 1/2 tsp (to taste) black pepper. Sauté garlic in oil. Add cubed potatoes, paprika, tomato sauce. Add broth, simmer 20 minutes until potatoes are tender. Add cubed raw tuna. Cook 5 more minutes until tuna is just cooked through. Season.

Txangurro.directions: Ingredients needed: 12 oz crab meat, 2 medium onions, diced, 4 large tomatoes, diced, 8 oz brandy, 3 cups fish stock, 1.5 cups breadcrumbs, 2 tablespoons dried parsley, 3 tablespoons butter. Cook and clean crab, reserve shells. Sauté onion and tomato, add brandy, flambé. Add crab meat and stock. Fill shells with mixture. Top with breadcrumbs. Bake at 400°F until golden.

Kokotxas.directions: Ingredients needed: 1.5 lbs cod, 1/4 cup olive oil, 6 cloves garlic, minced, 2 tablespoons dried parsley, 3 cups fish stock, 1/4 cup flour. Season kokotxas, dust with flour. Sauté garlic in olive oil, remove. Add kokotxas, cook briefly. Swirl in stock and parsley to create emulsion (pil-pil style). Serve immediately with sauce.

Pintxos spread.directions: Ingredients needed: 6 slices thick-cut bread, 1 lb jamón serrano, 2 tablespoons anchovy paste, 1 lb Gilda peppers, 1 cup sliced black olives, 8 oz manchego, 1 lb tortilla española, 1 lb bacalao. Toast bread rounds. Top with various items: jamón, anchovies, cheese, tortilla wedges. Make Gilda by skewering pepper, olive, anchovy. Arrange on platter for self-serve grazing.

Gilda.directions: Ingredients needed: 1/4 cup fresh dill, 2 lbs anchovy fillets, 3/4 cup green olives, 2 tablespoons olive oil. Thread on toothpick: guindilla pepper, anchovy, olive. Repeat pattern. Drizzle with olive oil. The original Basque pintxo - perfect with white wine.

Pintxo de tortilla.directions: Ingredients needed: 3 large eggs, 2 lbs Yukon gold potatoes, diced, 1 medium yellow onion, chopped, 2 tablespoons olive oil, 4 slices bread. Make classic tortilla española. Cool and cut into small squares. Spear each on thick slice of bread with toothpick. Serve at room temperature as bite-sized pintxos.

Txuleta.directions: Ingredients needed: 2 cups bone-in ribeye, 1 tablespoon coarse salt, 3 tablespoons olive oil. Use 2-3 inch thick bone-in ribeye. Bring to room temperature. Grill over very hot wood coals, 5-6 minutes per side for rare. Season with coarse salt after cooking. Rest 10 minutes. Slice thick.

ingredients: ribeye or New York strip steaks (1.5 inches thick)
Cider house steak.directions: Ingredients needed: 2 ribeye or New York strip steaks (1.5 inches thick), 2 tsp salt, 1 tsp black pepper, 2 tbsp vegetable oil, 4 tbsp butter, 3 s hallots sliced, 2 cups apple cider, 1/4 cup apple cider vinegar, 2 sprigs fresh thyme, 2 tbsp Dijon mustard. 1. Remove steaks from refrigerator 1 hour before cooking. Pat dry, season generously with salt and pepper. 2. Heat oil in large skillet over high heat. Sear steaks 3-4 min per side. Remove and set aside. 3. Reduce heat to medium. Add 2 tbsp butter and shallots, cook 3 min. 4. Add cider, vinegar, and thyme. Bring to boil, cook 10-12 min until reduced by half. 5. Whisk in mustard and remaining 2 tbsp butter. Return steaks to pan, baste with sauce 2-3 min until internal temp reaches 130°F for medium-rare. 6. Serve steaks with cider pan sauce.

Lamb chops Basque style.directions: Ingredients needed: 1.5 lbs lamb leg, 4 cloves garlic, minced, 1/4 cup fresh parsley, chopped, 1/4 cup olive oil, 1/4 cup vinegar, 2 teaspoons coarse salt, 1.5 cups piquillo peppers. Season chops with salt. Grill over high heat until charred outside, pink inside. Make dressing with minced garlic, parsley, olive oil, vinegar. Drizzle over chops. Serve with piquillo peppers.

Duck confit Gascony style.directions: Ingredients needed: 6 duck leg quarters, 1/3 cup kosher salt, 6 cloves garlic, smashed, 1 teaspoon dried thyme, 3 bay leaves, 1 tbsp black peppercorns, 5 cups duck fat, 4 cloves garlic, minced. 1. DAY 1: Mix salt, smashed garlic, thyme, bay leaves, and peppercorns. Rub all over duck legs. Place in dish, cover with remaining cure. Refrigerate 24-36 hours. 2. DAY 2 or 3: Rinse duck very thoroughly under cold water. Pat bone dry with paper towels. Let air dry 1 hour. 3. Preheat oven to 200°F. Arrange duck in single layer in deep baking dish. Add whole garlic cloves. Melt duck fat, pour over to completely cover duck. 4. Cover tightly. Bake 5-6 hours until meat is supremely tender and falling off bone. 5. Cool completely in fat. Store submerged up to 2 months refrigerated. 6. TO SERVE: Remove from fat. Heat heavy skillet over medium-high. Cook skin-side down without moving 8-10 min until deeply golden and crackling crisp. Flip 1 min. Serve with white beans or frisée salad.

ingredients: dried Tarbais or white beans, soaked overnight
Cassoulet toulousain.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 lb dried Tarbais or white beans, soaked overnight, 1 lb 4 duck confit legs, 1 lb pork shoulder, cubed, 1/2 lb pork belly, cubed, 1/2 lb fresh pork skin, 3/4 lb Toulouse sausage (or garlic sausage), 1 onion stuck with 4 cloves, 4 carrots, diced, 4 cloves garlic, minced, 2 (14.5 oz) cans diced tomatoes, 4 cups duck stock, 1/2 teaspoon thyme, 2 cups fresh breadcrumbs, 1/4 cup duck fat. 1. Drain beans. Simmer with pork skin, clove-studded onion, and bouquet garni 1 hour until tender. Drain, reserve liquid. Slice pork skin. 2. Preheat oven to 275°F. Brown pork shoulder and belly in large Dutch oven with duck fat, 10 min. Remove. 3. In same pot, layer: sliced pork skin on bottom, half the beans, all the meats (pork, sausage sliced, duck confit), remaining beans. 4. Add tomatoes, garlic head halved crosswise, fresh bouquet garni. Pour in duck stock to just below bean level. 5. Bring to simmer on stove. Cover, transfer to oven. Bake 2 hours. 6. Remove lid. Sprinkle breadcrumbs evenly over surface. Drizzle with duck fat. Bake uncovered 1 1/2 hours, pressing crust down into liquid every 30 min to create multiple crusts. 7. Let rest 20 min before serving. Crust should be golden, cassoulet creamy and rich.

Cassoulet castelnaudary.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 lb dried white beans, soaked overnight, 8 oz 4 duck confit legs, 1 1/2 lbs pork shoulder, cubed, 1/2 lb pork belly, cubed, 1/2 lb fresh pork skin or rind, 1 medium yellow onion, chopped, 3 medium carrots, sliced, 5 cloves garlic, minced, 4 large tomatoes, diced, 4 cups duck stock, 8 oz bouquet garni, 2 cups breadcrumbs, 2 tablespoons duck fat. 1. Cook beans with pork skin, clove onion, and bouquet garni 1 hour until tender. Drain, reserve liquid. Slice skin into pieces. 2. Preheat oven to 275°F. Season pork with salt and pepper. Brown in Dutch oven in duck fat, 8 min. Remove. 3. Layer in cassole or Dutch oven: pork skin pieces on bottom, layer of beans, browned pork, duck confit, remaining beans. Nestle in carrots, tomatoes, and garlic. 4. Pour in stock to nearly cover. Add bouquet garni. Bring to simmer. 5. Cover, bake 2 hours. Remove lid, sprinkle with breadcrumbs, drizzle duck fat. Bake uncovered 1 hour, breaking crust into beans twice during cooking. 6. Final crust should be deep golden. Let rest 15 min before serving.

Confit de canard with crispy potatoes.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 lb 4 duck leg confit, 2 lbs fingerling potatoes, halved, 4 cloves garlic, smashed, 2 teaspoons fresh thyme, 1/4 cup duck fat from confit, 1/2 tsp (to taste) black pepper, 1/4 cup fresh parsley, chopped. 1. Preheat oven to 425°F. Remove duck from fat, scrape off excess. 2. Toss potatoes with 3 tbsp duck fat, garlic, thyme, salt, and pepper. Spread on baking sheet. 3. Roast potatoes 30 min, flipping halfway, until golden and crispy. 4. Meanwhile, heat remaining duck fat in skillet over medium-high. Place duck skin-side down, cook 8-10 min until skin is deeply crispy. Flip, cook 2 min to warm through. 5. Serve duck over crispy potatoes, garnished with parsley.

Magret de canard.directions: Ingredients needed: 2 duck breasts (magrets), about 12 oz each, 1/2 tsp (to taste) black pepper, 1 tbsp honey, 2 tbsp red wine vinegar, 1 cup duck or chicken stock. 1. Score duck skin in crosshatch pattern, cutting through fat but not into meat. Season both sides with salt and pepper. 2. Place duck skin-side down in cold skillet. Turn heat to medium. Cook 8-10 min, rendering fat, until skin is golden and crispy. Pour off fat periodically. 3. Flip duck, cook 3-4 min for medium-rare (130°F internal temp). Transfer to cutting board, tent with foil, rest 8 min. 4. Pour off all but 1 tbsp fat. Add vinegar, scrape up browned bits. Add stock and honey, simmer 5 min until reduced by half and syrupy. 5. Slice duck thinly on bias. Drizzle with sauce. Serve with potatoes or green beans.

Duck fat fries.directions: Ingredients needed: 2 lbs Yukon gold potatoes, diced, 1/4 cup duck fat, 2 tablespoons dried parsley. Cut potatoes into fries. Soak 30 minutes. Blanch in duck fat at 325°F. Increase to 375°F, fry until golden and crispy. Season with salt and parsley. Rich and delicious.

Duck rillettes.directions: Ingredients needed: 2 lbs duck legs and thighs, 1 lb pork belly, diced, 3 cups duck fat, 4 cloves garlic, smashed, 1 teaspoon dried thyme, 2 bay leaves, 1/2 tsp ground allspice, 1/4 tsp ground cloves, 1/4 cup cognac, 1/2 tsp (to taste) black pepper. 1. Season duck and pork generously with salt, pepper, allspice, and cloves. Refrigerate overnight. 2. Preheat oven to 250°F. Place duck, pork, garlic, thyme, and bay leaves in Dutch oven. Cover with duck fat. 3. Cover, bake 4 hours until meat is falling-apart tender. 4. Remove meats to bowl, let cool slightly. Strain fat, reserve. 5. Shred meat finely with forks, discarding skin and bones. Mix in cognac. Taste, adjust seasoning aggressively. 6. Pack into jars or terrine. Pour thin layer of reserved fat over top to seal. Refrigerate at least 24 hours, up to 2 weeks. 7. Serve at room temperature with cornichons, mustard, and toasted baguette.

Pork rillettes.directions: Ingredients needed: 3 lbs pork shoulder, cubed, 1 lb pork belly, diced, 2 cups lard or duck fat, 1 cup dry white wine, 6 cloves garlic, smashed, 2 teaspoons fresh thyme, 3 bay leaves, 1/2 tsp ground nutmeg, 1/4 tsp ground cloves, 1/2 tsp (to taste) black pepper. 1. Season pork heavily with salt, pepper, nutmeg, and cloves. Refrigerate 8 hours or overnight. 2. Preheat oven to 275°F. Place pork in Dutch oven with wine, garlic, thyme, and bay leaves. Add lard to mostly cover. 3. Cover tightly, bake 4 hours until meat is completely tender. 4. Drain meats, reserve fat. Let cool 20 min. Remove herbs. 5. Shred meat very finely using forks or stand mixer with paddle. Mix in enough reserved fat to make spreadable consistency. Season aggressively with salt and pepper. 6. Pack tightly into jars. Pour melted fat over top to seal. Refrigerate minimum 24 hours, up to 3 weeks. Serve with crusty bread and pickles.

P\u00e2t\u00e9 de campagne.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 lb pork shoulder, ground, 1/2 lb pork liver, finely chopped, 1/2 lb pork fat or fatback, ground, 1/4 lb bacon, diced, 2 large shallots, diced, 3 cloves garlic, minced, 4 large eggs, 1/4 cup cognac, 2 tbsp heavy cream, 1 tsp fresh thyme, 1/2 tsp ground allspice, 1/4 tsp ground cloves, 1 tsp salt, 1/2 tsp black pepper, 12 slices bacon for lining terrine. 1. Preheat oven to 325°F. Line terrine mold or loaf pan with bacon slices, overlapping, with overhang. 2. Sauté shallots and garlic in 1 tbsp butter until soft, 3 min. Cool. 3. Mix pork, liver, pork fat, diced bacon, sautéed aromatics, eggs, cognac, cream, thyme, spices, salt, and pepper thoroughly. Fry small piece to test seasoning. Adjust. 4. Pack mixture firmly into bacon-lined terrine. Fold bacon ends over top. Cover tightly with foil. 5. Place terrine in roasting pan. Fill pan with hot water halfway up sides of terrine. 6. Bake 1 1/2 to 2 hours until internal temp reaches 155°F. 7. Remove from water bath. Weight down with heavy cans or plates. Refrigerate weighted down overnight. 8. Unmold or serve from terrine with cornichons, mustard, and baguette.

Chicken liver p\u00e2t\u00e9.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 lb chicken livers, trimmed, 1 cup (2 sticks) butter, divided, 3 s hallots, minced, 2 cloves garlic, minced, 2 tbsp cognac or brandy, 2 tbsp heavy cream, 1/2 tsp fresh thyme, 1/4 tsp ground allspice, 1/2 tsp (to taste) black pepper. 1. Melt 4 tbsp butter in large skillet over medium heat. Sauté shallots until soft, 3 min. Add garlic, cook 1 min. 2. Increase heat to medium-high. Add livers, season with salt and pepper. Cook 5-6 min, stirring, until browned outside but still pink inside. 3. Add cognac, let it flame. Add cream and thyme. Cook 1 min. Remove from heat. 4. Transfer to food processor. Add remaining butter (softened), allspice, salt, and pepper. Process until very smooth, 2-3 min, scraping down sides. 5. Push through fine-mesh sieve for ultra-smooth texture (optional but traditional). 6. Pack into ramekins or terrine. Smooth top. Pour thin layer of melted butter over surface to seal. 7. Refrigerate minimum 4 hours, up to 5 days. Serve at room temperature with toast points.

ingredients: 1/2 lbs fresh duck or goose foie gras, grade A
Foie gras terrine.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 1/2 lbs fresh duck or goose foie gras, grade A, 2 tsp salt, 1/2 tsp white pepper, 1/4 tsp ground allspice, 2 cups pinch pink curing salt (optional), 3 tbsp cognac or Armagnac, 2 tbsp sweet dessert wine (Sauternes). 1. DAY 1: Separate foie gras lobes. Remove veins carefully with tweezers. Let come to room temp 1 hour. 2. Season with salt, pepper, allspice, and curing salt. Drizzle with cognac and wine. Cover, refrigerate 4-6 hours. 3. Preheat oven to 200°F. Pack foie gras firmly into terrine mold, smooth top. 4. Place terrine in roasting pan. Fill pan with hot water halfway up terrine. Cover terrine with lid or foil. 5. Bake 45-60 min until internal temp reaches 115-120°F. Don't overcook. 6. Remove from water bath. Cool to room temp, then refrigerate weighted down overnight. Fat will rise to top. 7. Refrigerate 2-3 days before serving. Unmold, slice with hot knife. Serve with toasted brioche, fleur de sel, and sweet wine.

ingredients: brioche or baguette, sliced and toasted
Foie gras seared.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 lb fresh foie gras lobe, 8 oz coarse sea salt, 1 lb cracked black pepper, 1 cup brioche or baguette, sliced and toasted, 1 cup fleur de sel for serving. 1. Slice foie gras into 1/2-inch thick medallions. Let sit at room temp 15 min. 2. Score both sides lightly with knife. Season with salt and pepper. 3. Heat dry skillet (no oil) over high heat until very hot. 4. Sear foie gras 30-45 seconds per side until deeply caramelized outside but soft inside. It will release lots of fat. 5. Transfer immediately to toasted brioche. Sprinkle with fleur de sel. Serve at once.

Surf and turf: seared foie and lobster t.directions: Ingredients needed: 8 oz foie gras, 1/4 cup (4 tbsp) butter, 1/2 cup brioche, 1.5 cups 1, sliced pepper, 2 tablespoons chopped fresh chives. Butterfly lobster tail, brush with butter. Broil until just cooked. Score foie gras, sear in very hot dry pan 30 seconds per side. Toast brioche. Stack lobster on brioche, top with foie. Garnish with chives.

Wagyu beef tartare.directions: Ingredients needed: 3 lbs beef brisket, 3 egg yolks, 1/4 cup capers, 3 cups fresh corn, 2 large shallots, diced, 2 tablespoons Dijon mustard, 3 tablespoons Worcestershire sauce, 2 tablespoons olive oil, 1 cup crostini. Hand-cut wagyu into tiny cubes. Mix gently with minced capers, cornichons, shallots, mustard, Worcestershire. Season. Shape into mound. Top with egg yolk. Serve with crostini.

Bone marrow with parsley salt.directions: Ingredients needed: 3 lbs beef brisket, 1/3 cup fresh parsley, 2 large shallots, diced, 3 tablespoons capers, 3 tablespoons olive oil, 3 tablespoons fresh lemon juice, 1 lb toast. Soak bones in salted water 24 hours. Roast at 450°F 15-20 minutes until marrow is jiggly. Make parsley salad with shallots, capers, olive oil, lemon juice. Top marrow with salad. Serve with toast.

Truffle butter filet mignon.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 lb filet mignon, 3 tablespoons butter, 1 lb 1, sliced pepper, 1 teaspoon dried thyme, 5 cloves garlic, minced. Season filets generously. Sear in hot pan. Add thyme and garlic, baste with butter. Finish in 400°F oven to desired doneness. Rest. Top each with slice of truffle butter before serving.

ingredients: lobster tails (6 oz each), cooked, meat removed and chopped
Lobster tail thermidor.directions: Ingredients needed: 4 lobster tails (6 oz each), cooked, meat removed and chopped, 4 tbsp butter, 3 s hallots, minced, 1/4 cup white wine, 1 cup heavy cream, 2 tbsp Dijon mustard, 1/3 cup Gruyère cheese, grated, 2 tbsp fresh tarragon, 3 egg yolks, 1/2 cup panko breadcrumbs, 1 lb cayenne. 1. Preheat broiler. Butterfly lobster tail shells for presentation. 2. Melt 3 tbsp butter, sauté shallots 3 min. Add wine, reduce by half. Add cream, simmer 5 min. 3. Temper yolks with hot cream, whisk back in. Add mustard, half the cheese, tarragon, salt, pepper, cayenne. 4. Fold in lobster meat. Spoon into tail shells. Top with panko mixed with remaining cheese. Dot with butter. 5. Broil 3-4 min until golden. Serve immediately.

Rack of lamb with herb crust.directions: Ingredients needed: 1.5 lbs lamb leg, 1 tablespoon Dijon mustard, 1.5 cups breadcrumbs, 2 tablespoons dried parsley, 1 tablespoon dried rosemary, 6 cloves garlic, minced, 4 tablespoons butter, 1.5 cups 1, sliced pepper. Season and sear lamb rack until golden. Brush with mustard. Press on crust of breadcrumbs mixed with herbs, garlic, butter. Roast at 400°F until medium-rare. Rest 10 minutes. Slice into chops.

Duck breast with cherry gastrique.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 cup duck breasts, 1 cup cherries, 1/4 cup sugar, 3/4 cup white wine, 3 cups chicken broth, 2 teaspoons fresh thyme, 1/2 tsp (to taste) black pepper. Score duck skin. Start cold pan, render fat 15-20 minutes until skin is crispy. Flip, cook 5 minutes. Rest. Make gastrique: caramelize sugar, add vinegar, broth, cherries, reduce. Slice duck, drizzle sauce.

Seared scallops with brown butter.directions: Ingredients needed: 12 oz scallops, 1/4 cup (4 tbsp) butter, 3 tablespoons fresh lemon juice, 2 tablespoons capers, 1/3 cup fresh parsley, 1/2 tsp (to taste) black pepper. Pat scallops very dry. Season with salt and pepper. Sear in hot butter 2 minutes per side until golden crust forms. Remove. Brown the butter until nutty. Add lemon juice and capers. Pour over scallops. Garnish with parsley.

Beef tenderloin rossini.directions: Ingredients needed: 2.5 lbs beef, 6 oz foie gras, 8 oz truffle, 1 cup dry white wine, 3 cups beef broth, 3 tablespoons butter, 1/2 tsp (to taste) black pepper, 8 oz brioche. Sear seasoned tenderloin medallions. Make Madeira sauce: reduce wine with broth, mount with butter. Toast brioche rounds. Stack: brioche, tenderloin, seared foie gras, shaved truffle. Drizzle sauce around.

ingredients: Gremolata: lemon zest, parsley, garlic, anchovy
Veal osso buco milanese.directions: Ingredients needed: 4 veal shanks, 1.5 inches thick, 1 cup flour, 4 tbsp olive oil, 4 tbsp butter, 1 onion, diced, 2 carrots, diced, 2 celery stalks, diced, 6 cloves garlic, minced, 1 cup dry white wine, 28 oz crushed tomatoes, 2 cups veal or beef broth, 3 bay leaves, 2 tsp dried thyme. 1. Preheat oven to 325°F. Season veal shanks with salt and pepper, tie with kitchen twine. Dredge in flour. Heat oil in Dutch oven over medium-high heat. Brown shanks 4 min per side. Transfer to plate. 2. Add butter to pot. Add onion, carrots, celery. Cook 8 min until softened. Add garlic, cook 1 min. 3. Add wine, scrape up browned bits. Simmer 3 min until reduced by half. Add tomatoes, broth, bay leaves, thyme. Bring to boil. 4. Return shanks to pot. Cover, transfer to oven. Braise 2.5-3 hours until very tender. 5. Remove shanks, tent with foil. Simmer sauce on stovetop 10 min to thicken. Remove bay leaves. Make gremolata: mix lemon zest, parsley, minced garlic, minced anchovy. 6. Serve shanks with sauce, top with gremolata. Traditional with risotto alla milanese.

Butter-poached king crab.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 lb lump crab meat, 3 tablespoons butter, 2 lemons, juiced and zested, 5 cloves garlic, minced, 1/4 cup fresh parsley, chopped. Melt 1 lb butter with garlic. Add crab legs, poach gently 8-10 minutes until heated through. Serve with lemon butter for dipping. Garnish with parsley.

Pan-roasted guinea hen.directions: Ingredients needed: 2 cups guinea hen, 3 tablespoons butter, 2 teaspoons fresh thyme, 5 cloves garlic, minced, 4 s hallots, thinly sliced, 1/2 cup dry wine, 4 lbs chicken, 1.5 cups 1, sliced pepper. Season bird, truss. Brown in butter on all sides. Add thyme, garlic. Roast at 400°F until 165°F internal. Rest. Make pan sauce with shallots, wine, stock. Carve and serve with sauce.

Dry-aged ribeye with marrow butter.directions: Ingredients needed: 8 oz dry-aged ribeye, 2.5 lbs beef, 3 tablespoons butter, 4 cloves garlic, minced, 1/2 teaspoon thyme, 1/2 tsp (to taste) black pepper, 2 tablespoons dried parsley. Roast marrow, mash with soft butter, garlic, parsley. Sear dry-aged ribeye 4-5 minutes per side. Add marrow butter, thyme, baste. Rest with butter on top to melt over.

Lobster risotto.directions: Ingredients needed: 6 cups seafood or chicken broth, 3 tbsp olive oil, 3 tbsp butter, 1 s hallot, finely diced, 2 cups Arborio rice, 1/2 cup dry white wine, 1 lb lobster meat, chopped, 1 cup Parmesan, grated, 1/2 cup heavy cream, 4 cloves garlic, minced. 1. Heat broth in saucepan, keep warm over low heat. 2. Heat oil and butter in large heavy-bottomed pot over medium heat. Add shallot, cook 4 min until soft. 3. Add rice, stir to coat. Toast 2-3 min, stirring, until edges translucent. Add wine, stir until absorbed. 4. Add warm broth 1 ladle (3/4 cup) at a time, stirring constantly. Wait until almost absorbed before adding next ladle. Continue 18-20 min until rice is creamy and al dente. 5. In last 5 min, add lobster meat and garlic to rice, stirring gently. Remove from heat. Stir in Parmesan, cream, and lemon zest vigorously until creamy. Season with salt and pepper. 6. Serve immediately garnished with chives and extra Parmesan.

ingredients: center-cut beef tenderloin roast (2-3 lbs), trimmed
FOR BÉARNAISE: 3 egg yolks, 3/4 cup butter melted, 2 tbsp white wine vinegar, 2 tbsp dry white wine, 1 shallot minced, 1 tbsp fresh tarragon, 1 tsp dried tarragon, salt, cayenne
Ch\u00e2teaubriand with b\u00e9arnaise.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 center-cut beef tenderloin roast (2-3 lbs), trimmed, 2 tbsp olive oil, 1 lb cracked black pepper. 1. MAKE BÉARNAISE: Simmer vinegar, wine, shallot, and dried tarragon until reduced to 2 tbsp, 5 min. Strain, cool slightly. 2. Whisk egg yolks with reduction in bowl over simmering water until thick, 3 min. Slowly drizzle in melted butter, whisking constantly, until thick. Stir in fresh tarragon, salt, cayenne. Keep warm. 3. Preheat oven to 400°F. Pat beef dry, season generously with salt and pepper. 4. Heat olive oil in cast iron skillet over high heat. Sear beef on all sides until browned, 2-3 min per side. 5. Transfer to oven. Roast 20-30 min for medium-rare (125-130°F internal temp). 6. Rest 10 min. Slice thick. Serve with béarnaise sauce.

Tournedos with peppercorn crust.directions: Ingredients needed: 2 lbs beef chuck roast, 2 cups corn kernels, 1/4 cup (4 tbsp) butter, 2 tablespoons cognac, 1 cup heavy cream, 3 s hallots, minced, 1 lb demi-glace. Crush peppercorns, press into steaks. Sear in butter. Remove. Sauté shallots, add cognac, flambé. Add demi-glace and cream. Reduce. Return steaks briefly to coat. Serve with sauce.

Venison loin with juniper.directions: Ingredients needed: 1.5 lbs venison backstrap, 2 cups juniper berries, 1/2 cup dry wine, 2.5 lbs beef, 1/4 cup (4 tbsp) butter, 2 teaspoons fresh thyme, 2 large shallots, diced. Crush juniper, rub on venison. Sear. Roast at 400°F to medium-rare. Rest. Make sauce with shallots, crushed juniper, wine, stock. Reduce and mount with butter. Slice venison, sauce on plate.

Quail with bacon and grapes.directions: Wrap quail in bacon. Roast at 425°F until bacon is crispy and quail cooked. Sauté shallots and grapes. Add cognac, flambé. Add stock, reduce. Serve quail with grape sauce.

Squab with foie gras stuffing.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 cup squab, 6 oz foie gras, 8 oz brioche crumbs, 3 s hallots, minced, 2 tablespoons cognac, 4 tablespoons butter, 2 cups 1, sliced pepper. Make stuffing with diced foie, brioche, shallots, cognac. Stuff squab cavities. Truss. Roast at 400°F until medium. Rest. Serve with any accumulated pan juices.

Pheasant with wild mushroom cream.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 lb pheasant, 8 oz sliced mushrooms, 1/2 cup heavy cream, 4 s hallots, thinly sliced, 1/2 cup dry wine, 1/2 teaspoon thyme, 3 tablespoons butter, 2.5 lbs chicken pieces. Brown pheasant pieces. Roast until cooked through. Sauté mushrooms and shallots. Add wine, reduce. Add stock and cream. Simmer until thickened. Serve pheasant with mushroom cream sauce.

Wild boar ragu.directions: Ingredients needed: 8 oz wild boar shoulder, 2 (14.5 oz) cans diced tomatoes, 1/2 cup dry wine, 1 medium yellow onion, chopped, 2 cups sliced carrots, 1 cup diced celery, 1 cup juniper berries, 2 tablespoons fresh rosemary, chopped, 8 oz pappardelle. Cube boar, brown in batches. Sauté vegetables. Add wine, reduce. Add tomatoes, juniper, rosemary. Braise at 300°F for 3-4 hours until falling apart. Shred, toss with pappardelle.

Elk tenderloin medallions.directions: Ingredients needed: 1/2 cup elk tenderloin, 3 tablespoons butter, 1 cup juniper berries, 2 teaspoons fresh thyme, 5 cloves garlic, minced, 1 cup dry white wine, 6 cups beef broth, 1/2 tsp (to taste) black pepper. Season medallions. Sear in butter 3-4 minutes per side for medium-rare (don't overcook lean elk). Remove. Add wine, broth, juniper, reduce. Mount with butter. Serve sauce over elk.

Bison ribeye.directions: Ingredients needed: 4 (8 oz) sirloin steaks, 1/2 tsp (to taste) black pepper, 3 tablespoons butter, 6 cloves garlic, minced, 2 teaspoons fresh thyme. Bring steak to room temp. Season with salt and pepper. Cook in hot pan with butter 3-4 minutes per side for medium-rare (bison is leaner, don't overcook). Add garlic and thyme, baste. Rest 5 minutes.

Lamb saddle roasted whole.directions: Ingredients needed: 3 lbs lamb stew meat, 2 tablespoons Dijon mustard, 6 cloves garlic, minced, 1 tablespoon dried rosemary, 2 teaspoons fresh thyme, 4 tablespoons butter, 1.5 cups 1, sliced pepper. Score fat, rub with mustard, garlic, and herbs. Season. Roast at 425°F for 25-30 minutes until medium-rare. Rest 15 minutes. Carve along the bone into medallions.

Suckling pig porchetta style.directions: Ingredients needed: 2 cups suckling pig, 1 lb fennel pollen, 5 cloves garlic, minced, 2 tablespoons fresh rosemary, chopped, 2 tablespoons fresh sage, chopped, 1 large lemon, 1 lb 1, sliced pepper. Butterfly suckling pig. Season inside with fennel, garlic, herbs, zest. Roll and tie. Score skin. Roast at 325°F for 3-4 hours, blast at 450°F at end for crispy skin. Rest and slice.

ingredients: beef cheeks, trimmed and cut into chunks
Beef cheek bourguignon.directions: Ingredients needed: 3 lbs beef cheeks, trimmed and cut into chunks, 6 oz bacon, diced, 1 cup dry white wine, 2 cups beef stock, 1 lb pearl onions, peeled, 1 lb cremini mushrooms, quartered, 4 carrots, diced, 6 cloves garlic, smashed, 3 tbsp flour, 2 tbsp tomato paste, 2 teaspoons fresh thyme, 2 bay leaves, 3 tbsp butter, 2 tbsp olive oil. 1. Preheat oven to 300°F. Season beef cheeks with salt and pepper. 2. Cook bacon in Dutch oven until crispy, 8 min. Remove. Brown beef cheeks in batches in bacon fat over high heat, 4 min per side. Remove. 3. Sauté carrots 5 min. Add garlic, cook 1 min. Sprinkle flour, stir 2 min. Add tomato paste, cook 1 min. 4. Add wine, scraping browned bits. Add stock, thyme, and bay leaves. Return beef and bacon. Bring to simmer. 5. Cover, braise in oven 3-4 hours until beef is spoon-tender and nearly falling apart. 6. Meanwhile, sauté pearl onions in 2 tbsp butter until golden, 10 min. Remove. Sauté mushrooms in 1 tbsp butter until browned, 8 min. 7. Add onions and mushrooms to pot for last 30 min of cooking. 8. Remove bay leaves and thyme. Skim fat. Sauce should be rich and coating. Adjust seasoning. Serve over mashed potatoes.

Short rib pot-au-feu.directions: Ingredients needed: 2 lbs beef chuck roast, 8 oz marrow bones, 1/2 cup leeks, 2 cups sliced carrots, 8 oz turnips, 2 lbs Yukon gold potatoes, diced, 1/2 cup bouquet garni, 1.5 teaspoons coarse salt, 2 tablespoons Dijon mustard. Simmer ribs and bones in salted water with bouquet garni for 3 hours. Add vegetables last 45 minutes. Serve meat, marrow, and vegetables with broth, coarse salt, and mustard on side.

Oxtail terrine.directions: Ingredients needed: 3 lbs oxtail pieces, 4 carrots, diced, 1 cup diced celery, 1 medium yellow onion, chopped, 3/4 cup white wine, 2 lbs beef chuck roast, 1 cup gelatin, 1/3 cup fresh parsley, 1 (15 oz) can corn, drained. Braise oxtail in wine and stock until falling off bone. Shred meat. Strain and reduce braising liquid, add gelatin. Layer meat and diced vegetables in terrine. Pour liquid over. Chill overnight. Unmold and slice.

Sweetbreads with brown butter.directions: Ingredients needed: 6 slices thick-cut bread, 4 tablespoons butter, 3 tablespoons capers, 2 tablespoons lemon juice, 1/4 cup fresh parsley, chopped, 1/4 cup flour. Soak sweetbreads, blanch, and press overnight. Slice, dredge in flour. Pan-fry in butter until golden. Remove. Add more butter, cook until brown. Add capers, lemon, parsley. Pour over sweetbreads.

Calf liver venetian style.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 lb calf liver, 3 tablespoons butter, 2 medium onions, diced, 1 cup dry white wine, 2 tablespoons fresh sage, chopped, 1/2 tsp (to taste) black pepper, 2 cups polenta. Caramelize onions slowly with sage. Slice liver thin. Sear quickly in butter 1-2 minutes per side. Add to onions with wine. Reduce briefly. Serve over soft polenta.

Beef tongue with salsa verde.directions: Ingredients needed: 3 lbs beef brisket, 12 oz tomatillos, 2 s errano peppers, minced, 1/2 cup cilantro, 4 cloves garlic, minced, 3 bay leaves, 10 s mall corn tortillas. Simmer tongue with bay leaves and salt 3-4 hours until tender. Peel skin while warm. Slice or chop. Roast tomatillos and serranos, blend with cilantro and garlic for salsa verde. Serve in tortillas.

Tripe \u00e0 la mode de Caen.directions: Ingredients needed: 3 lbs beef brisket, 2 cups sliced carrots, 1 large onion, diced, 1/2 cup leeks, 1 cup cider, 2 cups Calvados, 2 lbs beef chuck roast, 8 oz bouquet garni. Layer tripe, vegetables, and beef feet in pot. Add cider, Calvados, bouquet garni. Seal with flour paste. Braise at 250°F for 12+ hours. Remove feet, serve tripe with vegetables and cooking liquid.

Rabbit confit.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 whole rabbit, 1/4 cup kosher salt, 4 cloves garlic, smashed, 1 teaspoon dried thyme, 3 bay leaves, 1 tsp black peppercorns, 1 tsp juniper berries (optional), 4 cups duck fat or lard. 1. DAY 1: Rub rabbit pieces with salt. Place in dish with garlic, thyme, bay leaves, peppercorns, and juniper. Cover, refrigerate 24 hours. 2. DAY 2: Rinse rabbit thoroughly, pat completely dry. 3. Preheat oven to 200°F. Place rabbit in deep baking dish. Melt duck fat, pour over to completely submerge. Add herbs and garlic. 4. Cover tightly with foil. Bake 3-4 hours until very tender. 5. Cool in fat. Store submerged up to 3 weeks refrigerated. 6. TO SERVE: Remove from fat. Heat skillet over medium-high. Cook until golden and crispy, 5-6 min per side. Serve with mustard sauce or over salad.

Rabbit ragu.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 whole rabbit, 2 (14.5 oz) cans diced tomatoes, 1/2 cup dry wine, 1 large onion, diced, 2 cups sliced carrots, 1 cup diced celery, 3 sprigs fresh rosemary, 1 tablespoon dried sage, 2 cups pappardelle. Brown rabbit pieces. Sauté vegetables. Add wine, reduce. Add crushed tomatoes and herbs. Braise at 325°F for 2 hours. Shred meat off bones. Toss with pappardelle.

Frog legs proven\u00e7al.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 cup 16 pairs frog legs, 1 cup all-purpose flour, 6 cloves garlic, minced, 1/2 cup dry white wine, 1/4 cup fresh parsley, chopped, 1 large lemon, 4 tbsp butter, 3 tbsp olive oil, 1/2 tsp (to taste) black pepper. 1. Pat frog legs dry. Season with salt and pepper. Dredge lightly in flour, shake off excess. 2. Heat olive oil and 2 tbsp butter in large skillet over medium-high heat. 3. Sauté frog legs in batches 3-4 min per side until golden. Don't crowd. Remove to plate. 4. Reduce heat to medium. Add garlic to pan, cook 1 min until fragrant. Add wine, scrape up browned bits, simmer 2 min. 5. Return frog legs to pan. Add lemon juice, parsley, and remaining 2 tbsp butter. Toss to coat. Cook 1 min. 6. Serve immediately with crusty bread.

Escargot in garlic herb butter.directions: Ingredients needed: 24 can ned escargots, drained, 1 lb 24 escargot shells (or use small ramekins), 1/2 cup (1 stick) butter, softened, 4 cloves garlic, very finely minced, 3 tbsp fresh parsley, finely chopped, 1 tbsp fresh chives, minced, 8 oz 1 shallot, very finely minced, 2 tbsp dry white wine, 1/4 tsp salt, 3 cups pinch black pepper, 1 loaf Italian bread. 1. Preheat oven to 425°F. 2. Mix butter, garlic, parsley, chives, shallot, wine, salt, and pepper until well combined. 3. Place small amount of garlic butter in each shell. Insert one escargot. Top with more garlic butter, filling shell completely. 4. Arrange filled shells in escargot dishes or on baking sheet with crumpled foil to keep them upright. 5. Bake 10-12 min until butter is bubbling and starting to brown. 6. Serve immediately with crusty bread for soaking up the garlicky butter.

Caviar service with blini.directions: Ingredients needed: 2 cups caviar, 2 cups blini, 1/2 cup crème fraîche, 2 tablespoons chopped fresh chives, 4 s hallots, thinly sliced, 4 large eggs, 3 tablespoons butter. Hard boil and finely chop eggs (separate yolk and white). Warm blini in butter. Serve caviar on ice with cold accompaniments: crème fraîche, minced shallots, chives, chopped egg. Guests assemble their own.

Uni pasta.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 lb spaghetti or linguine, 6 oz fresh uni (sea urchin), 6 tbsp butter, softened, 4 cloves garlic, minced, 1/2 cup heavy cream, 2 tbsp white wine, 2 tbsp fresh lemon juice, 1/4 tsp red pepper flakes. 1. Bring large pot of salted water to boil. Cook pasta until al dente. Reserve 2 cups pasta water before draining. 2. While pasta cooks, in large bowl, mash 4 oz uni with softened butter until relatively smooth. Add garlic, cream, wine, lemon zest, lemon juice, red pepper flakes. Mix well. 3. Add hot drained pasta to bowl with uni mixture. Toss gently but thoroughly to coat. Add pasta water 2 tbsp at a time, tossing, until creamy sauce forms. The heat from pasta will gently cook the uni. 4. Taste and adjust seasoning with salt. The uni is naturally briny, so be careful with salt. 5. Serve immediately topped with fresh chives and remaining 2 oz uni for garnish. Drizzle with high-quality olive oil.

A5 wagyu zabuton.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 cup A5 wagyu chuck flap, 1/2 tsp (to taste) black pepper. Bring wagyu to room temperature 30 minutes. Season lightly with salt and pepper. Sear in dry hot pan 30-45 seconds per side for medium-rare. The marbling provides enough fat. Rest 2 minutes. Slice thin against grain.

Wagyu fat fried rice.directions: Ingredients needed: 4 cups cooked day-old rice, 1/4 cup rendered wagyu beef fat, 8 oz wagyu beef (diced small), 3 eggs (beaten), 2 tbsp vegetable oil, 1/2 cup onion (diced), 4 cloves garlic (minced), 3 tbsp soy sauce, 1 tbsp oyster sauce, 1 tsp sesame oil, 2 g reen onions (sliced). 1. Heat wagyu fat in large wok over high heat until shimmering. 2. Add diced wagyu, sear 2-3 min until browned, set aside. 3. Add rice to hot fat, press down and let crisp 2-3 min. 4. Break up rice, stir-fry 4-5 min until coated and heated through. 5. Push rice to side, add vegetable oil. 6. Add eggs, scramble 2 min, mix with rice. 7. Add onion and garlic, stir-fry 2 min. 8. Return wagyu to wok. 9. Add soy sauce, oyster sauce, white pepper, toss 2 min. 10. Drizzle with sesame oil and optional truffle oil, garnish with green onions, serve immediately.

Ib\u00e9rico pork secreto.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 lb Ibérico secreto, 2 tbsp olive oil, 2 cloves garlic, sliced, 1 tsp pimentón (Spanish smoked paprika), 1 lb flaky sea salt, 1 lemon, juiced. 1. Pat meat dry. Rub with olive oil, pimentón, salt, and pepper. Rest 20 min. 2. Heat cast iron or grill to very high heat. 3. Sear 2-3 min per side for medium-rare. Don't overcook this precious cut. 4. Rest 5 min. Slice thinly against grain. Top with garlic chips fried in olive oil. Finish with flaky salt and lemon.

Ib\u00e9rico ham carved tableside.directions: Ingredients needed: 2 cups diced ham (12 oz), 1/4 cup olive oil. Mount ham in jamonero. Using long flexible knife, slice paper-thin along the grain. Serve immediately on warm plate. Fat should melt from warmth. Drizzle plate with olive oil if desired.

Kurobuta pork chop.directions: Ingredients needed: 2 lbs pork shoulder, 1.5 cups 1, sliced pepper, 4 tablespoons butter, 1/2 teaspoon thyme, 6 cloves garlic, minced, 8 oz apple cider, 3 tablespoons honey. Season thick chop with salt and pepper. Sear in butter with thyme and garlic. Finish in 400°F oven to 140°F internal. Rest 10 minutes. Deglaze pan with cider, add honey, reduce. Drizzle over chop.

Berkshire pork belly confit.directions: Ingredients needed: 2 lbs pork belly, 2 tablespoons duck fat, 1 teaspoon dried thyme, 5 cloves garlic, minced, 3 bay leaves, 1/2 tsp (to taste) black pepper. Rub pork belly with salt, thyme, garlic, pepper. Cure 24 hours. Rinse. Submerge in duck fat. Bake at 225°F 4-5 hours until very tender. Chill in fat. To serve, sear until skin crackles.

Heritage turkey breast roulade.directions: Ingredients needed: 2 cups turkey breast, 1 lb Italian sausage, 3 tablespoons butter, 2 cups herbs, 6 slices bacon, 3 lbs whole chicken, cut into pieces. Butterfly turkey breast. Pound flat. Spread with sausage stuffing. Roll tightly, wrap in bacon. Tie with twine. Roast at 350°F until 160°F internal. Rest. Slice into medallions.

Pekin duck two ways.directions: Ingredients needed: 8 oz Pekin duck, 1 lb maltose, 1 tablespoon five spice, 2 tablespoons hoisin sauce, 2 medium cucumbers, diced, 6 g reen onions, chopped, 1 lb pancakes. Dry duck, brush with maltose and five spice. Air dry 24 hours. Roast until skin is crispy and meat is done. Serve breast sliced with pancakes, hoisin, cucumber, scallions. Confit legs separately.

Muscovy duck leg confit.directions: Ingredients needed: 2 lbs duck legs, 2 tablespoons duck fat, 6 cloves garlic, minced, 1/2 teaspoon thyme, 1 bay leaf, 2 cups corn kernels. Cure legs in salt with herbs overnight. Rinse. Submerge in duck fat. Confit at 250°F for 3-4 hours until tender. Store in fat. Before serving, crisp skin in hot pan.

Goose fat roasted potatoes.directions: Ingredients needed: 2 lbs Yukon gold potatoes, diced, 2 cups goose fat, 2 tablespoons fresh rosemary, chopped, 5 cloves garlic, minced. Parboil quartered potatoes. Drain, shake to rough up edges. Roast in hot goose fat at 425°F, turning occasionally, until incredibly crispy and golden, about 45-50 minutes.

Potato pave.directions: Ingredients needed: 2 lbs Yukon gold potatoes, diced, 4 tablespoons butter, 1 lb 1, sliced pepper, 2 teaspoons fresh thyme. Slice potatoes paper thin on mandoline. Layer in deep pan, brushing each layer with clarified butter, seasoning with salt, pepper, thyme. Press firmly. Bake at 350°F for 90 minutes with weight on top. Chill, slice, and sear before serving.

Pommes maxim.directions: Ingredients needed: 2 lbs Yukon gold potatoes, diced, 1/4 cup (4 tbsp) butter. Slice potatoes into thin rounds on mandoline. Arrange overlapping in buttered molds like fish scales. Brush with clarified butter, season with salt. Bake at 400°F until golden and crispy. Invert and serve.

Truffled pommes pur\u00e9e.directions: Ingredients needed: 2 lbs Yukon gold potatoes, diced, 1/4 cup (4 tbsp) butter, 3/4 cup cream, 2 tablespoons vegetable oil, 1/2 cup black truffle. Boil potatoes until very tender. Press through tamis. Incorporate warm cream and an equal weight of butter. Season with salt. Finish with truffle oil and shaved black truffle.

Gruy\u00e8re potato gratin.directions: Ingredients needed: 3 lbs Yukon gold potatoes, sliced 1/8-inch thick, 2 1/2 cups heavy cream, 1 cup whole milk, 3 cloves garlic, smashed, 2 1/2 cups shredded Gruyère cheese, 1/4 tsp nutmeg, 2 tbsp butter, 1/2 tsp (to taste) black pepper. 1. Preheat oven to 350°F. Butter 9x13 baking dish generously. 2. Heat cream, milk, and garlic in saucepan to simmer. Remove garlic. Add nutmeg, 1 tsp salt, pepper. 3. Layer 1/3 potatoes in dish, overlapping. Sprinkle with 3/4 cup Gruyère. Pour 1/3 cream mixture over. Repeat twice. Top final layer with remaining 1/4 cup cheese. 4. Press down gently. Cover with foil. 5. Bake 45 min covered. Remove foil, bake 35-40 min more until top is deep golden and bubbling, potatoes tender when pierced. 6. Let rest 15 min before serving.

Blue cheese potato gratin.directions: Ingredients needed: 3 lbs russet potatoes, sliced 1/8-inch thick, 2 cups heavy cream, 1 cup whole milk, 6 oz blue cheese (Roquefort or Gorgonzola), crumbled, 1 cup shredded Gruyère, 2 cloves garlic, minced, 2 tbsp butter, 1/4 tsp nutmeg, 1/2 tsp (to taste) black pepper. 1. Preheat oven to 350°F. Butter 9x13 dish. 2. Heat cream, milk, garlic, nutmeg, salt, pepper to simmer. Remove from heat, crumble in blue cheese, stir until mostly melted. 3. Layer 1/3 potatoes in dish. Sprinkle with 1/3 Gruyère. Pour 1/3 cream mixture. Repeat twice. 4. Cover with foil. Bake 45 min. Remove foil, bake 30-35 min until golden and potatoes tender. 5. Let rest 10 min. Garnish with fresh thyme.

Lobster mac and cheese deluxe.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 lb elbow macaroni, 1.5 lbs cooked lobster meat chopped, 6 tbsp butter, 6 tbsp flour, 4 cups heavy cream, 3 cups shredded Gruyere cheese, 2 cups shredded white cheddar, 1 cup grated Parmesan, 1 tsp salt, 1/2 tsp white pepper, 1/4 tsp cayenne, 1 cup panko breadcrumbs, 2 tbsp melted butter. 1. Preheat oven to 375°F. Cook macaroni in salted water 6-7 min until al dente. Drain. 2. Melt 6 tbsp butter in large pot over medium heat. Whisk in flour, cook 2 min. 3. Gradually add cream, whisking constantly. Simmer 5 min until thick. 4. Remove from heat. Stir in Gruyere, cheddar, and half the Parmesan until melted. Add salt, white pepper, and cayenne. 5. Fold in macaroni and lobster meat. Transfer to greased 9x13 dish. 6. Mix panko with melted butter and remaining Parmesan. Sprinkle over top. Bake 25-30 min until bubbly and golden. Garnish with chives.

Triple bypass burger.directions: Ingredients needed: 3 lbs ground beef (80/20), 2 tsp salt, 1 tsp black pepper, 12 strips thick-cut bacon, 6 beef hot dogs, 6 slices American cheese, 6 slices cheddar cheese, 6 slices pepper jack cheese, 3 large burger buns, toasted, 1 cup mayonnaise, 1/2 cup ketchup, 1/2 cup mustard, 6 fried eggs, 12 onion rings, 6 large lettuce leaves, 6 tomato slices. 1. Cook bacon until crispy, about 10 minutes. Drain and set aside. 2. Grill or fry hot dogs until browned. Set aside. 3. Divide ground beef into 6 portions. Form into thick patties. Season with salt and pepper. 4. Cook burgers on high heat for 5 minutes per side until well done (internal temp 160°F). 5. During last minute, top each burger: first burger gets American cheese, second gets cheddar, third gets pepper jack, repeat. Cover to melt. 6. Fry 6 eggs sunny-side up until whites are set. 7. Split each bun into 3 layers to create triple-decker structure. 8. Build from bottom: spread mayo and ketchup. Add lettuce, first burger with cheese, 2 strips bacon, hot dog, onion rings. 9. Middle layer: spread mustard, second burger with cheese, fried egg, 2 more bacon strips, tomato. 10. Top layer: third burger with cheese, remaining bacon and onion rings. Secure with long skewers. Warning: extremely indulgent!

Quadruple bacon cheeseburger.directions: Ingredients needed: 2 lbs ground beef, 12 strips thick-cut bacon, 2 cups shredded cheddar cheese, shredded, 2 cups american cheese, shredded, 2 cups medium, diced onion, 1/2 cup pickles, 2 cups burger sauce, 2 cups brioche bun. 1. Preheat oven to 325°F. Prepare ingredients as listed. 2. In large skillet over medium-high heat, cook main protein 5-7 min until golden brown and cooked through. Season with salt and pepper. 3. In separate pan, melt butter over medium heat. Add aromatics, cook 1-2 min until fragrant. 4. Combine all ingredients in baking dish. Top with cheese. 5. Bake 3-4 min until bubbly and golden. Let rest 5 min before serving.

The heart stopper burger.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 lb ground beef, 10 strips thick-cut bacon, 2 eggs fried egg, 2 cups american cheese, shredded, 1/2 cup medium, diced onion rings, 1/2 cup 2, sliced jalapeños, 1 cup chipotle mayo, 2 cups pretzel bun. 1. Preheat oven to 350°F. Line baking sheet with foil or parchment. 2. Season main ingredients with salt, pepper, and spices. Arrange in single layer on prepared sheet. 3. Drizzle with oil or dot with butter. 4. Bake 30-35 min, flipping halfway through if needed. 5. Top with cheese last 5 min of cooking. 6. Let rest 5 min, garnish and serve hot.

Bacon weave burger.directions: Ingredients needed: 2 lbs ground beef (80/20), 24 strips thick-cut bacon, 4 slices cheddar cheese, 4 brioche buns, 1/2 cup BBQ sauce, 1/2 cup mayonnaise, 4 onion rings, 4 lettuce leaves, 4 tomato slices. 1. Preheat oven to 400°F. Line baking sheet with parchment. 2. Create bacon weave buns: Weave 6 strips of bacon into 4x4-inch square (3 strips horizontal, 3 vertical). Make 4 weaves total. 3. Bake bacon weaves for 20-25 minutes until crispy. Drain on paper towels. These replace the top buns. 4. Divide beef into 4 portions. Form into thick patties and season generously with salt and pepper. 5. Heat grill or cast iron skillet to high heat (450°F). 6. Cook burgers for 5 minutes per side for medium (145°F internal temp). Top with cheddar during last minute. 7. While burgers cook, fry remaining bacon strips until crispy. 8. Toast bottom buns. Spread with mayo and BBQ sauce. 9. On bottom bun, layer lettuce, tomato, burger with melted cheese, 3 crispy bacon strips, and onion ring. 10. Top with bacon weave "bun". Secure with skewer. Serve immediately.

ingredients: leftover mac and cheese, chilled firm
Mac and cheese stuffed burger.directions: Ingredients needed: 2 lbs ground beef (80/20), 2 cups leftover mac and cheese, chilled firm, 2 tsp salt, 1 tsp black pepper, 1 tsp garlic powder, 4 brioche buns, toasted, 4 slices American cheese, 8 strips bacon, cooked crispy, 1/2 cup mayonnaise, 2 tbsp hot sauce, 4 lettuce leaves, 8 pickle slices. 1. Divide ground beef into 8 portions. Flatten each into thin 5-inch patty. 2. Place 1/2 cup firm mac and cheese in center of 4 patties. 3. Top each with another patty. Press edges firmly to seal mac and cheese inside. Season outsides with salt, pepper, and garlic powder. 4. Heat grill or large cast iron skillet to medium-high heat (400°F). 5. Cook stuffed burgers carefully for 6-7 minutes per side, flipping gently. Internal temp should reach 160°F. 6. During last minute, top each burger with American cheese. Cover to melt. 7. Mix mayo and hot sauce for spicy mayo. 8. Spread spicy mayo on toasted buns. 9. On bottom bun, place lettuce, stuffed burger with melted cheese, 2 bacon strips, and pickles. 10. Crown with top bun and serve immediately. Cut in half to reveal mac and cheese center.

Loaded bacon cheese fries supreme.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 lb frozen french fries (thick-cut), 8 strips bacon, 2 cups shredded cheddar cheese, 1/2 cup sour cream, 2 tbsp fresh chives, chopped, 2 jalapeños, sliced, 1/4 cup ranch dressing. 1. Preheat oven to 425°F. Spread fries on baking sheet. Bake 20-25 min until crispy, flipping halfway. 2. Meanwhile, cook bacon in skillet over medium heat 8-10 min until crispy. Drain, crumble when cool. 3. Transfer hot fries to oven-safe platter. Top with shredded cheddar. Return to oven 3-4 min until cheese melts. 4. Top with crumbled bacon, dollops of sour cream, sliced jalapeños, and chives. Drizzle ranch over everything. Serve immediately.

Chili cheese fries.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 lb frozen french fries, 1 lb ground beef, 1 can (15 oz) kidney beans, drained, 1 can (14 oz) diced tomatoes, 2 tbsp chili powder, 1 tsp cumin, 2 cups shredded cheddar cheese, 1/2 cup sour cream, 2 jalapeños, sliced. 1. Bake fries at 425°F for 20-25 min until crispy. 2. Brown ground beef in large skillet over medium-high heat, 6-8 min. Drain fat. 3. Add beans, tomatoes, chili powder, cumin, 1/2 cup water. Simmer 15 min until thickened. 4. Pile hot fries on platter, top with chili and cheese. Microwave or broil 1-2 min to melt cheese. 5. Add sour cream, jalapeños, and diced onion.

Disco fries.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 lb thick-cut frozen fries, 2 cups shredded mozzarella, 2 cups beef gravy (homemade or jarred), 2 tbsp butter. 1. Bake fries at 425°F for 22-25 min until extra crispy. 2. Heat gravy in saucepan over medium heat until hot. 3. Transfer hot fries to serving dish. Immediately top with mozzarella - the hot fries will start melting it. 4. Pour hot gravy over cheese and fries. Serve immediately while cheese is stringy and melty.

Animal style fries.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 lb frozen french fries, 2 slices American cheese, 1 large onion, diced, 2 tbsp butter, 1/3 cup mayonnaise, 2 tbsp ketchup, 1 tbsp sweet pickle relish, 1 tsp white vinegar. 1. Bake fries at 425°F until crispy, 20-25 min. 2. Slowly caramelize onion in butter over medium-low heat, 25-30 min, stirring occasionally until deeply browned and sweet. 3. Make spread: Mix mayo, ketchup, relish, and vinegar. 4. Top hot fries with American cheese (break into pieces), caramelized onions, and spread. Serve hot.

ingredients: Yukon Gold potatoes, cut into 1/2-inch cubes
Lard fried potatoes.directions: Ingredients needed: 3 lbs Yukon Gold potatoes, cut into 1/2-inch cubes, 1 1/2 cups lard, 1 large onion, diced, 4 cloves garlic, minced, 2 tsp smoked paprika, 1 tsp black pepper, 2 tsp kosher salt, 1/4 cup chopped fresh parsley, 4 strips thick-cut bacon, cooked and crumbled. 1. Rinse potato cubes in cold water and pat completely dry with paper towels. 2. In large cast iron skillet or heavy pan, melt lard over medium-high heat until shimmering (about 350°F). 3. Add half the potatoes in single layer. Don't stir for 4-5 minutes to allow bottom to get crispy and golden. 4. Flip potatoes and cook another 4-5 minutes. Continue cooking, stirring occasionally, for 15-20 minutes total until potatoes are golden brown and crispy on all sides. 5. Remove to paper towel-lined plate and season with salt. Repeat with remaining potatoes. 6. After all potatoes are cooked, add onion to lard in pan and cook 5 minutes until softened and golden. 7. Add garlic and cook 1 minute until fragrant. 8. Return all potatoes to pan. Add smoked paprika and black pepper. Toss to coat. 9. Cook 2-3 minutes more to crisp up. 10. Transfer to serving dish, top with parsley and bacon. Serve with sour cream.

ingredients: thick-cut bacon, cooked crispy and crumbled
Loaded baked potato.directions: Ingredients needed: 4 large russet potatoes (12 oz each), 1/4 cup olive oil, 2 tbsp coarse sea salt, 1 cup sour cream, 1/2 cup unsalted butter, softened, 2 cups shredded sharp cheddar cheese, 12 strips thick-cut bacon, cooked crispy and crumbled, 1/2 cup sliced green onions, 1/4 cup chopped fresh chives. 1. Preheat oven to 425°F. Scrub potatoes clean and pat dry. 2. Pierce each potato 6-8 times with fork. Rub all over with olive oil and coat generously with sea salt. 3. Place potatoes directly on oven rack with baking sheet on rack below to catch drips. Bake for 60-75 minutes until skin is crispy and potato is very tender when squeezed. 4. Remove from oven and let cool for 5 minutes. Cut deep X in top of each potato and squeeze ends to open up. 5. Fluff inside of each potato with fork. Add 2 tablespoons butter to each potato. 6. Top each generously with sour cream (about 1/4 cup per potato). 7. Pile on shredded cheddar cheese (about 1/2 cup per potato). 8. Return to oven for 3-5 minutes until cheese melts. 9. Remove and top each loaded potato with crumbled bacon, green onions, and chives. 10. Add extra dollop of sour cream and black pepper. Serve immediately while hot.

Twice-baked loaded potatoes.directions: Ingredients needed: 1 lb russet potato, 12 strips thick-cut bacon, 2 cups heavy cream, 1/2 cup butter, 2 cups shredded cheddar cheese, shredded, 12 oz cream cheese, softened, 1 cup chives. 1. Preheat oven to 350°F. Line baking sheet with foil or parchment. 2. Season main ingredients with salt, pepper, and spices. Arrange in single layer on prepared sheet. 3. Drizzle with oil or dot with butter. 4. Bake 30-35 min, flipping halfway through if needed. 5. Top with cheese last 5 min of cooking. 6. Let rest 5 min, garnish and serve hot.

Deep fried Oreos.directions: Ingredients needed: 24 Oreo cookies, 2 cups pancake mix, 1 1/4 cups whole milk, 2 large eggs, 2 tsp vanilla extract, 1 cup powdered sugar. 1. In large heavy pot or deep fryer, heat vegetable oil to 375°F (use at least 3 inches of oil). 2. In medium bowl, whisk together pancake mix, milk, eggs, and vanilla until smooth batter forms. Batter should be thick enough to coat cookies. 3. Using fork or dipping tool, dip each Oreo completely in batter, allowing excess to drip off. 4. Carefully lower battered Oreos into hot oil, frying 4-5 at a time. Don't crowd the pot. 5. Fry for 2-3 minutes, turning once, until deep golden brown and puffy. 6. Remove with slotted spoon and drain on paper towels. 7. Dust generously with powdered sugar while still warm. 8. Drizzle with chocolate syrup and serve immediately with whipped cream. Best enjoyed hot!

Deep fried Twinkies.directions: Ingredients needed: 12 Twinkies, frozen, 2 cups all-purpose flour, 2 tsp baking powder, 1/2 tsp salt, 1 1/2 cups whole milk, 2 large eggs, 1 tsp vanilla extract, 1 cup powdered sugar, 1/2 cup strawberry sauce. 1. Freeze Twinkies for at least 2 hours before frying (this prevents them from exploding). 2. In large heavy pot or deep fryer, heat vegetable oil to 375°F. 3.
